loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda A.  esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito. Esta solicitando otro préstamo para invertirle a su negocio de papelería, ya que no cuenta con suficiente mercancía. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de su negocio, ya que su esposo el señor Fernando Ricardo Ramón quien trabaja de súper visor de una compañía de agua, con su ingreso de su empleo le ayudara con los gastas de la familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda A. is grateful for her prior loan.  She is asking for another loan to invest in her stationery store because she doesn’t have sufficient stock merchandise.

She plans to repay the loan with profits from her business since her husband, Mr. Fernando Ricardo Ramón, who works as a Supervisor at a water company, will use his salary to help her with family expenses.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is 46 years old and married to Muse who contributes to the family income. She has seven children who are all dependents. She has been  farming on her own piece of land. She has been in the business for a period of six months with an income of about KES. 5,000 per month.

Mary has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her first loan from KADET LTD. She intends to use it to buy seedlings for her farm. 

She hopes to expand her retail shop and grow drought-resistant crops in the future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda is a 54-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a vegetable garden. She lives in the municipality of Narra, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her vegetable garden business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 24,000 to purchase fertilizers and seeds for her vegetable garden.  This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Luzviminda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for her garden

loans.name: Cherry Lou

texts.en:
Cherry Lou S., from the village of Santo Niño, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon, is 22 years old, married, and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, for the past two years Cherry Lou has owned and operated a service-based business providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members, with her husband as the driver. She earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Cherry Lou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase tools needed to provide service, she is now requesting her second loan for 8000 PHP to purchase tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of the service. Cherry Lou plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools and utilities needed for the maintenance of the service

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra forma parte del banco comunal “Newen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco. 
Ella se dedica al corte y confección de ropa, desde hace 12 años. Trabaja desde su casa, ya que ahí tiene su taller con 6 máquinas de coser, además Alejandra trabaja junto a su hermana. Su clientela son colegios, consultorios y empresas, además de clientes particulares. Alejandra cuenta con la publicidad necesaria para ofrecer sus servicios, ya que tiene una página de Internet, en la cual aparecen sus costuras. Sus clientes solicitan sus servicios durante todo el año, sin embargo la temporada más baja es durante los mese de enero y febrero correspondiente a las vacaciones de verano. 
Su mercadería o insumos, los compra en una tienda de costuras y las máquinas de coser las compró en una tienda comercial. 
Con el préstamo comprará una maquina de coser (overlook), además de una orilladora.  
Su meta es comprar una maquina para bordar.
Sus sueños a nivel personal son obtener su casa propia y seguir costeando los estudios de sus hijas. De aquí las motivaciones de continuar con el negocio. 
Alejandra vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 15 y 10 años de edad. Ambas estudian en colegios particulares.
Alejandra está muy contenta y agradecida de la ayuda otorgada por Fondo esperanza, ya que con el préstamo ha podido invertir en su negocio, además asiste a las reuniones del banco comunal y participa con mucho ánimo, ya que éstas son muy gratas. Junto con esto realizó un curso de ventas, aprendizaje que ha podido incorporar en su negocio. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Alejandra is part of the “Newen” communal bank belonging to the city of Temuco. She’s been a Seamstress for 12 years.  She works at home; she has a workshop there with six sewing machines. Alejandra works alongside her sister.  Her customers are schools, doctor’s offices and firms as well as private customers.  Alejandra has adequate publicity for her services because she has a web page on the Internet where here creations appear.  Her customers request her services year round but her weakest months are January and February which correspond to summer vacation.  She buys her supplies at a sewing supplies store and she bought her sewing machines at a department store.  She will use the loan to buy an overlock sewing machine as well as an edger.  Her goal is to buy an embroidery machine.

Her dreams on a personal level are to buy a house of her own and to continue to pay for her daughters’ education.  This is where her motivation to continue in business comes from.  Alejandra lives with her husband and two daughters who are 15 and 10 years of age.  Both go to private school.

Alejandra is very happy and grateful for the help provided by Fondo Esperanza because she was able to use the loan to invest in the business.  Besides, she attends communal bank meetings and participates very actively because the meetings are very enjoyable.  Together with this she took a sales course, acquiring learning that she was able to apply to her business.

Temuco is the capital of the La Araucanía region.  The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile).  In its surroundings are a series of lakeside spas (Pucón, Villarica) and a showy native flora and fauna concentrated in nearby natural parks.   It’s worth stressing that 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous people existing in our country, lives in this region.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David M. is married and has one child. For the past four years, he has operated a music producing business, selling as retail to musicians. David faces a major challenge of competition from other music producers in the market. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and electricity bills. 

David is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which he will use to purchase software and CDs for music recording for sale. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase software and CDs for music recording

loans.name: Ou

texts.en:
The woman in the photo is Mrs. Ou, age 50. She lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns a living raising pigs. Since 2000, she has run this business, and it has provided her with income to get to her standard of living. She is married with eight children, five of whom are single and three are married already. 

Her husband helps her in raising pigs as well as catching fish. In order to earn extra income, Mrs. Ou will be using the loan to buy a second motorcycle for traveling needs because she and her family always pay for a motor taxi when they want to go out. That is why Mrs. Ou made the decision to ask for a Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy a second motorcycle for traveling needs.

loans.name: Lomas De San Pedro (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Lomas De San Pedro se reúne cada quince días en el sitio las Palmas del Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Banco Comunal que les sirve de mucho ya que con los créditos han mejorado sus pequeños negocios. Se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio, servicios, venta de comidas entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Sonia, tiene 36 años, hace varios años su esposo falleció y de esa relación tiene tres  hijos de 16, 10 y 9 años de edad, el mayor estudia en colegio y los dos menores en escuela. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta del mismo y le gusta porque en otros lugares los intereses son más altos.

Ella tiene una tienda de comestibles en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, esto le ha servido para sacar adelante a sus hijos después de la partida de su querido esposo, ahora con los créditos espera mejorar su negocio y su vida familiar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. 

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Lomas De San Pedro [The Hills of San Pedro] meets every two weeks at Las Palmas of the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich precolonial culture, its handicraft which enjoys a national and international reputation, and the famous Panama hats. 

This is a group of people who decided to get together and form this communal bank which is of such value to them, since they have used the loans to improve their small businesses. They work in various types of business such as commerce, services, and food sales among others. 

Here we meet Mrs. Sonia, 36, whose husband died some years ago. From that relationship she has three children who are 16, 10 and 9 years of age. The eldest is in high school and the two younger children in elementary school. This is her first loan with the communal bank. She is the group's president and she likes it because in other places the interest rates are higher. 

She has a grocery store in her home where she sells all kinds of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc. She works every day from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. and sometimes until later. Her children help her with the work. She has had this business for a year and it is going very well. This has allowed her to support her children since her dear husband's departure. With the loans she hopes to improve her business and her family life. 

She will use this loan to further stock her store. She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other staple items. 

Her goals are to continue on in her business and that her store would grow more and more.

loans.use:
to purchase rice, sugar, detergents, cold cuts and other staples. 

Comprar arroz, azúcar, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.

loans.name: Malibongwe Group

texts.en:
Florence Siphiwe is 45 years old and single, with 2 children who are 22 and 27 years old. She runs a clothing business in the Kwa Zulu Natal area of Empangeni in South Africa. She also takes care of her 3 grandchildren.  In the photo she is pictured raising her right arm.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells clothes and jewelry at her home. She also receives income from the goverment's children grant. She explained that her main challenge is customers who do not pay on time after purchasing on credit. Florence Siphiwe requested this loan though WDB and Kiva to buy clothes and jewelry for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her grow her business and improve her family's life.

loans.use: To buy clothes and jewelry for resale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school.  Lydia has a business selling second hand clothes.  She has been in this business for three years and she works seven days out of every week. Lydia sells her products at the market by means of wholesale/retail. Lydia has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bales of second hand clothes.  The main business challenge(s) for Lydia include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second clothes and build rental houses. Lydia lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Phylis

texts.en:
Phylis has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last seven years. She is 47 years old, single and the mother of three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET by one of our field officers and this will be her second loan.  She paid her previous loan of KES.10,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer. She will later sell her crop to the local market as she practices small-scale farming.

In the future, Phylis hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Andres Avelino

texts.es:
Andrés tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Chepén en La Libertad. Goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales por ser una persona empeñosa en la actividad que realiza.

Andrés se dedica a la pesca y venta de pescados de manera ambulatoria, desde hace 17 años, esto le ha dado gran experiencia y clientela. Su trabajo le ha permitido desarrollarse económicamente y desea seguir invirtiendo en él.

Andrés solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles  para darle mantenimiento a sus mallas  y comprar otros accesorios de pesca que necesita para seguir desarrollando su labor adecuadamente. Además, parte del crédito será destinado al mantenimiento de su moto lineal la cual utiliza para transportar sus productos.

Esta inversión le ayudará a aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar  la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Andres is 48 years old. He lives with his family in their own home,  ​​located in the district of Chepén in La Libertad. He has good personal and professional references because he is a person committed to his work. 

Andres has been fishing and selling fish in the streets for 17 years, which has given him a lot of experience and a good client base. His work has allowed him to improve his financial position and he would like to continue investing in it.

Andres is requesting Edpyme Alternativa a loan of 1000 soles to repair his nets and buy other fishing accessories he needs to further develop his work properly. In addition, part of the loan will go to pay for the maintenance of the motorbike he uses to transport his products. 

This investment will help him increase his revenue and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to repair his nets and buy fishing accessories.

loans.name: Mzaituni Group

texts.en:
Darzen, who is in her late 20s, is married with one daughter. She has been running a clothes shop for two years now. She works from 8 a.m to 6 p.m daily and is able to make fair monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd "Motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A "Motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania  given in the middle of the main loan that motivates borrowers with good credit ratings who pay back their  loans  smoothly to receive half the amount of the existing loan before their original loan term has ended. Darzen used the previous loan to increase the shop inventory and has paid back her loan successfully. She wants this loan to buy more clothes from Kariakoo, a business centre which is some few kilometres from the City Centre. Her dream is to one day be an international businesswoman.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mzaituni" which has a total of 10 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more  clothes from Kariakoo to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene 32 años vive en Latacunga con su esposo y sus hijos que tienen 16, 10, 9, 7 y 4 años; Marina se describe como una persona responsable en su trabajo, honesta y sincera con las demás personas.

Trabaja en la crianza de cerdos junto con su familia, Marina inició su trabajo hace 15 años con la crianza de pollos y erdos pequeños.

Es la primera vez que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de cerdos que le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas.

Su sueño es construir más chancheras, comprar más animales y tener mejores ingresos para poderles dar un buen estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marina, age 32, lives in Latacunga with her husband and their children; ages 16, 10, 9, 7, and 4.  Marina can be described as a person who is responsible in her work, and as being honest and sincere with other people.

She works raising pigs with her family.  Marina started her work 15 years ago by raising chickens and small pigs.

This is her first time working with Fodemi.  She will use the loan she is requesting to buy pigs, which will help improve her sales.

Her dream is to buy more pigpens, to buy more animals, and to have better earnings in order to be able to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mr. Em is a farmer and has been in this business for a long time. This is an occupation he learned from his grandparents when he was young. He earns about 4 USD each day. He has four children, two of whom attend school. The other two are married and live in separate houses. Em wishes to have a motorbike, but he lacks the money. He has decided to request a loan from HKL, a Kiva partner. He will use this loan to purchase a new motorbike. He hopes that the loan and the motorbike will help his family to be happier and more prosperous. This is his fifth loan with HKL. He is very thankful to all kind lenders that always help his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CHICON” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Poblado de Chicon, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Victoria; La socia tiene 49 años, la socia es conviviente;  la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de productos secos, la socia tienen su stand en uno de los mercados de Urubamba; la socia compra al por mayor de sus proveedores productos secos como las diversas menestras habas, porotos, maíz, quinua, cebada, entre otros como papa seca, carne seca y los vende en sus stand en el mercado todos los días desde muy temprano por la mañana la socia desea invertir el crédito en la compra de otro grupo de productos secos para la venta e implementación de sus negocio la socia pagara a sus proveedores y ellos le darán a cambio maíz amarillos, blanco, papa para que la socia lo deshidrate, lentejas, porotos,  entre otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos secos para implementar sus negocio.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "CHICON" which is located in the village of Chicón, province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco.

Victoria, 49, has a common-law husband.  She buys and sells dry goods at her stand in the Urubamba market.  Her goods, which she buys from wholesale dealers, include vegetables, lima beans, green beans, corn, quinoa, barley, potatoes, and dry meat.  She opens her stand every day from very early in the morning.  She wants to use the loan to buy another group of dry goods.  She will pay the dealers and they will give her yellow and white corn, potatoes for freeze-drying, lentils, and green beans, among others.  

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy dry goods for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
This is Rebecca, 49, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Marlon, a tricycle driver, and mother to their four children. With the help of her husband and children, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rebecca operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos' worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and reselling them by the piece. Aside from this, she also sells processed meat. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 43,000-PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Rebecca hopes her business will grow more this coming year, so she'll be able to have their house renovated. She dreams of being able to give her children a high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is married and blessed with one child. He manages a retail shop and has run a green grocer for the last five years to make a living. He also rents out houses to earn extra income. He has employed one person to help him to manage the business. In the next five years, he wants to become more financially stable. Since he decided to join Faulu Kenya, he has been able to improve his living standard. With 40,000 Kenya shillings, he wants to buy sugar, vegetables and a weighing machine.

loans.use: to buy sugar, vegetables and a weighing machine.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.ru: Адолат разведенная женщина, у нее трое детей. Она работает на заводе по переработке хлопка и за месяц получает заработную плату в размере 700 сомони. Являясь единственной кормильцем в семье она также дополнительно занимается продажей сухофруктов и откормом крупного рогатого скота. В бизнесе ей помогают дети. Сухофрукты востребованы круглый год и у нее большие спросы на продажу сухофруктов. Адолат хотела бы получить займ для приобретения сухофруктов и скота.
texts.en: Adolat is a divorced woman, who has three children.  She works at a cotton-processing factory and earns a monthly income in the sum of 7000 somoni.  Being the sole provider for her family, Adolat is also involved in sales of dried fruits and fattening up cattle.  Her children help her with this business.  Dried fruits are in demand all year around, and she has a lot of requests for sales of dried fruits.  Adolat wants to obtain this loan for the purchase of dried fruits and livestock.

loans.use: to buy dried fruits and livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizer for rice crop and pay field hands.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima De Conchacalla Group

texts.es:
En este nuevo desembolso está la Sra. Vicentina, ella tiene 50 años D. edad, la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos D. 25, 23, 20, 16, 12 años D. edad, La socia es una persona muy trabjadora y tiene varios oficios para poder obtener rentabilidad economica para educar a sus hijos, la socia tiene como principal actividad yla agricultura ella siembra y cosecha maíz, papa, trigo, cebada y aunque este ingreso no es mensual ella hace todos los esfuerzos posibles para generar ganancias en otras actividades como la venta D. queso, ya que la socia tambien tiene ganados y vacas lecheras las cuales producen leche y ella pueD. elaborar queso; la socia también se dedica a la crianza D. animales menores, ella en esta ocasión desea el credito para poder comprar gallinas doble pechuga y cuyes como 50 pares. La socia a futuro desearía poder exportar sus productos pero aun en esta zona no es posible eso ya que no se tienen los contactos para hacerlo, ella dice que vendiendo D. forma minorista y a los compradores frecuentes en la zona no gana mucho y sería una muy buena opcion exportar pero ella como muchos socios no saben como hacerlo. La socia desea el credito para invertir en la compra D. gallinas doble pechuga y D. cuyes 50 pares. 
Las otras socias se dedican a la agricultura, a la ganadería, a la crianza D. animales menores y una D. las socias atienD. su tienda D. abarrotes pequeña.
Las socias se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
In this new loan disbursement is Vicentina. She is 50 years old. She is married and has 5 children who are 25, 23, 20, 16 and 12 years old. She is a hardworking person and has various ways of earning a living in order to be able to obtain financial profitability so she can educate her children. 

Her main activity is agriculture and the planting and harvesting of corn, potatoes, wheat, and barley. Since this not monthly income she puts all her possible efforts into generating earnings from other activities such as selling cheese, because she also has cattle and dairy cows which produce milk and she can make cheese. She also breeds small animals. 

At this time she is asking for a loan in order to buy double breasted chickens and 50 pairs of guinea pigs. 

In the future she would like to export her products even though in this area it is not possible and she does not have the contacts to do it. She says that she is selling retail and to buyers in her area.  She does not earn much and it would be a good option to export but she and other members do not know how to do it. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy double breasted chickens and 50 pairs of guinea pigs. The other members work in agriculture, livestock, raising small animals and one of the members has a small grocery store The members promise to make their payments on time.

loans.use: to buy double breasted chickens and 50 pairs of guinea pigs

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es: El señor Jorge Iván desde los 10 años de edad aprendió de su padre la elaboración de herraduras y desde entonces se dedica a esta labor acompañado de sus dos hijos a quienes les enseñó esta labor.  El señor Jorge Iván compra metal para fabricar las herraduras en el taller que tiene en el patio de su casa y el producto terminado lo vende a un mayorista del municipio de Sonson ubicado en el occidente de Antioquia.  El señor Jorge desea comprar hierro y carbón para continuar con la elaboración de las herraduras y de esta manera lograr mayores ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
When Jorge Iván was ten years old he learned from his father how to make horseshoes.  From then on he has devoted himself to this work.  He taught his two children this work, and they work with him.

Jorge Iván buys metal in order to make the horseshoes in his workshop, which is on the patio of his house.  He sells the finished product to a wholesaler in the Sonson municipality to the west of Antioquia.

Jorge wishes to buy more iron and coal to continue making the horseshoes.  That way he will attain greater income and improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw material like iron and coal.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 36 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Annabelle works very hard to provide for them.

Annabelle runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Annabelle has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, noodles, sardines, biscuits, coffee and milk.  

In the future Annabelle would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Maria Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Maria Adriana es casada, tiene 50 años de edad, curso el cuarto años de educación primaria, tiene 7 hijos 4 de los cuales estudian, se dedica al comercio, a la atención de una tienda, inició por iniciativa propia, lleva 2 años de experiencia.

Solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de productos para la tienda que tiende y así poder competir con las tiendas que están alrededor. En el futuro espera ver su negocio con ventas al por mayor.
texts.en:
María Adriana is married and 50 years old with seven children, four of whom are students.  She finished four years of elementary school.  She works in business, tending a store.  She began on her own initiative and has two years of experience.

She is requesting a loan that she will use to buy products for the store she tends, and so be able to compete with the surrounding stores.  In the future she hopes to see her business with wholesale sales.

loans.use: to buy items for her store.

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en: Ms Xuan is the mother of  Minh, who is a student.  Minh was born in 1993.  She is studying accounting at the University.  Her study duration lasts 36  months.  She is a first year student.  To be an accountant is her dream job, and she is trying to study hard to absorb knowledge since she wants to be self-confident in her new career.  She hopes she will get a good job after graduation. Currently, she wants to borrow a loan of 10,206,000 Vietnamese Dongs to pay for tuition fees.

loans.use: pay tuition fees

loans.name: Melissa Alejandra

texts.es: A sus 19 años, la joven Melissa es madre soltera de un bebé de 1 año de nacido, con el fin de brindarle a su hijo todo lo necesario, decide desde hace un año dedicarse a la venta de ropa y al peinado de niñas. Desde entonces, todos los días, la joven Melissa sale a las calles a vender su mercancía y conseguir sus ingresos. Con el ánimo de suplir las necesidades propias y de su hijo, la joven Melissa necesita de la compra de mercancía que puede ofrecer a sus clientes y a futuro cumplir su sueño de tener su propio almacén y ver crecer a su hijo en buenas condiciones.
texts.en: At 19, young Melissa is the single mother of a 1 year-old baby.  A year ago, with the objective of providing her child with everything he needs, she decided to start a business selling clothing and hairstyling for little girls. Since then, each day, young Melissa goes out into the streets to sell her merchandise and obtain her income.  With the motive of meeting her own needs and those of her son, young Melissa needs to buy merchandise to offer to her customers.  In the future, she hopes to accomplish her dream of having her own store and seeing her child grow up in good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing for men and women

loans.name: Mugoma Goat Keepers Group

texts.en: Patrick is a thirty nine year old married man living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has four children. He has been trading in produce for the last ten years and this has facilitated him to educate his children. Price fluctuation is his major challenge. His dreams are to educate his children and to expand his business into new markets. Patrick needs the loan facility to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa has a small stall rented inside the local market in her town and sold variety of vegetables like  cabbage, beans, squash, tomatoes, garlic, eggplant and bottle gourd. 
She is 53 year old married woman and has three grown children. She resides in the town of Sierra Bullones.



She would like to improve her earnings by purchasing assorted to purchase assorted vegetables such as squash, okra, beans and other green leafy vegetables.  These will keep the inventory on her shop  causing more buyers to come. In the long run, Felisa's earnings will slowly improve. She will start to save and continue to expand her business.
 
Felisa extend thanks to Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: to purchase assorted vegetables such as squash, okra, beans and other green leafy vegetables

loans.name: Massan

texts.en:
Ms. Massan F. was born on Aril 10, 1955 in Tohoun in the Moyen-Mono prefecture. She is a married mother of three children and takes care of two others. Very early on, she got into the business of selling bags of rice and then opened a shop from which to do so. This flourishing business allows her to contribute to her family’s income, because her husband’s salary is no longer stable due to situation of his business. She is rigorous in the management of her business and has easily been able to repay her loans.

She is requesting a new loan of $1200, which will allow her to buy bags of rice direct from wholesalers and to respond to market demands. She could then increase her income and meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame F. Massan est née le 10 Avril 1955 à Tohoun dans la préfecture du Moyen-Mono. Elle est mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants avec deux (02) enfants à sa charge. Très tôt, elle s’est lancée dans la vente de sacs de riz et a ouvert une boutique en la circonstance. Ce commerce florissant lui permet de contribuer aux charges du ménage car le salaire de son mari n’est plus régulier à cause de la situation de son entreprise. Rigoureuse dans la gestion de ses activités, elle a su rembourser ses crédits obtenus sans difficulté.

Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit de $1200 qui lui permettra d’acheter directement les sacs de riz chez les grossistes et répondre à la demande de son marché. Elle pourra accroître ainsi son revenu et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and sell rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tirente Mokira Oloyionte intends to buy beads in bulk

loans.name: Joseph O.

texts.en: Joseph is 24 years old, and is an ambitious married father of one. He is currently employed in the coffin making business but is in the process of setting up his own. He needs this loan to enable him to purchase the tools and materials necessary for him to begin. He is also seeking financial independence so that he will be able to support his family and improve their life.

loans.use: To purchase tools and materials to start up a coffin making business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en: Mrs. Hilda I. started her business 3 years ago and it has helped to take care of her family. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She sells provision & foodstuff to her community. Mrs. Hilda I. is married with (5) children. She intends to expand her business with the above loan.

loans.use: To buy more provision & foodstuff for sale

loans.name: Majida

texts.en:
Majida, 41 years old, married and mother of 5 children, runs a small business from home in the area of Al Rwaissat in Beirut. She buys home products, small appliances, and accessories and sells them back in her neighborhood.

Two years ago, Majida heard about our Institution from word of mouth and applied for a loan to purchase more inventory. This is the 3rd time Majida is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua. This time, again, she needs a loan of US$ 600 to buy home products. Her dream is to open a small shop of her own in an area near her home to have better visibility for her business.

Majida is part of a group loan with other women from the same neighborhood. A group is usually constituted of self-chosen women, living in vulnerable conditions. The group lending is based on incremental increase of loan amount and group solidarity to guarantee repayment. The strength of the group loan is that it encourages the collaboration approach in the borrowing community; it is a very powerful tool towards economic empowerment of women.

loans.use: Purchase of a stock of home products, small appliances, and accessories for resale

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria’s husband does contract work in the local town’s industry: however there are long gaps between contracts in which he is without work. It is for this reason that Maria Guadelupe decided to begin to look for a business in order to be able to meet household expenses without waiting for her husband to obtain new work. This was how she began to sell clothes and ceramics, and after a time a friend of hers invited her to sell cosmetics from a catalogue, saying to her that these products would give her a good profit margin. She decided to hold a demonstration in her house, together with her neighbours, and she managed good sales that day and from then on she has continued fighting to advance.

Maria’s goal now is to become the co-coordinator of a group of saleswomen, and for this she is asking for a loan of $575 USD, to be paid back over 5 months. With this money Maria will be able to meet all the orders which she has for the upcoming end-of-year party season, and with the profits she will make they she will be able to renovate a part of her house in order to make a small office where she can meet her clients. With your help, Maria will be able to realise her dream.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El esposo de María, trabaja por contrato en una industria de su comunidad, sin embargo hay largas temporadas entre contrato y contrato que se queda sin trabajo. Es por eso que María Guadalupe decidió comenzar a buscar un negocio para poder solventar los gastos de la casa, que no esperan a que su esposo consiga trabajo nuevamente. Y fue así como comenzó por vender ropa y cerámica, y después de un tiempo una amiga de ella la invitó a vender cosméticos por catálogo, diciéndole que dichos productos le iban a dejar una buena ganancia, y se decidió a hacer una demostración en su casa, juntó a sus vecinas y logró hacer una buena venta ese día y desde entonces a luchado por salir adelante.

La meta de María ahora es llegar a ser coordinadora de un grupo de vendedoras, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero María podrá surtir todos los pedidos que tiene para esta temporada de fiestas de fin de año, y con las ganancias que tenga poder remodelar una parte de su casa para ponerla como oficinita para atender a sus clientas. Con tu ayuda el sueño de María se hará realidad.

loans.use: Stock orders from her clients

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana belongs to the Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadores (The Community Bank of Leaders), and she lives in the Jr. Rosa Merino Mz. H Lt. 13 district of Calleria, in the county of Ucayali. She is 73 years old and has 7 grown up kids. She is widowed and her income does not cover the household bills. This is why Ana, with the first loan that she got from Manuela Ramos of $300.00, decided to invest in the sale of food and raising chickens and farm ducks.

Now, Ana, along with her daughter, is still selling food. First they rise early to go to the market, then they prepare the food and they sell it at night. At the same time, and with much dedication, she rears chickens and ducks for public sale.

With a loan of $1800, which she will pay back over a period of 6 months, she will buy more chickens, ducks, a sack of beans, a sack of Chiclayo (pulses), a sack of corn and two crates of fizzy drinks.

Despite Ana's advanced age she is a great example for all mothers, some of whom, despite being young, find themselves unhappy in life, but they have the strength to go on and focus on a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Ana pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Jr. Rosa Merino Mz. H Lt. 13, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 73 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos independientes, es viuda, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Ana, con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en la venta de comida y crianza de pollos y patos de granja. Actualmente Ana junto con su hija salen adelante con la venta de comida. Primero madrugan para realizar las compras en el mercado, luego se dedican a la preparación de sus comidas y la venta se realiza en las noches. Paralelamente, con mucho esmero, se dedica a la crianza de sus pollos y patos para la venta al público. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,800, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará mas pollos, patos de granja, un saco de fríjol, un saco de Chiclayo (menestra), un saco de maíz y dos cajas de gaseosas. Ana a pesar de su avanzada edad es todo un ejemplo a seguir para las demás madres, que siendo jóvenes se sienten derrotadas en la vida, aún le sobran fuerzas para seguir adelante y pensar en un futuro mejor.

loans.use: To buy small animals (chickens, ducks), and to buy pulses (beans, chiclayo) and fizzy drinks/Compra de animales menores (pollos, patos). Compra de menestras (frijol, chiclayo). Compra de gaseosas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in merchandise

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Since she was young, Marcela has always enjoyed maintaining herself presentable. This characteristic motivated her to become an active member of the most popular brands and beauty lines in the country. Thanks to the large amount of orders and a large portfolio of clients, she has been able to form partnerships with some stores who now carry her products. She also has her cosmetic products on display at home for her clients. For 5 years she has had big returns, but now she finds herself in a different situation that she must overcome and we confiD. in you to offer her a helping hand. She's asking for a loan to buy a greater quantity of products so she can strengthen her business. Let's answer her petition for a loan so she can make this a reality and free herself from the problems that surround this mother.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

A Doña Marcela, desD. joven le ha agradado mantenerse muy presentable, caracteristica que la motivaron a ser miembro activo D. las más populares marcas y líneas D. belleza D. su país, gracias a la gran cantidad D. pedidos y a la gran cartera D. clientas que maneja a podido formar alianzas con algunas tiendas en las que oferta sus productos y no tan solo eso sino que en su domicilio tiene un pequeño mostrador con diversos productos cosméticos.Ella hace mas D. 5 años ha tenido grandes beneficios, pero ahora se ve en algunos problemas que tendrá que superar y confiamos en usted para tenderle una mano, ella solicita un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad D. productos con el objetivo D. estabilizar su negocio.Posibilitemos su petición para que pronto este hecho se haga realidad y libre las dificultades en las que ha estado inmersa esta trabajadora madre.

loans.use: Increase capital to buy more cosmetics.

loans.name: Budumuli East D(I) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Christine N.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery shop and is requesting a loan to add more stock. Christine is 35 years old and is married. She has 4 children ranging from ages 7 to 17 and her children go to school. Each week, Christine makes approximately UGX 90000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children and save for future use. Christine has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add capital to the business and the loan was paid back on time.

Christine is joined in her small group by Rehema N. and Suzan N.. Rehema N. has a business selling clothes and wants to boost her business. Suzan N. is currently operating a business selling fish and wants a loan to increase the stock of fish.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and add to her shop

loans.name: Tima's Minchi Sokoni Group

texts.en:
Tima is 30 years old and is married with 2 children, ages 12 and 6 years old. Tima is a fish seller. She started her business in 2006. Everyday, she works from 10am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Mwanaasha, Kibibi, and Mwanapwani, who have businesses in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra I. is 39 years old and married with three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. This is a business she has been into for the past 11 years. She sells her goods at home and at the market.

Sandra has been a LAPO client for the past seven years. She needs the loan of $700 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy provisions and drinks for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia B. sells fish and although she is married, her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for her and her two children. Since demand for her goods is high, Lydia is requesting a loan of $400 to expand her business in order to increase profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Edoh

texts.fr:
Edoh A. is forty years old. She is married and is the mother of three children. She lives in Assahoun, a village about 50 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. She has been a retailer of vegetable foodstuffs for more than five years. With her second loan, she hopes to increase her stocks of peanuts, corn, millet, beans, and other cereals, with a view to reselling them to expand her business. The profits from her occupation will allow her to better meet the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Edoh A. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Il habite à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Madame est revendeuse de produits vivriers depuis plus de 5 ans. Avec ce second crédit, elle souhaite faire davantage de stocks d’arachides, de maïs, de mils, du haricot et autres céréales en vue de les revendre pour augmenter la capacité de son commerce. Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of corn, beans, millet, and peanuts for resale

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is fifty-year-old Zuhura S. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with three children and is also responsible for supporting two other young relatives because they are orphans. Zuhura owns a Mama Lishe or local café in Dar where she serves up delicious local food.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be.

The food is all local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

Josephine, along with one employee, also works as a caterer for local businesses, which has enabled her to increase her monthly profits to US$ 170. She has borrowed and successfully repaid two prior loans from SELFINA for US$ 275 each. This time, she is requesting a larger loan of US$ 525 to purchase additional cooking equipment to help fulfill her catering orders and buy extra cooking supplies on a larger scale. In the future, Zuhura hopes to do well enough to expand her business to another location.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence the poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client.

The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional catering and cooking supplies

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is 22 years, and she is married with two children aged 1 and 3 years old. She has been a clothes and firewood  seller since May 2008. Every day, she works from 7am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155  from her sales. Halima is now looking for a loan to buy more firewood and clothes for her business.

loans.use: Halima would like to buy more firewood and clothes  for her business.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en: Dilbar A. is 35 years old, and a widow raising her three children alone. They are her inspiration to work hard every day and continue with her business. When her husband passed away, Dilbar was left without steady income. Supporting her children practically on her own was very difficult. After a long suffering she decided to open a grocery store near her house. Considering that Dilbar is the only owner of the grocery store in her community her business went well after it started. Dilbar is trying to generate income not only for her family's consumption but also to be able to create savings for the dowries of her daughters and future weddings of all of her children. Today Dilbar is planning to increase the range of her selling goods. With this purpose she requests 2800 Somoni ($825 USD) for the term of 12 months. Support this woman of much strength and courage to keep working. Your generosity can change her and her familyl's lives.

loans.use: Dilbar would like to purchase foodstuff like sweets, tea, sugar, juices, soft drinks, preserved food for her grocery store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Gloria es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Gloria vende comida variada en su casa que esta ubicada en la Av. Quinuapata, actividad que realiza por las noches y cuenta con la ayuda de sus sobrina. Además Gloria en sus ratos libres vende cosméticos por catalogo llamado Oriflame sus ventas son al crédito.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de  600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, y papa.
Los sueños de Gloria son tener una tienda de abarrotes, un restaurante y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Legioncito microfinance institute. Gloria is a 38-year-old married mother of 2 children. She sells assorted meals in her house, which is located on Quinuapata Avenue. With the help of her niece, she works evenings. Gloria also sells Oriflame cosmetics by catalog for credit in her free time. Gloria needs a loan of 600.00 PEN, which will be invested in purchasing sugar, rice, and potatoes. She dreams of having her own general store and restaurant, and of her children finishing their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, and potatoes

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: La Sra. Maria T. R. es propietaria de una pequeña casa, lugar en el cual formó su hogar y su familia, durante muchos años se dedicó a las labores del hogar, pero ante la falta de  ingresos económicos decidió aprovechar una habitación de su casa para instalar una pequeña tienda general de barrio. Actualmente y gracias aq su esfuerzo y su arduó trabajo en la venta, la tienda creció y vende muchos más productos que en un inicio, es por ello que decidió ampliar su tienda, para lo cual necesita materiales de construcción como ser: viguetas prefabricadas, fierro, etc, asi podrá tener mas comodidad. Espera que su negocio siga creciendo, así continuará aportando económicamente en su hogar.
texts.en:
Señora Maria T. R. is the owner of a small house, a place in which she has made a home and a family. For many years she worked in the home, but in the face of a lack of income, she decided to take advantage of a room in her house to start a small neighborhood general store. Currently, thanks to her efforts and her hard work in sales, the store has grown and she sells more products now than she did in the beginning. For this reason, she decided to increase the size of her store which is why she needs construction materials like pre-fabricated beams, iron, etc. That way she will be able to be more comfortable. She hopes that her business will keep growing and that she will continue to financially support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The Purchase of Construction Materials to Enlarge her Store

loans.name: Nadejda

texts.en:
Nadejda B. lives in Baccealia village, Causeni district. Since 2005, Ms. Nadejda has worked in the SA-Elevator Kelley Grains company, currently as guardian. Previously, she worked as an aide in Brigadir Kolkhoz in the village.

This is her first loan from Microinvest. The loan was required to pay for connecting gas to her home. Now, Nadejda is going through a very difficult period, because she lives alone and she only needs to maintain herself to survive. 

Nadejda has 4 boys, three of whom are married and have a secure future. The youngest is in the army, and he has a girlfriend who is looking forward to his return to get married. Ms. Nadejda knows she can appeal to her children, but she wants to handle it herself. The most important thing is that Ms. Nadejda is happy, and she loves her children, so she knows that she will require help from them.

loans.use: For connecting gas to her home.

loans.name: Maisara

texts.ru: Намозова Майсара , жительница города Яван. Возраст 38 лет, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Муж уехал в Россию на заработки и она занялась бизнесом. Торгует на рынке овощами и фруктами. Занимается этим делом уже четыре года. Кредит планирует получить и использовать его для того, чтобы закупить ящики , арендовать складские помещения , а так же увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кердит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Maisara N. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 38 years old, married and has two children. Her husband went to Russia to find work and she has started own business. She sells fruits and vegetables on the market. She has been doing this for four years already. She plans to get a loan and use it to buy boxes and rent a storage space as well as increase circulation of produce. Maisara will pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase produce circulation

loans.name: Zinhoue

texts.fr: Zinhoue D. est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Lomé, la capitale Togo. Agée de 50 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Avec ce crédit, Zinhoue souhaite accroître la taille de son commerce en alimentant sa boutique de nouveaux produits lui permettant de mieux satisfaire les besoins de la clientèle. Elle compte sur cette chance pour améliorer la qualité de sa vie.
texts.en:
Zinhoue D. is the owner of a grocery store in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of four. With this loan, she would like to expand her commerce by stocking her shop with new goods, allowing her to satisfy her customers better. She is counting on this chance to improve the quality of her life.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Doña María  tiene la edad de 42 años, reside en el  barrio Villa Reconciliación, estado civil casada, tiene un hijo varón de la edad de 16 años actualmente estudia. Los planes para el bienestar de su familia es mejorar el nivel de vida para su hijo y su esposo por que trabajando juntos lograran alcanzar las metas y también lograr que   su hijo sea un profesional. La señora Maria desde hace seis años inicio su propio negocio de venta de cereales como: pinolillo, cebada y tortilla un producto muy consumido por los Nicaragüense y elaborado por su propietaria. Los proyectos para su negocio es incrementar las ventas por medio del incremento de su producción. La solicitud de su préstamo en Afodenic es para comprar materia prima tales como: Maíz, cacao, canela, soya, cal (se utiliza para nesquizar es maíz y elaborar las tortillas), cebada, semilla de jícaro y introducir al comercio otros productos: cuajadas, crema y queso.
texts.en:
Dona Maria is 42 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliacion neighborhood. She is married and has a 16-year-old son who presently studies. The plans for the well-being of her family are to improve the lifestyle for her son and husband. By working together, they will succeed in reaching their goals and also succeed in getting their son to be a professional.

Mrs. Maria started her own business about six years ago and sells cereals such as; pinolillo [sweet cornmeal and cocoa], barley and tortilla, a popular product consumed by Nicaraguans which she makes herself. Her business projects are to increase the sales incrementally through increased production. The loan request through Afodenic is to buy principal materials such as: corn, cocoa, cinnamon, soy, lime mineral (used for the nixtamalization process of the corn and preparation of tortillas), barley, jicaro seeds and the introduction of other products: curds, cream and cheese.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, cocao, soy, lime mineral and other products for her business.

loans.name: Violor

texts.en:
Violor is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for baking bread. Violor is 32 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for the children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy ingredients for baking bread

loans.name: Aiga

texts.en:
Aiga P., 59, is married with four children. She has three years of experience selling pancakes in her village, which she does five days per week. She is requesting a loan to replenish supplies such as flour, oil, sugar, gas, a frying pan, and containers.

This is Aiga’s second loan through SPBD. These loans are her only access to capital because she is unable to qualify for a loan through traditional banks. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala ($208 USD).

loans.use: Purchase bag of flour, bag of sugar, oil, chinese frying pan, gas oven, plastic storage containers

loans.name: J Concepción

texts.es:
El señor J Concepción J. desea construir un baño de materia mas duradero ya que el actual es de madera, se encuentra en malas condiciones y teme que pueda posar algo. 
  Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material ya que el se dedica a la construcción de vivienda y se encargara de ser la mejora.
texts.en:
Mr. J Concepción J. wishes to build a bathroom of sturdier materials since his current one is wooden. It is currently in poor condition and he fears it may fall apart. He is seeking a loan to buy materials. He works in construction and will perform the improvements himself.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bathroom construction

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Раъно Массобирова - женщина средних лет, 1958 года рождения. Разведена и имеет 2-х детей. Раъно развелась с мужем много лет назад, и теперь живет со своими детьми и растит их одна. Она открыла лавку у своего дома и продает там разные товары и принадлежности для хозяйства. Недавно она закупила мужскую обувь (кроссовки), чтобы расширить свой ассортимент. Раъно кредитуется в нашей организации уже три года. За этот период она расширила ассортимент своего товара и расширила свой бизнес. За это она благодарна кредиторам за поддержку в ее бизнесе.
texts.en:
Rano M. is a middle age woman, she was born in 1958. She is divorced and has two children. Rano has divorced her husband many years ago and now lives with her children and raises them by herself. She has opened a small kiosk next to her house where she sells different kind of products for home. Just recently she bought men's shoes (sneakers) to expand the assortment of goods. Rano has been taking loans from our organization for three years now. During this time she has increased the assortment of her merchandise and expanded her business. She is grateful to the lenders for the support of her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail of household products and shoes

loans.name: Jessenia Esther

texts.es: Jessenia Esther tiene un niño de 7 años estudiando el 2do grado de primaria, vive con su mamá en la zona # 3 de Nueva Guinea RAAS, labora en la empresa CURACAO como cajera, solicita su 1er crédito a AFODENIC para realizar mejora de su vivienda, como es la construccion de un dormitorio, es una mujer emprendedora capaz de salir adelante  con la familia, siempre ha demostrado ser  responsable con su deberes crediticios, su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda, ella espera tener la oportunidad de ser beneficiada con el fondo Kiva con este financiamiento, pues este fondo le brinda ayuda a la familia de escasos recurso económico, pues su mayor deseo es contar con mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar y brinarle mayor comodidad a su hijo y madre.
texts.en:
Jessenia Esther has a son who is seven years old and in the second grade. She lives with her mother in Zone 3 of Nueva Guinea RAAS. She works for CURACAO as a cashier. She is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner AFODENIC in order to improve her home because right now she's in the middle of construction on a bedroom. Jessenia is an enterprising woman, capable of succeeding with her family. She has always shown herself to be responsible with her debts. Her greatest dream is to improve the condition of her home; she hopes to have the opportunity to be helped by a Kiva loan. This loan would help her family economically, so her greatest hope is to improve her living conditions and give her son and mother more comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction on a bedroom

loans.name: Concern Group

texts.en:
Sahid M. I. (left), age 35, is the leader of this group. Sahid was born in Magburaka town. He is single with two children who are still in primary school. Sahid owns a bar where he has been selling both soft and hard drinks for over five years now.

Sahid M. I., Septimus C. and Marie K. named their group "Concern". They are small scale business people based in Magburaka town in northern Sierra Leone. This will be the first loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To invest in a bar

loans.name: Tanazio's Group

texts.en:
T. Tanazio, 45, is the leader of his lending group in Bushenyi. He is a business man with a business of selling farm produce like beans, maize, Irish potatoes and matooke (steamed green plantain) to traders in and around his home area. He has run this business  for over ten years. He has a store in the Township and his dream is to have the biggest of its kind in the area since at the moment, he is able to make profits of 120,000/= per month.

Tanazio is married with nine children of whom five are still in school and he cares for two grandchildren. He longs for his children’s education since he believes they will be better off with education.

Tanazio needs a loan to help purchase more produce for resale since the amount he gets from his farm can never be enough for his business. Plus he will use part of the loan in employing manpower on the same farm.

loans.use: To buy more farm produce for resale and to employ manpower on his farm

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou K. is a 30-year-old man who lives with his wife (pictured at her farmland) in Battambong Province. He has three children: two of them are students, while the other one is a beer seller. K. owns and operates a construction business. He has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately US$105 a month. In 2009, K. joined CREDIT to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting for the first time a loan from CREDIT. He is requesting a loan of US$300 which will be used to purchase a motorbike. K. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About CREDIT: CREDIT's mission is to provide inclusive financial services tailored to the clients' needs through excellent service and positive relationships while maintaining organizational sustainability. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn D. lives in the village of Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a furniture-making business, selling her products to local businesses and people who live in her community. She has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that could improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has applied for a loan of 5000 PHP to expand her small company and improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Operating a butcher shop in the public market is hard work and involves long hours. To be successful in this business, one has to be committed to wake up way before dawn every day to get the fresh meat from the slaughter house and have it displayed in the market before the first customers arrive.

But this is what Mrs. Dolores M. and her husband do each day to provide a good living for themselves and their 3 children. Dolores is 52 years old and a resident of Sitio Kahilwayan, Brgy. Gargato, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. By being her husband's helpmate in the business, she is ensuring that her children will be well provided for and she and her husband will have a nest egg in their old age.

Dolores and her husband are shown in the accompanying picture proudly posing with the chest freezers where they keep meat they do not sell for the day so that it stays fresh and can still be sold the following day.

Dolores joined NWTF-Project Dungganon so that she could have access to additional capital for her business. She has been a good payer, as she has slowly increased her income capacity with each new loan. Now her business nets a monthly income of PHP 14,000, enough to satisfy the needs of her family.

Dolores plans to use her 14th loan, this one for Php 30,000, to expand her business even further and to use as additional working capital for her butcher stand.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: As additional capital for meat stand

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 26 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajneh, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their child. Mhammad has been working in the sanitary since 2006. Mhammad requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to pay his working car debt. This is the first time that Mhammad has requested a loan. 
Mhammad is special because he has competitive prices. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mhammad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent work and improve his financial situation. In the future, he plans on expanding his work by opening a sanitary shop.

loans.use: To pay his working car debt.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 52 años, vive con sus 3 hijos y con su esposo en su casa propia. Su rutina diaria es levantarse a las 5 de la mañana para dirigirse a un puerto fluvial cercano a su casa para esperar la llegada de los agricultores, quienes traen diversos productos para vender.  Rosa compra 80 racimos de plátanos diariamente, los cuales vende en uno de los mercados de su localidad, normalmente termina de vender esta fruta en un par de horas, porque sus clientes ya la conocen y la esperan, obteniendo así muy buenas ganancias. En esta labor cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y llevan trabajando juntos 2 años. Lo que le gusta a Rosa de su trabajo es aprender más sobre el comercio y considera que lo más importante es dar una buena atención a sus clientes. 
Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, ya conoce a los miembros de su grupo y cree que trabajarán bien juntos, pues todas son personas muy responsables. Con 200 soles del dinero que solicita comprará un puesto en el mercado y con el resto comprará más plátanos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 52 years old; she lives with her 3 children and her husband in the house they own. Everyday she gets up at 5:00 a.m. and goes to a river port near her house to wait for farmers who bring various products to sell. Rosa buys 80 bunches of bananas everyday, which she sells in one of the markets in town. She normally finishes selling the fruit in just a few hours, because her customers know and wait for her. She earns good income from the sales. Rosa's husband helps her and the two have worked together for 2 years. What Rosa likes most about her work is learning more about business. She believes it is most important to provide good customer service. This is her first loan with MFP; she already knows the members of her group and believes they will work well together, as all the members are very responsible. With 200 PEN of the money she is requesting she will buy a stall in the market, and with the remaining money she will buy more bananas.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a market stall and more merchandise

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es una mujer trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, región de Ucayali, tiene 63 años de edad, es madre de cinco hijos, todos mayores, se dedica a la venta de menús (comida), forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Soñadoras ll” desde hace dos años.  El primer crédito fue de 300 soles que invirtió en insumos para la venta de menús (comida). 
Este crédito de 1200 nuevos soles, piensa invertirlo en construcción y reparación de los dormitorios de su casa. Su meta es seguir trabajando e implementar su venta de menús.
texts.en:
Josefina is a hardworking woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 63 years old and is the mother of five children, all of which are older. She sells à la carte meals and has been a part of the “Mujeres Soñadoras II” communal bank for the past two years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she invested in ingredients for her à la carte meals to sell.

Josefina plans to invest this loan of 1200 PEN in the construction and repair of the bedrooms in her house. Her goal is to continue working and to set up her à la carte menu sales.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in the construction and repair of the bedrooms in her house.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 38 years old and married with two children. She sells both foodstuffs and groceries at the front of her house, combining these businesses to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her immediate family members. She has been in this business for a long time.

This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Optimistas Ii Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal “Mujeres Optimistas II” esta formado por un grupo de 19 mujeres dinámicas y perseverantes, la mayoría viven en el distrito de Manantay región de Ucayali, la presidenta Eloisa Z. N., es madre de dos hijos, de los cuales uno es mayor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas. Las socias que forman este Banco Comunal trabajan en diferentes labores como; venta de pescado, abarrotes, carnes, frutas, golosinas, verduras, bebidas, etc. Este Banco tiene cuatro años desde su creación en el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, donde siempre han demostrado ser unas socias puntuales. En la actualidad este banco necesita un crédito de S/ 8,100 soles que será utilizado en los diferentes negocios que tienen las socias. Este grupo esta agradecido  por la confianza que depositaron en ellas ya que gracias a los préstamos ellas pueden invertir y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Mujeres Optimistas II” consists of 19 dynamic and persevering women, the majority of whom live in Manantay district in the region of Ucayali. The president, Eloisa Z. N., is a mother of 2 children, one of whom is grown. She works selling food and sweets. The partners that form this bank work at different jobs such as selling fish, groceries, meats, fruits, candies, vegetables, drinks, etc. This bank was created 4 years ago within the Manuela Ramos Movement, where they have always shown themselves to be punctual partners. Currently, this bank needs a loan of 8,100 Peruvian Nuevo Soles that will be used in the different businesses. This group appreciates the confidence placed in them and thankful for the loans that they can invest to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for the different businesses

loans.name: Pouline

texts.en: Pouline is 29 years old and married with three children. She is a resident of Kyotera, residing in Kasaali Local Council 1 Zone. She owns a grocery store in Wbira. She will use the loan to purchase shop items, such as sugar, water, soap, pads, jelly, etc., for her business expansion. Her future plan is to create a big grocery shop in Wbira Zone Kyotera to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase shop items that will expand her business

loans.name: Susana Rafaela

texts.es:
La señora Susana M. es una dama muy trabajadora que tiene el deber de mantener a sus dos hijos en edad escolar a los cuales debe brindarle las condiciones de vida necesarias para que se desarrollen y sobre todo brindarles un techo digno donde vivir.

Actualmente, lleva a cabo la reconstrucción de su vivienda y por este motivo es que ha duplicado sus esfuerzos en el trabajo para lograr esta meta de mejorar el nivel de vida de ella y sus hijos a los que tanto ama.
