Por estas razones es que solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los materiales de construcción para que de esta manera logre salir adelante en su desarrollo familiar brindando un techo digno y seguro para vivir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Susan is a hard-working woman. She is responsible for two school-age children. She needs to provide them with their basic needs as well as a decent home to live in. She would like to renovate her home. In order to do this she is dobbling her efforts at work so that she can achieve her goal of providing for a better quality of life for herself and her children that she loves so much. This is why she is asking for a loan in order to buy construction materials. In this manner she can move forward with her family by providing them with a decent roof over their heads and security.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy construction materials.

loans.name: Flor Angelica

texts.es:
La señora Flor Angélica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Amor y Paz”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene 36 años y es madre de 03 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Siendo la madera un insumo importante para la confección de muebles no vio mejor oportunidad que dedicarse a la compra venta de maderas al por mayor y menor, negocio que lo desarrolla en su misma casa, con el apoyo de su esposo, atendiendo pedidos de las carpinterías y ebanisterías mas importantes de la ciudad y la región, entre sus clientes es muy reconocida por la calidad de las maderas que vende y por el buen trato que los brinda.   

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará cuartones de madera como tornillo, cedro, caoba, ishpingo entre variedades que son muy apreciadas para la confección de muebles de sala, comedor, cocina, oficinas.    

Flor Angélica, es una mujer muy emprendedora y perseverante, cualidades que le sirven de ejemplo para otras mujeres, que como ella quieren salir adelante. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por contribuir con sus sueños y metas que tiene.
texts.en:
Flor Angélica, 36, is a member of the "Amor y Paz" communal bank, which is in Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She is single and has three children, all of whom are still dependent on her. Because wood is an important component in furniture-making, she thought the opportunity to buy wood at wholesale and sell at retail from her home would be a profitable business. With her husband's support, she fills orders from the most important carpentry and cabinet-making shops in the city and region. She is very well-known among her customers for the quality of the woods she sells as well as for the good customer service she offers. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy cuartones (a sixteen feet long, 3x3" beam) of various woods like: tornillo (a tropical wood, scientific name: Cedrelinga catenaiformes), cedar, mahogany, ishpingo (a tropical wood, scientific name: Amburana cearensis. It has a well-established reputation in Peru for decorative purposes and durability), among other varieties that are valued in the making of living-room, dining-room, kitchen and office furniture. Flor Angélica is a persevering, enterprising woman, qualities which serve as examples to other women like her who want to get ahead. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for contrituting to her dreams coming true and to meeting her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy different kinds of wood.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita G. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 56 years old. Rosalita is a widow and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosalita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community.  Rosalita is just starting this business.

In 2009, Rosalita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Rosalita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Carminda

texts.es:
la señora Carminda García R. tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijas que estan estudiando, cuando las ventas son muy buenas sus hijas le ayudan a la atencion de sus clientes.
Carminda se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado, utiles escolares y ventiladores. tiene varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad. su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo.
esta solicitando el credito para surtir de calzado para la epoca escolar.
 
su mayor deseo es comprarse una casa porque donde vive renta desde hace 5 años.
texts.en:
Carminda García R. is 45 years old and single with two daughters in school. When business is good, her daughters help her serve her clients. Carminda sells clothing, footwear, school supplies, and fans. She has several years' experience in this area, and her business is open every day of the week. She is requesting the loan to stock footwear for the school year. Her dream is to buy her own home, since she has been renting for five years.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase shoes

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 26 años, es una persona muy jovial, vive con Andi su esposo y su pequeño 7 años de edad. Gracias a varios años de trabajo lograron adquirir su casa propia a pocas cuadras de la de su madre.

La venta de cosméticos por catálogo es la actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el cual ha aprendido todos los secretos para lograr una buena venta. Su carisma es de gran ayuda, pues pocas clientes se pueden negar a realizarle una compra por el gran poder de convencimiento que tiene. Además se ha instruido en los tonos y colores que van de acuerdo con los tipos de piel, además de varios secretos de belleza. Carmen está contenta con su trabajo y cada vez tiene clientes más asiduos, los cuales la buscan para solicitarle las novedades que ofrece. Asimismo, puso una vitrina en la tienda de su madre donde se muestra mejor la mercadería y puede lograr mayores ventas. Para el futuro, quiere instalar una tienda bazar, pero aún debe esperar a que su pequeño este más grande y no dependa tanto de ella, así que espera cumplir su meta poco a poco.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y pertenece al banco comunal llamando “Cristo Morado”, donde está muy contenta. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Carmen is 26 years old and very jovial. She lives with her husband, Andi, and her seven year old son. Thanks to several years of working, they were able to acquire their own home a few blocks away from her mother's. She has been selling cosmetics from a catalog for three years, during which she has learned all of the secrets to making good sales. Her charisma helps as well and few customers are able to resist buying from her, thanks to her salesmanship. She has also learned which colors and tones complement her customers' various skin types, and other beauty secrets. Carmen is happy with her work and has regular customers who seek her out to ask about any new products that she has. She installed a display case in her mother's store in order to better showcase her merchandise and increase her sales. In the future she would like to open her own shop, but she wants to wait for her son to get a little older, when he will not depend so much on her. She hopes to be able to read her goal little by little. This will be her third loan through MFP and she belongs to the "Cristo Morado" communal bank. She is very happy there. She will use the money from this loan to increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en: A. Akmal is 25 years old and has been selling men’s clothing for five years. He began selling to acquaintances and friends, and after a while he realized that he had a lot of clients. So, he decided to rent a shop location and establish himself in the market. Akmal is a very enterprising person with a great desire to get ahead. His business has been able to show the fruits of his labor and he hopes to grow as a businessman. Akmal needs a loan of 3,000 USD, which he plans to invest in inventory in order to offer better service and variety to his clients. You can be an important part of the growth of his business. Today is your opportunity to help, have no doubt. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Mariée à BESSOU Paulin, un boulanger, et mère de trois enfants dont certains sont scolarisés, M. Christine est née en 1952 à Azowlissè au Bénin. Il y a environ 14 ans que Christine vit à Lokokoukoumè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Christine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assume les charges familiales. En effet, pour aider son mari, Christine mène comme activité principale, la vente de bouillie de maïs, de façon ambulante. De manière secondaire, Christine vend également des beignets. Christine effectue l’achat de ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Christine exerce son activité depuis environ 7 ans mais elle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Christine est une cliente fidèle de ALIDé car ayant déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursés. La raison qui l’a poussé à solliciter un quatrième prêt est le souci de renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Married to Paulin Bessou, a baker, and mother of three children some of whom are educated, Christine M. was born in 1952 in Azowlissè in Bénin. About 14 years ago, Christine lived in Lokokoukoumè in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Christine lives together with her husband and children. The couple takes on the family's responsibilities. In fact, to help her husband, Christine sells corn porridge from a moving cart. On a less frequent basis, she also sells beignets. Christine makes her purchases in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She has done this work for about seven years. She never went to school. Christine is a faithful client of ALIDé, having already benefited from three loans which she repaid in full. She is asking for a fourth loan to strengthen her business.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn, sugar, and corn flour

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya de l’association Horonya est composé de 10  femmes mariées de la ville de Tominian, Ségou, quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 33 ans et au moins 5 enfants.
Depuis environ 15 ans, les femmes du groupe font le  commerce d’articles divers tels l’arachide, le riz,  le haricot, les tissus, les savons de toilettes et de lessives, les produits cosmétiques  dans lequel excelle particulièrement Josseline D., etc,  à Tominian. 
Pour l’épanouissement de leurs activités, ces femmes ont décidé de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.
Quant à l’utilisation du prêt Josseline D.,  compte utiliser le sien pour acheter, 6 cartons de parfums  et 20 cartons d’autres petits articles de beauté de  tous genres auprès des grossistes à Bamako. Josseline effectue sa vente à Tominian, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes, au comptant en détail et à crédit.
Tandis que Josseline espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21.000FCFA les autres membres du groupe envisagent obtenir 18.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour subvenir aux dépenses familiales et réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The Danaya group of the Horonya association is made up of ten married women from the town of Tominian in Segou, the 4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They live in traditional families and are on average 33 years old with at least five children. For about 15 years, women in the group have been retailing various items such as peanuts, rice, beans, clothing fabric, toilet and laundry soap, and cosmetic products, which is Josseline D.’s specialty in Tominian. The women decided to call upon the Doro Yiriwaso MFI to help develop their activities. With her part of the loan, Josseline D. intends to buy 6 cartons of perfumes and 20 cartons of various cosmetics from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells her products in Tominian, for the most part to women customers, retail and for cash or credit. Whereas Josseline is hoping for monthly earnings of 21,000 FCFA, the other group members expect to reach 18,000 FCFA. The profits will be used to deal with family expenses and reinvested in the commercial activities.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Tombong

texts.fr: Tombong M. est une femme de 30 ans, elle est mariée et mère d'un enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 8ans et a 16 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle est vendeuse d'huile de palme et de balais traditionnels fabriqués à partir de feuilles de palmier. Elle achète la marchandise dans sa localité et l'expatrie dans les autres régions du pays pour son écoulement en l'occurrence à Dakar. Elle souhaite participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et payer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Tombong M. is 30 years old, married and the mother of one child under her care. She has been a member of the local « Banc Villageois » loan group for 8 years and has been granted 16 successive loans. She retails palm oil and traditional brooms made from palm fronds. She gets her merchandise locally and delivers it to other regions of the country for resale, in particular Dakar. She wishes to participate in improving her family’s living conditions, satisfy her personal needs and pay for her children’s schooling.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and resell 110 liters palm oil and three packs of brooms

loans.name: Able God Group

texts.en:
Kulubo C. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Able God. She is 61 years old, married, and has two children, who are 26 and 28 years old. She also cares for a sibling. She did not have the opportunity to go college.

For five years, Kulubo has been selling used clothing at the Redlight Market in Paynesville, Liberia. She talks to her customers in a nice manner, which keeps them returning. But sometimes sales can be slow for her.

Kulubo started selling with 2,000.00 Liberian dollars as working capital. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more used comforters for sale. Her goal is to expand her business to a large store in the near future. Kulubo describes herself as a serious and hardworking woman.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Kulubo is holding the sign.

loans.use: To buy more used comforters for resale

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Otgonbayar is a humble, helpful and open-minded person. She lives with her husband and two sons in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They all live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Otgonbayar currently operates a transportation business in the city using a van she owns. Every day she makes six trips between two transportation terminals in the city. She collects fares and announces stops as her driver drives. Her husband works as a driver at a local company. Her oldest son, Munkhzul, is 15 years old and attends high school. His 6-year-old son, Munkh-Erdene, attends kindergarten. While she enjoys the work, her voice is starting to tire after years of loudly announcing route stops. Otgonbayar started her business in 2005, after obtaining a loan to purchase her van. She recently had to purchase a bus as the city government plans to enact a law forbidding the use of vans for transportation in the city. She says that "my family's living conditions have improved a lot since I started running transportation." She is requesting a loan to purchase a built house.

loans.use: To buy a built house

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique was born in 1978 and is married with 3 children aged between 6 and 12 years. Angelique’s husband is a driver and they both work hard for their family. Angelique takes care of one dependent who is 21 years. She has a small restaurant business. Her business is well organized and known in the area where she resides; her business is profitable and that is the reason why it was chosen by her. Angelique in these days employs 12 people from her community.

Angelique is now requesting her second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through purchasing more foodstuffs which will allow her to satisfy the demand of her customers. This loan will help Angelique to sell large quantities and good quality food which is one of the ways of earning more profit. With the extra money, Angelique expects to save for her future.

loans.use: Expanding her restaurant business

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es: Azucena, de 47 años, es una mujer  muy trabajadora, que vive en una  casa alquilada, junto a su hijo adolescente.El arreglo y confección de prendas de vestir, han sido en la vida de Azucena una actividad necesaria para vivir. Desde que tenía 16 años, su madre le enseñó este trabajo que le generaba buenas ganancias, y por eso decidió continuar desempeñando estas labores. Ahora tiene su propia máquina de coser, con la que trabaja sin la ayuda de nadie. La mayoría de sus clientes son las madres de familia del colegio de su hijo, que saben de  la calidad de su trabajo, y por esta razón, la visitan en su puesto que tiene  en el mercado de la zona por donde vive. Le gusta su trabajo, porque es tranquilo y le genera buenas ganancias. Para mas adelante tiene pensado  comprarse otra máquina, para realizar acabados más  impecables en las prendas.Este es su doceavo préstamo que tiene con MFP, sabe que el dinero le será muy beneficioso en el desarrollo de su actividad. Asimismo dice que esta muy orgullosa de su grupo de trabajo, pues todos los integrantes son muy responsables y solidarios en el pago de sus cuotas.Azucena tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  repuestos para su máquina de coser, que es su principal  herramienta de trabajo, además adquirirá  telas, cierres y conos de hilos al por mayor, pues quiere cumplir con los pedidos que tiene pendientes.
texts.en:
Azucena, 47 years old, is a hard-working woman who lives in a rented house with her adolescent son. Designing and making dresses has been a necessary activity for her to live. When she was 16, her mother taught her this skill -- one that could generate good earnings for her. For that reason, she decided to continue this line of work. Now, she has her own sewing machine, enabling her to work without anyone else's help. The majority of her customers are mothers with children who attend her son's school and know the quality of her work. For that reason, they visit her post in the market of the zone where she lives. She likes her work, because it is pleasant and provides good earnings. Someday, she hopes to buy another machine, to be able to accomplish more impeccable finishes for her creations. This is Azucena's 12th loan with MFP and she is sure that the money will be beneficial in developing her activity. Also, she says that she is very proud of her working group, since all the members are very responsible and show solidarity in making their payments. Azucena plans to invest the requested funds in buying parts for her sewing machine – her principal working tool – and, in addition, acquiring cloth, zippers, and cones of thread at wholesale, so that she can to fill the orders she has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PARTS FOR HER SEWING MACHINE AND SUPPLIES FOR HER SEWING

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty A. is from the village of Manaoag. He is 40 years old. Resty is married. To make a living, Resty owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Resty has been engaged in his business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Resty joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Resty has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Resty is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Resty from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Cenelia Maria

texts.es:
Cenelia Marìa de 23 años de edad es soltera, vive junto a sus padres, trabaja como docente de primaria en la Escuela Rafaela Herrera desde hace 7 años ubicada en la colonia la Fonseca a 35 km de Nueva Guinea,  

Està solicitando su 5to crèdito para construir  una habitaciòn y asì poco a poco mejorar su nivel de vida, cenelia se ha caracterizado por ser una joven responsable y con muchos deseos de superacion, pues actualmente està cursando su tercer año en la universidad URACCAN  de la licenciatura en ciencias de la Educacion con menciòn en Español. 

Su mayor su sueño en la vida es culminar sus estudios universitarios para obtener mejores ingresos econòmicos y asi poder ayudar a su humilde familia ya que son de escasos recursos y ir mejorando  su vivienda poco a poco.
texts.en:
Cenelia Maria, 23, is single and lives with her parents. She has worked as an elementary school teacher in the Rafaela Herrera school for 7 years. The school is located in the Fonseca neighborhood, 35 kilometers from Nueva Guinea. She is requesting her 5th loan to build a room, and in this way gradually improve her standard of living. Cenelia is known to be a responsible young person with a strong desire to succeed. She is currently completing her 3rd year at the Uraccan University, where she is studying toward a degree in education with a minor in Spanish. Her main wish in life is to finish her university studies so that she can have a better economic status and in this way help her family, since they have limited economic resources. She also wants to continue to make gradual improvements to her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to build a room

loans.name: Revelieta

texts.en:
Revelieta D. L. C., age 30, and her husband, Eddie, have one child in elementary school and work hard to cover daily expenses.  Revelieta runs a small 'sari-sari' or general store that sells a number of goods including beverages, snacks, and toiletries.  Her business generates roughly PHP 7,000 per month. 

Revelieta has applied for a loan of PHP 9,000 to help her replenish her stock.  She would like to use the loan to purchase more toiletries and beverages, so that the added inventory might help her expand her business and generate more earnings each month.  

Revelieta has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since the beginning of 2010 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.*  She hopes that one day she will be able to purchase her own house and that her child will finish schooling.  

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: Replenish stock

loans.name: Olinda

texts.es: Olinda, de 34 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Walter de 34 años y su querido hijo Kevin de 13 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Las chacras que con tanto esfuerzo ha cultivado Olinda, siempre le han brindado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse, ella cultiva papa, arveja y maíz, las cuales después de la cosecha lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios le dan por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucha paciencia, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos. En lo sucesivo, tiene planeado ampliar sus campos para poder cultivar y obtener mayor producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y desea serlo también ahora, en su banco comunal es una socia muy comprometida con el desarrollo de su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Olinda, 34, is a kind, hard working woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Walter, 34, and her beloved son Kevin, 13, for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. The fields that Olinda has always cultivated with so much effort have always provided enough income for her to support herself. She grows potatoes, peas and corn which she sells at the Tarma wholesale market which is where the best prices are available for her products. What she likes most about her work is planting and she does it with much patience. She has farmed for 15 years and considers the most difficult part of it protecting the crops from infestations that can damage them. In the future she plans to expand her fields in order to plant more and produce more. This is her 2nd loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her previous repayments and wants to be so again now. She is very committed to her group’s development in the communal bank. She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy more manure to improve the quality of her land.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more manure.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn T. is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old. Jocelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 17 years.

Jocelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies, such as seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Topacio Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “TOPACIO” está solicitando crédito por primera vez, en el Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón, esta asociación se reunirá cada quincena.  La frecuencia de reuniones permite que las integrantes de la asociación se conozcan mejor,  con un riesgo menor, pues generalmente los montos del primer crédito son bajos.   La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora  Luisa  como presidenta, la señora Fabiola como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora María.

La señora  Luisa es una mujer de 30 años de edad, ha sido nombrada  presidenta con la seguridad de que cumplirá con responsabilidad sus funciones.   Con respecto a su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de edredones, desde hace tres años, aprendió el negocio de un tío que también vende el mismo producto.  La señora Luisa solicitó Bs.2000.- , pensando en ampliar el negocio y comprar sábanas, ollas y cosméticos.

Los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación son variados: venta de cosméticos líneas AVON; Yanbal, venta de ropa para niño, venta de verduras venta de ropa, venta de aceite lubricante, venta de ropa deportiva y  tienda de joyas.
texts.en:
The communal bank “TOPACIO” is requesting their first loan  in El Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación.  The group is made up of eight members, seven women and one man.  They meet every two weeks.  The frequency of their meetings allows them to get to know each other better, creating less risk, however, the amounts of first time loans are generally small.  The board consists of Señora Luisa, president, Señora Fabiola, treasurer and Señora Maria as recording secretary.  

Señora Luisa is a 30 year old woman and has been named president with the assurance that she will fulfill her duties responsibly.  She has been selling quilts for a living for the last three years, learning  the business from her uncle who also sells quilts.  Señora Luisa is requesting Bs. 2000 (Bolivianos - Bolivian currency) because she is planning to expand her business and buy sheets, cookware and cosmetics.  

The other members of the group engage in various other activities:  Avon cosmetics sales, Yanbal personal products sales, children's clothing sales, vegetable sales, clothing sales, lubricant sales, athletic clothing sales, and a jewelry store.

loans.use: To purchase sheets, cookware and cosmetics

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz lives in a city called Jaranwala with her family in the area named Kot kabeer, in a 2 room brick house. She is a mother of 2 daughters and 3 sons. All of them are young and don’t go to school because Shahnaz and her husband couldn’t afford their education expenses. 

Her husband has a motorbike rental business. He gives motorbikes on rent to people for specific time periods and charge them on hourly basis. 
He also operates a grocery shop. He has made a room of his house for this purpose and has been operating it for the past 5 years. In his absence, shahnaz operates his business and serves his clients. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s grocery shop business. With the loan, her husband will buy groceries in bulk quantity and improve his grocery business. Shahnaz is hopeful that her husband will make full use of money and improve his business. 

Shahnaz is a regular user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has built a good credit record and never missed any meeting.
 
Note: “In this photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Shahnaz”.

loans.use: To buy groceries fora  grocery shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Lebanese Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents. While his father is the main income provider of the family, the borrower helps him with the heavy family expenses.

Despite his young age, he has owned a curtain shop for five years. With his loan request of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to increase his store’s inventory and offer new curtain designs to his customers. He looks forward to further expanding his business, stating that every year has been better than the year before. He is planning to open a small curtain factory and begin working with some galleries to present his products.

loans.use: To increase his store’s inventory

loans.name: Jesus

texts.en:
Jesus E. describes himself as an active entrepreneur.  His family has background in carpet cleaning and maintenance, which is why he opened J.M. Carpet Care Sale Installation four years ago.  He employs two other people and, through his business, supports his wife and children.  

Jesus E. says this is the first time he has accessed credit. He will use this loan to increase his publicity, and to have in-hand cash flow for one employee.

In the future, Jesus would like to make enough profits to be able to rely on his business for financial independence.  He would like to get a house, have his own equipment, and eventually buy a bigger company – like a restaurant.  He thinks that will take him about five years.

Jesus E. advises new business owners to really research how businesses work.  He says a lot of people that want to start a business are very excited.  But when they go to open the business, there are a lot of legal processes they’re not aware of.  So he advises them to focus 100% on their business for a good year.  It took him that long to establish a good foundation for his business.

Jesus E. is proud of his knowledge and experience, because it means he can offer the best service to his clients.  He is proud of being professionally independent, and driving his own schedule.

loans.use: Increased publicity and in-hand cash flow for one employee

loans.name: Mariya

texts.ru: Кулиева Мария проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет 6 детей. Муж вместе с двумя сыновьями находится на заработках в России. Сама Мария имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается торговлей. Зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Она покупает недорого бычков и продает по более выгодной цене. В этом ей помогает сын. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота. Таким образом, Мария хочет увеличить их количества и улучшить финансовое положение в семье.
texts.en: Mariya K. lives in Yavan.  She is 53 years old, married, and has six children.  Her husband and two sons work in Russia. Maria has a high school education.  She has been working in sales for more than ten years.  She makes a living selling cattle.  She buys calves cheaply and resells for a profit.  Her son helps her.   She is taking out a loan to buy cattle.  Maria wants to expand her herd and thereby improve her family’s finances.

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora A. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Leonora is married and has 12 adult children. To make a living, Leonora owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & junk food in the local community. She also makes and sells snacks like rice cakes. Leonora has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leonora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Leonora is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk food & biscuits. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like junk food & biscuits

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma B. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old. Norma is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twelve years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Norma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 1st loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Revelita Domingo's Group

texts.en:
Revelita D. is from the village of Pulay, Luna, Isabela. She is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Revelita is is 52 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Revelita owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Revelita has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Revelita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Revelita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her sixth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
El Comité Santa Catalina se conformó en fecha 28 Junio del 2010, se encuentran en el 2°ciclo en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Además del trabajo independiente de cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin de contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la de trabajar para apoyar económicamente  a sus familias especialmente.
Una historia muy conmovedora es la de la Sra. Reina B. quien se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas, nos comenta que mediante el crédito pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y nivel de vida e ingreso económico.
La Sra. Reina mencionó que la actividad realizada por la Fundación Paraguaya es muy importante ya que ella nunca encontró esta clase de espacio en otro lado por ser pobre.
texts.en:
The Santa Catalina committee was established on June 28th, 2010.  The group are in their second loan cycle and are working supportively together within the program.

In addition to each member's own business activity, they carry out activities as a group in order to raise funds so that the group itself has some capital.  They also help each other to achieve their goals.  One of their main goals is to work so that they can financially support their families.

Reina B. has a very touching story.  Reina buys and sells clothes.  She tells us that through her loan she was able to improve her business, her standard of living and her income.  She mentions that Fundación Paraguaya's work is very important.  She comments that because she is poor she never found this kind of space before.

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, shorts, pants, blouses and towels

loans.name: Angela Ubilvida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

La señora Angela es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta por el apoyo para cualquier actividad y por la responsabilidad del personal. Tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos, tres de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y una linda jovencita de 17 años que está en colegio, dos de sus hijos viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.

Este crédito es para el negocio del esposo que es quien mantiene su hogar, ella le ayuda asistiendo a las reuniones y nos cuenta que esta es su forma de contribuir al hogar. El se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres,  
hay días que trabaja en el mercado de tosagua y otros que recorre con sus productos por toda la localidad en su carro. Trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 14h00, también se dedica a la compra y venta de plátano. Lo que es fruta y legumbres los compra en el mercado mayorista y a agricultores de la zona ya que le salen más baratos.

Este crédito es para comprar plátano, frutas y legumbres. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de abarrotes y ganar más dinero para ayudar mas en los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
In the city of Tosagua, the Communal Bank Esperanza Nueva meets every fortnight.  This place is known for being very dynamic where most people work in agriculture and animal husbandry, being an area with abundant vegetation.

Angela is a founding member of the communal bank and she is liked for her support for any activity and her personal responsibility.  She is 45 years old, married, and has 4 children from this marriage.  Three of the children are already grown and her youngest, a pretty 17-year-old girl, is in high school.  Two of her children live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

This loan is for her husband's business, as he maintains their home.  She helps him to attend meetings and she tells us that this is her way of contributing to the household.  She sells fruits and vegetables.  There are days when she works in the markets of Tosagua and other places and travels all over town with their products in her car.  She works everyday from 5 am till 2 pm and is also engaged in buying and selling plantains.  She purchases the fruit and vegetables in the wholesale market and from local farmers, as it is cheaper.

This loan is to buy plantains, fruits, and vegetables.  Her dreams are to have a grocery store and to make more money to help with household expenses.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, plantains and other fruits.

loans.name: Consolatrix

texts.en:
Consolatrix B. is from the village of Pob. Manukan. She is 56 years old. Consolatrix is married with two adult-aged children. Consolatrix owns and operates a specialized retail store (sari-sari store). The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Consolatrix has had her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Consolatrix joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her sari-sari store. This loan will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya lives in Jaranwala, a small city of Punjab Pakistan that is known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 8 years. 

She is the mother of 4 sons and a daughter. Her sons do different kind of work to contribute to the family's finances. Her daughter, who is 14 years old, is only able to attend school and is studying in the 8th class. 

Ruqqiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to expand her milk-selling business by purchasing another buffalo. She started operating this business after the death of her husband a few years ago. Now the business is well established as Ruqqiya has a good number of clients in her community who buy milk from her due to the milk's freshness and good quality. She is hopeful that by purchasing another buffalo, her business will grow due to increased productivity of milk and her ability to serve more clients. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she paid her installments on time and never missed a single meeting.

Note:  In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ruqqiya.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene E. is from the village of El Salvador, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old. Marlene is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Marlene owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling rice per kilogram, beverages, snack foods, canned goods, shampoo & biscuits in the local community. Marlene has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marlene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marlene from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & snack foods.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Lucia, es casada y tiene 50 años de edad,  la socia tiene 10 hijos de los cuales 7 están vivos, la socia aún apoya a 5 hijos  (20, 18, 16, 15, 10) años de edad; La socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, ella tiene este pequeño negocio en casa y así mismo la socia posee tierras agrícolas en las cuales produce papa, maíz y verduras. La socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la alimentación de sus animalitos, ella cría pollos, gallinas, cuyes, y las verduras que le producen sus tierras las vende al por mayor en la feria a los compradores mayoristas que llegan para comprar toda la cosecha de los pobladores y llevárselas al exterior del país. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y comprar animales menores.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucia is a member of the Communal Bank “San Martin de Zurite” which is located in the town of Zurite in Anta Province, Department of Cusco.

She is 50 years old, married, and has 10 children but only 7 are living. Lucia supports five of them (ages 20, 18, 16, 15, and 10). She raises farm animals and has a small business in her home. Lucia also has farmland on which she grows potatoes, corn, and vegetables. She needs a loan to invest in the feeding of her animals. Lucia raises chickens, hens, and guinea pigs. The vegetables that are produced on her land are sold in bulk at the fair to wholesalers who come to acquire the entire harvest of the villagers in order to sell the produce abroad. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and farm animals.

Lucia appreciates and values the loan that has been provided to her. For this reason, she promises to complete her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and farm animals.

loans.name: Melona

texts.en:
Melona is 30 years old and is a married woman. She has six children, the oldest of whom is 18 years old.

Melona is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for 15 years. She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. Melona works hard to sustain her family. She hopes for her farming business to grow.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is from the village of Mapulog, Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 51 years old. Susan is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, junk foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. She is also providing karaoke services. Susan has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, beverages and biscuits. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, beverages and biscuits.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 57-year-old married woman living in the village of Nagbukel San Isidro. She has four children and all of them have their own families already. She is grateful because her business is improving.

She earns about PHP 20,000 every time she sells 12 hogs every three months. Teresita does her best in order to maintain her hog raising business. According to her, the profits she generated were used in the maintenance of her fishpond. She also used some amount for their daily needs. Teresita has been in the business for two years and still she would like to develop it. Because she doesn't have enough capital for her fattening hogs, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 18,000. She plans to use this loan to purchase feed, supplies and vaccine for the hogs and some will be used to maintain her fishpond.

In the future, Teresita hopes to buy additional fingerlings and produce more piglets so that she can improve their way of living and save for security purposes when they get weak.

loans.use: to buy feed, supplies and vaccine

loans.name: Nastanzia

texts.en:
Nastanzia is 48 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are currently in school. Nastanzia has a grocery business selling food, which she has run for ten years.
To help expand her business, Nastanzia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Nastanzia hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

Ruth sells fruits and vegetables. She has done so for seven years, working seven days a week. Ruth sells her produce at retail at the market. She also rents rooms. Her main business challenges include seasonality and defaulters.

Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches and clusters of yellow Cavendish bananas. Her goal for her business is to start going directly to farmers for her yellow bananas to sell.

loans.use: To buy more bunches and clusters of Cavendish bananas.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en: Kan, 54 year old, is a weaver. Her husband is a farmer. Their income is $6 per day. She has five children. None of the children is studying, but three are working in a factory. Every month she has to spend $43 on food, $5 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $5 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $400 to buy agriculture material for sowing mushroom to sell so that she can make more income to support her family. She expects that all of her children will get a good job to do in the future and will be able to take care of themselves and her too.

loans.use: To buy agriculture material for sowing mushroom to sell

loans.name: Maria Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 27 años de edad, está casada y  es madre de un pequeño bebe de 6 meses de edad. Maritza vive en una comunidad pequeña y rural perteneciente al distrito de Catacaos en Piura. Este distrito es conocido por ser zona de orfebres y por la buena comida que hay en él.

Maritza es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la preparación y venta de chicha de Jora. Esta es una bebida fermentada hecha a base del maíz de Jora, que tiene gran acogida en la zona norte del Perú. Maritza realiza esta actividad en su propio domicilio desde hace 4 años y cuenta con clientela establecida en la zona donde vive.

Maritza solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar los insumos requeridos para la elaboración de la chicha y harina, como el maíz en sí. Además, parte del crédito será destinada a la compra de aves de corral, que comenzará a criar para tener ganancias adicionales.
 
Maritza tiene muchos deseos de superación, ella desea desarrollar su negocio adecuadamente para darle una buena vida y educación a su pequeño hijo. Este crédito le sería de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Maritza is 27. She is the married mother of a little 6-month-old baby. Maritza lives in a small rural community belonging to the Catacaos district in Piura. This district is known for being an area with many smithies, and for the good food one can find there.

Maritza is an enterprising woman who makes and sells Chicha de Jora. This is a fermented drink with a Jora corn base, favoured in northern Peru. Maritza has done this work in her own home for four years, and has an established customer base in her neighbourhood.

Maritza is requesting a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of the required supplies for making the Chicha; as well as flour, and corn. Furthermore, part of this loan will be used to buy barnyard birds, which she will start raising in order to obtain an additional income.

Maritza has a great desire to succeed. She wants to develop her business enough to give her little child a good life and education. This loan will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making chicha; and barnyard birds.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is 38 years old, married, and has five children. His has a motorcycle business. He is applying for his third loan from Kiva partner, KADET, to buy another motorcycle to add to the one in operation. He will use the profits made to add stock to his wife's retail shop as she also assists him in maintaining the family financially. He hopes to own a transport company in the future.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Lisbeht

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LAS MARGARITAS DE OCONGATE”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Ocongate, en la Provincia de Quispicanchis y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la señora Lisbeht; la socia es conviviente y tiene  21 años de edad, la socia tiene 1 hijo; la socia trabaja en la atención de su librería, la socia tiene una pequeña librería y ella administra y atiende su librería, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de cuadernos, papel lustre, útiles escolares como lapiceros, pinceles, borradores, colores entre otros; La socia solicita comprar materiales de librería así como papel lustre, von, lapiceros entre otros.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “LAS MARGARITAS DE OCONGATE” communal bank. The bank is located in the District of Ocongate, in Quispicanchis Province in Cusco Department.

This member is Señora Lisbeht. She lives in a common-law marriage, is 21 years old and has 1 child.  She has a small bookstore that she manages. She needs a loan to buy notebooks, lustre paper, bond paper and other school supplies such as ballpoint pens, paintbrushes, erasers and paints among others.

Lisbeht is grateful for the support provided her and is committed to making her payments on time

loans.use: to buy bookstore supplies such as lustre paper, bond, ballpoint pens among other items.

loans.name: Rahmonali

texts.ru:
Рахмонали более 12 лет занимается скотоводством. Он честный, умный и добросовестный человек.  Он женат и у них 3 детей. Он занимается купля продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он научил свой бизнес от отца и дедушки. Раньше они занимались, а Рахмонали наблюдал и помогал им.  Рахмонали хочет расширить данный бизнес, чтобы получить максимум прибыли. Он хочет обеспечить свою семью и содержит их в хороших условиях жизни. В этом бизнесе помогает ему его жена и сын. Рахмонали хочет покупать скота, чтобы расширить свой бизнес для получения прибыли. С этой целью он запрашивает займ в размере 1200$ США. Рахмонали благодарен Киве и Кива кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрения.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Rahmonali has been involved in animal husbandry for over 12 years.  He is an honest, smart and conscientious person.  He is married and has three children.  He is involved in buying and selling cattle and learned this business from his father and grandfather.  They used to be in this business before, and Rahmonali observed and helped them.  Rahmonali wants to expand this business in order to make a maximum profit.  He wants to provide for his family and maintain good living conditions for them.  His wife and son help him in this business.  Rahmonali wants to buy livestock in order to expand his business and make a profit.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $1200 for this purpose.  Rahmonali is grateful to Kiva and Kiva creditors for their support and help.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Gladis Antonia

texts.es:
La Señora Gladis es de la ciudad de Santaní, ella tiene una Ropería y Zapatería en la zona del Mercado Municipal. Se define como una mujer muy emprendedora, trabajadora y creativa. Vivió por mucho tiempo en el extranjero de donde trajo un poco de capital y abrió para su puesto de trabajo.
Comenta que le llevo mucho esfuerzo y trabajo lograr lo que ha tenido hasta hoy, pero manifiesta que seguirá trabajando duramente para poder seguir creciendo y expandiendo su negocio. Dice que todo lo que realiza es por ayudar a su familia, ya que desea darles lo mejor y que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades. Una de sus metas es tener una gran tienda donde pueda atraer a mas clientes y con ello aumentar sus ingresos. Su objetivo es mantener este negocio y así poder solventarse, desea tener todos los artículos de primera necesidad, para que sus clientes encuentren todos en este lugar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas que posteriormente va a vender. Está con las esperanzas puestas en el crédito, pues de obtenerlo le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Gladis is from the city of Santaní.  She has a clothing and shoe business in the Mercado Municipal neighborhood.  She defines herself as a very enterprising, hard-working, and creative woman.  She lived abroad for a long time.  She brought capital from abroad, and she used it to open the stall where she works.

She says that it took a lot of effort and work to achieve what she has had as of today.  She states that she will continue working hard in order to be able to continue growing and expanding her business.  She says that everything she does is to help her family.  She wishes to give them the best so that they do not experience any type of privation.

One of her goals is to have a large store where she could attract more customers, which would increase her income.  Her objective is to maintain this business and be able to pay for her expenses.  She wishes to have all of the basic needs items so that her customers find everything at her place. 

She is requesting the loan to buy garments that she will later sell.  She hopes for the loan because getting it will be very useful to her.

loans.use: to buy garments to later sell.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is a resident of Kitale in Western Kenya. He is 49 and married with five children, the youngest of whom are school-going age. He has been farming for 10 years and currently produces maize and milk for the local market. He also works as a carpenter.

Emanuel has requested a loan of 31,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. He says with the experience he has in dairy farming, the loan will improve his farming income so he can cater for the education and needs of his children.

Emanuel laments hostile weather conditions and poor market prices for farm products as limitations in a farming business. He is glad, however, that Juhudi Kilimo provides farmers with loans.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is married and blessed with four children, all of whom attend school. He has been tailoring to earn a living. He is also employed. He has retained his business because of a good reputation with his customers. He has employed two people to help him manage the business. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a sewing machine. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to manage the business with a previous loan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Delgerbuyant

texts.en: Mr. Delgerbuyant is 23 years old and lives with his wife and son in a house which is located in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He works as an electrician for a construction company. His monthly income cannot meet his necessary expenses. Delgerbuyant wants his son to grow up in good living conditions, so recently he made some adjustments to his house and changed the design of his house's rooms. Now he needs to buy some new furniture for his home. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of new furniture.

loans.use: To cover the cost of new furniture.

loans.name: La Estancia (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Estancia está formado por nueve socias y un socio quienes son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón muy cálido, trabajan en diferentes actividades y en especial en trabajos del campo, como se desempeñan en diferentes actividades estas les permiten aportar a la economía de su hogar y salir  adelante con sus familias. Viven por los alrededores del cantón Paute (Cuenca), cantón que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus paisajes y tiene varios lugares para visitar, su clima que es muy cálido, tiene variedad en su gastronomía típica y su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Janeth, tiene 27 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad que están estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Janeth se desempeña en cualquier trabajo que le den ya que hay días que le llaman a trabajar en la agricultura, pelando pollos o cualquier otro trabajo. En su casa se dedica a la cría y venta de cuyes y pollos.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para ampliar su criadero.
 
Su meta es tener un galpón mas grande de cuyes.
texts.en:
The members of the La Estancia communal bank, nine women and one man, are agreeable, gentle, and warm-hearted people.  They work in different jobs, especially agricultural work.  Since they work in various activities, they are able to contribute to the household economy and get ahead with their families.  They live in the environs of Paute canton (Cuenca), a canton known for its beautiful landscape, several places to visit, warm climate, variety in its typical cuisine, and people who maintain the culture and traditions of their communities.

One of the members of this group is Janeth, 27.  She lives with her common-law husband and has conceived two children, ages 6 and 4, who study in a school in the community.  Her husband works as a private employee, and the house in which she lives is her own property.
 
Janeth does whatever job she is given, since there are days when she works in agriculture, plucking chickens or any other job.  At home she works raising and selling guinea pigs and chickens.

She has been a member of the communal bank for five years, and with her new loan she will buy guinea pigs to expand her breeding.
 
Her goal is to have a larger guinea pig shed.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Maristela

texts.es:
La señora Maristela tiene 40 años D. edad, es madre soltera D. un hijo.

Ella se dedica a la costura D. ropa y a la elaboración D. pupusas. Hace tres años su esposo dejo el hogar y desD. entonces, Maristela trabaja para mantener a su hijo y a sus padres que ya estan ancianos.

Maristela con la ayuda D. su hermana, venden todos los días por la tarD. pupusas y en el transcurso del día se dedica a la costura D. ropa. Ella aprendió la costura gracias a sus padres ya que la enviaron a una academia para que aprendiera hace 16 años y eso es lo que ahora representa una fuente D. ingresos para ella y su familia. Los insumos para elaborar las pupusas las adquiere en el lugar más cercano a su vivienda, para luego regresar a su casa y elaborarlas.

Maristela solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar cemento, arena, entre otros materiales y construir un tapial perimetral, para mantener segura y protegida su vivienda, ya que su papá elabora cultivos y estos estarán más seguros. Mas adelante ella espera construir su propia casa junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Maristela is 40 years old.  She is a single mother and has one son.

Maristela sews clothes and makes pupusas.  Her husband left her three years ago and, since then, Maristela has worked to support her son and her parents who are now elderly.

With the help of her sister, Maristela sells pupusas every afternoon and, during the day, she sews clothes.  She learned how to sew thanks to her parents as they sent her to a school to learn 16 years ago and now this has become a source of income for her and her family.  She acquires the supplies she uses to make her pupusas from the closest place to her home.  She then returns home and makes them.

Maristela is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy cement, sand and other materials in order to build a perimeter wall to keep her home safe and protected.  Her dad grows vegetables and these will be safer.  In the future, Maristela hopes to build her own house together with her family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and other materials to build a perimeter wall

loans.name: Norka Irasema

texts.es:
Norka Irasema nació en la  ciudad de Puerto Maldonado y ahora vive en la ciudad D. Cusco. Norka Irasema tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera. Norka Irasema desarrolla sus actividades cotidianas y económicas en la ciudad D. Cusco.   

Norka Irasema se dedica a la venta de ropa, ella compra su mercadería de diferentes ciudades como por ejemplo de Tacna y Lima y después los vende o distribuye en la ciudad D. Cusco a sus amigos, a familiares, a compañeros de estudio y a otras personas. A Norka Irasema su pequeño negocio no le quita mucho tiempo pues el tiempo restante lo emplea para estudiar la carrera profesional de contabilidad de una de las universidades particulares de la ciudad D. Cusco y ya está cursando el tercer semestre. 

Norka Irasema pertenece al banco comunal “Ñahupacman Purisun” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad D. Cusco y en esta oportunidad requiere Norka Irasema el préstamo para comprar ropa. 

Norka Irasema se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Norka Irasema was born in Puerto Maldonado and now lives in Cusco.  She is 27 years old and single.  Norka carries out her daily economic activities in Cusco, making her living selling clothing.  

She buys her merchandise from different cities such as Tacna and Lima and then sells or distributes them in Cusco to her friends and family, her classmates and others.  Norka's small business doesn't take away too much time from her schedule, as she uses her remaining time studying accounting at one of Cusco's universities.  She is already in her third semester. 

Norka Irasema belongs to the local bank "Ñahupacman Purisun" of the Cusco Aririwa Association and at this time she needs the loan to purchase clothing.  Norka is thankful for the opportunity offered to her through this channel, and in turn is committed to fulfilling her obligations and the timetable to which they correspond.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
Ida tiene 47 años, vive en la compañía de su esposo y sus 5 hijos, a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Azapampa. Desde hace 17 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte, su esposo es el conductor del carro que esta inscrita en una línea de taxis de su comunidad. Su trabajo es de todos los días, pues desde las primeras horas del día hasta el anochecer recorre las diversas calles de su ciudad. Pero como todos, se da un espacio para comer; ha optado por realizar este negocio a raíz de que las ganancias son mucho mas rentables y hay mucha necesidad de este servicio en su zona. Por lo que ha optado en  realizar este servicio con calidad manteniendo su carro en buen estado, para lo cual frecuentemente realiza el mantenimiento, reparación y compra de nuevos repuestos, en la actualidad tiene en su propiedad el auto y también 2 ómnibus de las que actualmente conducen 2 de sus hijos en las rutas locales. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los héroes al progreso” y este es el noveno crédito con MFP, donde se siente realizada, por ello promete una vez más ser puntual en sus pagos. 
Ida de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de mantenimiento de su auto. Para que pueda trabajar con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Ida is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and 5 children who she cares for in her own home, located in Azapampa. 

For 17 years she’s provided transportation services. Her husband is a driver who is registered in a fleet of taxis in their community. She works every day. She drives the many streets of his city from the early hours of the day until dusk. But like everyone else, she is given a place to eat. She has chosen this business because it is profitable and there is a great need for this service in her area. Since she has chosen to provide this service with high standards, she keeps her car in good condition. For that reason she often does upkeep, makes repairs, and buys spares parts. Right now she own the car and also 2 omnibuses which are currently driver by two of her children on local routes. 

Ida belongs to the group “Los Héroes Al Progreso” (Heroes in Progress), and this is the ninth loan with MFP where she feels satisfied. For that reason she promises to once again be punctual in her loan payments. Upon receiving help, Ida will invest the requested many into the funding of maintenance for her car in order to work with peace of mind.

loans.use: to pay the mechanic for auto maintenance

loans.name: Janet Kaniki

texts.en: Janet, 31 years old, is a single woman. She has no children yet.  For the past one year, she has been selling mobile phones, phone accessories, and providing phone charging services.  In addition, she is employed as a Safaricom agent. Sometimes in her business she faces a challenge of delayed operation from the Safaricom company when doing money transactions. She will use the loan KES 20,000 to purchase phone accessories.   Janet's hopes and dreams is to run several similar stores in the next five years.

loans.use: buy phone accessories

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua lives together with her husband and four children in Nkrontrodo, near Elmina. She sells bread, eggs and soft drinks and uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of their family and home.

Efua will use her loan of 800 GHS to buy more soft drinks, eggs and bread to sell. With her increased profits, Efua will grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, eggs and bread to sell.

loans.name: Mignonnoui Group
