texts.fr: Le groupe MIGNONNOUI est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie Julie Monsoi (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 49 ans. Marie Julie Monsoi n'a pas fréquenté l'école mais a appris la photographie, activité qu'elle exerce depuis vingt trois ans dans sa région. Marie Julie Monsoi est mariée à un certain Joseph. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Marie Julie Monsoi et son mari. Pour cette raison, parallèlement à son activité, Marie Julie Monsoi vend divers accessoires de photographie, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Marie Julie Monsoi s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Marie Julie Monsoi sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe MIGNONNOUI, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter divers accessoires de photographie.

loans.name: Aljon

texts.en: Aljon is 20 years old, single and lives with his family and siblings in Gata Daku, Clarin. Aljon owns and operates a transportation transport service  for a couple of years to earn a living. He had support the family's daily needs with this income aside from working in a private company. After his work, he does transportation services to earn . Recently, he took a new loan of 15,000.00 to buy tires and repair his  motorcycle to commute between his work and in other village in town. He plans to buy sidecar for his motor for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: To purchase a new set of tires and for maintenance.

loans.name: Ema Saa

texts.en: Ema is a single mother with 6 children to cater for. She is 52 years and owner of a popular fast food joint in her community. The business has been in operation for 6 years now. Having used a greater part of her capital to upgrade the joint to the level required by city authorities, the finances are low. She would therefore like KIVA to assist her with the loan to recapitalize her operations.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jane would like to buy utensils, timber, nails and iron sheets to put up a small restaurant

loans.name: Merardo

texts.en:
Merardo is a 40-year-old father of three daughters. He talks with pride about how he gets up at 2 a.m. every morning to heat the water he sells to people to make mate, a popular drink in Paraguay that requires special preparation to give it its unique taste. His main clients consist of carriers whose route crosses in front of his home. Two of his daughters have successfully completed their studies and today have bright futures thanks to the income Merardo earns. His wife supports him unconditionally. He also runs a snack stand selling empanadas, fried steak, and other foods, and plans to start selling fish as well, since he has a freezer where he can store them. Merardo is a hard working and dedicated person who deserves your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunter

Merardo tiene 40 años, es casado,tiene 3 hijas.Cuenta con orgullo que se levanta todos los días a las 2 de la mañana para calentar el agua que luego vende a las personas que la utilizan para la preparación del mate. Comenta que el mate es una bebida que se toma mucho en el Paraguay y que tiene una preparación muy especial en base a remedios que le dan un agradable sabor. Sus principales clientes lo constituyen los transportistas que se desplazan por la ruta que cruza frente a su casa. Dos de sus hijas lograron culminar sus estudios y hoy día son flamantes docentes gracias al ingreso que Merardo genera con sus ventas. Su esposa lo ayuda incondicionalmente, también tiene un pequeño copetín en donde vende empanadas, milanesas y otros tipos de comestibles. Planea comprar pescados para poder venderlos posteriormente ya que tiene una congeladora en donde podría almacenarlos. Es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora.

loans.use: Purchase fish

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Mr. Charles U. has been a LAPO member for 5 years.  He lives in Ewa Road, Off Ikpoba Slop, Benin City, Edo State.  He states that LAPO has been a sources of income to his business and has helped improve his business and pay for his three children to go to school.  He hopes to expand his business with the above loan.

loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 43 years old and has four children, including a daughter who has a child of her own. She also takes care of her niece, because her sister left the child with her when she went to the States. Her husband left her, so she is the sole provider for her household but her children and her mother help her run her store.

Maria runs a small grocery store selling essential foods such as rice, fruit, and vegetables. She also sells over-the-counter medicines, which she buys from a pharmacy in in the capital, Santo Domingo. She is a continuing client. With her profits so far, she has been able to purchase wood to repair her house, instead of tin. This loan will go to expand her inventory.

Maria is the president of a local “mothers’ club”, a group of 36 women who are involved in various things in the community, including trying to build a school in her area of Los Alcarrizos.

loans.use: Purchase staples as well as medicine for her store

loans.name: Ricardina

texts.pt:
Ricardina is married and mother of 3. She lives in Maxine in the province in the Inhume. She joined the credit program in 2006. Her first loan was of 3.000, 00mt. She sells kitchenware at the market. Since business is doing well she wants to start selling clothes and shoes as well. Ricardina’s husband in unemployed but works odd jobs to help provide for the family. One of her sons is going to school and the other 2 are still small. Ricardina supports her family with the income fromt he business.

Translated from Portuguese Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Ricardina e casad e mae de 3 filhos. Ela vive na Maxixe, provincia de Inhambane. Ricardina entrou para o programa de credito em 2006. O primeiro emprestimo foi de 3.000,00 Mt. Ela vende a sua loica no mercado.Porque o negocio lhe esta a correr bem ela introduziu tambem a venda de alguma roupa e algum calcado. Ela esta no setimo ciclo.O marido de Ricardina nao esta empregado vive de pequenos expedientes para sustentar sua familia. Dos filhos de Ricardina apenas um vai a escola os outros dois ainda sao pequenos. Mas logo que estes tenham idade serao matriculados. Com os rendimentos Ricardina ajuda o marido nas despesas da casa.

loans.use: Ricardina will use the loan to increase her inventory and also buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Obertilia

texts.es:
Mrs. Obertila belongs to the Lideres Triunfadoras (Triumphant Leaders) communal bank, and lives in the Calleria district of Ucayali, Peru. She is 49 years old, and a mother of two grown children. Her husband works, but his income does not cover the household expenses. That’s why Obertila invested her first loan from Manuela Ramos for S./300.00 in a small sewing shop where she makes women’s, men’s, and children’s clothing. Currently Obertila and her husband wake up very early to prepare breakfast and clean up the house. Then she opens the sewing shop and devotes herself to sewing the garments her customers ordered, as well as others to be sold in the store. With this loan for $750 that she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in expanding her business by purchasing a new sewing machine, a mending machine that will give her garments a better finish, as well as fabrics, threads of every color, elastic bands, lace, etc.

Obertila is very pleased, she told us, because she celebrated her birthday in the company of her friends at the communal bank and with her loved ones. She is overflowing with happiness at her good fortune to be part of Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Obertila pertenece al Banco Comunal Lideres Triunfadoras, vive en el Asentamiento Humano 15 de Julio Mz. H Lt. 11 del distrito Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos independientes, su esposo trabaja como empleado, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos del hogar, es así que Obertila, con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300.00, decide invertir en un pequeño taller de costura, donde confecciona prendas para damas, caballeros y niños. Actualmente Obertila, junto con su esposo, se levantan muy temprano para preparar el desayuno, posteriormente realiza el aseo de su casa para después abrir su taller de costura y dedicarse a la confección de sus prendas, ya que trabaja con pedidos y también de forma particular para la venta casual. Con el préstamo de S/. 2.200, el cual pagará en 6 meses, invertirá en la ampliación de su negocio, ya que comprará una maquina de coser, una remalladora que le permita dar un mejor acabado de sus prendas, destinará S/. 200 en telas, S/. 50 en toda variedad de colores de hilo, S/. 20 en elásticos y S/. 20 en blondas, etc. Obertila, se siente muy feliz por que nos contó que celebró su cumpleaños con sus compañeras de su banco comunal y los seres que mas quiere, desbordando alegría por la suerte que tiene al estar en Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware (sewing machine, mender). Purchase of materials (fabric, thread, elastic, lace).

loans.name: Seray

texts.en: Seray B. is 35 years old and married, with five children.  Her husband has an irregular salary and could not meet the family expenses.  She started the business to support the family but the business is at a very small scale due to lack of capital.  Seray will complete her current loan repayment in January and would like to take another loan to further expand the business.

loans.use: Seray runs a small general store and would like to expand the business so she can better care for her family.

loans.name: Hom

texts.en: Mrs. Hom C., 51, is the mother of 6 children. She is a housewife, who looks after her home and cooks for her family. Mrs. C. also works as a farmer growing a variety of vegetables in order to generate an income. She earns about $1 a day. Her husband, Mr. Yu Leng, works as a high school teacher, and makes an average of $3.50 a day. One of her childrean works in Phnom Penh City as a garment worker, and earns around $50 a month. With this loan, the couple hopes to purchase, breed, and resell pigs. They will use the money they earn to pay back their loan, and create a new business with their profit.

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase pigs to breed.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha lives on Pucara Grande street, in the Juana Azurduv de Padilla zone of the city of El Alto.

Since her husband abandoned them, she lives alone with her two children aged 15 and 10. This is a very common situation within the poorer segment of Bolivia’s population.

Martha works selling food from a location she rents in the city of El Alto, thus providing the only means of sustenance for her and her children.

The loan would be used to buy ingredients at wholesale, helping her to reduce her daily expenses.

It is the first loan with IMPRO, and the financial evaluation conducted indicates that she qualifies for the loan. Also, we think that this type of person is who we should help given she has no other choice but to work to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Martha vive en la calle Pucara Grande de la zona Juana Azurduy de Padilla ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive solo junto a sus dos hijos de 15 y 10 años respectivamente, ya que su esposo hizo abandono del hogar. Esta es una situación muy común entre este segmento de la gente pobre en Bolivia. Martha trabaja en la venta de comida en un local que alquila en la ciudad de El Alto, constituyéndose esta actividad en su única fuente de ingresos para sostener sus hijos y a ella misma. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ingredientes por mayor, ya que esto reduciría sus gastos en compras diarias. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo, además de que pensamos que este tipo de cliente es aquel al que deberíamos ayudar, porque no tiene otra alternativa que trabajar para sostener a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase supplies/ingredients at wholesale for her small restaurant.

loans.name: Sumangul

texts.ru:
Sumangul Abdulloevna D. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 43 years old, married and has three children. She has secondary education. Sumangul has been in the clothing retail business for the past 9 years. She has a vendor space on the market in Vahdat. Her small business profits allow her to support and take care of her children. At this time, she wants to buy seasonal clothing and needs a loan. By increasing the variety of her merchandise, she will have better profits. She will also provide the residents with a quality and inexpensive merchandise. Sumangul plans to pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Давлатова Сумангул Абдуллоевна проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 43 года, замужем, имеет 3 детей.Образование среднее. Сумангул уже 9 лет занимается купле продажей одежды. На рынке города Вахдат она имеет торговую точку. От прибыли , которую приносит ее небольшой бизнес Сумангул может воспитывать и растить своих детей. В данное время клиентка хочет закупить сезонную одежду и поэтому решила взять кредит . Увеличив ассортимент товара Сумангул может получить хорошую прибыль.Тем самым предоставит жителям Вахдата качественную и не дорогую продукцию. Сумангул планирует погасить кредит в течении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the variety of merchandise

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy O. is 41 years old, married, and has 7 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria, and earns income selling provisions and drinks. Dorothy learnt this trade from her sister for two months and started her own business three years ago. She now needs a loan of US$450 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale to be able to meet her customers' demand.

loans.use: Purchase of provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica A. sells fabric and mobile phone airtime transfers. She is single, and her income is not sufficient for Veronica and her child. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 38 year-old Ester P.. She is married and has four children, aged between 9 and 14. In 2007, Ester established her genge business. Ester requires a loan in order to buy more utensils. She thanks you for your support.

The Swahili word for this type of outside shop, or stall, is genge. A genge is usually a very basic structure made of wood, with a tin roof, which sells general items such as onions, tomatoes, chilli, oil, rice, and dried fish. It is the kind of place local people usually send their children running to fetch something when they are in the middle of cooking the evening meal, and don’t have time to go all the way to the market to buy the missing ingredient.

loans.use: To buy more utensils.

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa E. sells yams, tomatoes, and beans at the market. Her income as a single parent is not sufficient for Adwowa and her 6 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Noureddine

texts.en: Noureddine, a 37-year-old married man, father of 7 children, lives in a village in the Northern Bekaa. He owns a poultry butcher shop. His willpower and enthusiasm have helped his business grow every day. He has started to distribute chicken to a large number of restaurants and markets in the region. Presently he needs the amount of US$ 1,200 to improve the shop decoration. This is the first time that Noureddine is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Improve the shop decoration

loans.name: Zamira

texts.en: Zamira K. lives in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and she is married. She has been an executive and reliable client of MicroInvest since the end of 2007. She recommended herself as a non-problem client who has not had a problem with the previous loan repayment and trusts the MicroInvest loan procedures. She is engaged in commercial services and trade. She has a business in selling food products (sweets, sugar and jams, etc). Mrs. K. works in a bazaar where she has a wide assortment of goods and many permanent clients. Being the straight supplier she has the opportunity to work with clients of different income levels and she is very experienced in the business. But working in bazaar she meets strong completion which is why she wants to widen her existing assortment. Now she is requesting a loan of 4000 STJ to support her business by growing her existing assortment.

loans.use: Zamira would like to widen her existing assortment of goods for her shop.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 38 años de edad, es casada, madre de cuatro hijos, estudió el tercer año de secundaria y vive en el Sector Orccomplaya del C.P. Uros Chulluni del distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno.
 
Es socia del Banco Comunal “Melchorita Saravia II” en Puno. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 aumentó su capital para comprar artesanías, negocio que empezó hace muchos años, desde los 5 años de edad. En la actualidad continua vendiendo en la Isla Los Uros.

Con este crédito de S/. 500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará bordados en bayeta para continuar con su negocio de artesanías.

Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio para tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old, married and a mother of four, she studied until third grade, junior high, and lives in Sector Orccomplaya of C.P. Uros Chulluni of the district, province, and department of Puno.

She is a partner of "Banco Comunal Melchorita Saravia II" in Puno. With the initial loan of S/.300 she increased her capital to buy crafts, a business she started many years ago at the age of 5. Presently she continues selling on the island "Los Uros".

With this loan of S/.500 to be repaid in 4 payments, she will buy baize embroideries to continue with her business of crafts. It is her wish to move ahead with her business to increase earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baize embroideries.

loans.name: Magda Ivania

texts.es: Doña Magda habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Laureles Sur, tiene 63 años de edad,  con un hijo mayor de edad, trabaja y la ayuda, la Sra. Magda trabaja en manualidades pero también recibe una pensión de jubilada, su experiencia son quince años, lo cual comenzó con fondos propios del salario que ella ganaba con su trabajo, ahora sus dificultades son el no poder trabajar el tiempo completo ya que abecés le duelen sus manos y no trabaja ese día, hasta que le pasa el dolor, con esta solicitud seria la séptima que  hace en nuestra institución de Afodenic, lo cual ha logrado hacer mejoras a su vivienda y desea con este préstamo hacer el frente de su casa ya que una parte la tiene con lamina de zinc, lo cual desea estar un poco mas segura de la delincuencia. A largo plazo desea invertir en su negocio para obtener ganancias y ayudar a su único hijo.
texts.en:
Magda lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of the capital of Managua. She is 63 years old, and has a grown-up son who works and helps her. Magda works as a craftswoman, and receives a retirement pension as well. She has been making crafts for 5 years, which she began with her own money. Now her difficulty is that she cannot work full time because her hand hurt and cannot continue working until the pain passes. This loan will be the seventh that she has received from Afodenic, with which she has been able to improve her home. With this loan she wishes to revamp the front of her house, as one part is covered in zinc, and she would like to make it a little safer from the local criminals. In the long run she would like to invest in her business to increase her earnings and help her only son.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to fortify the front of her home.

loans.name: Vicuñitas De Tunari Group

texts.es: EL GRUPO "VICUÑITAS DEL TUNARI " ESTA REPRESENTADO POR LA SEÑORA LILIANA ELLA AL IGUAL QUE SUS COMPAÑERAS TIENE UNA FAMILIA NUMEROSAS COMPUESTA D. CINCO MIEMBROS. LAS SOCIOS (AS) SON GENTE TRABAJADORA Y MUY RESPONSABLE, EN GENERAL SE DEDICAN AL COMERCIO D. MERCADERÍAS COMO LA ROPA, ARTESANÍAS, MANTA D. VICUÑA, ZAPATILLAS DEPORTIVAS, ABARROTES, REPUESTOS PARA AUTO Y A LA CONSTRUCCIÓN D. VIVIENDAS. DENTRO DEL MERCADO SIEMPRE EXISTE LA COMPETENCIA D. LA OFERTA Y LA DEMANDA, LAS SOCIAS HAN APRENDIDO A COMBATIRLA HACIENDO ROTAR SU MERCADERÍA PARA PONER A LA VENTA LOS PRODUCTOS D. LA ÉPOCA, ALGUNAS D. ELLAS NO LOGRAN HACERLO A TIEMPO QUEDÁNDOSE CON MERCARÍA PASADA Y DIFÍCIL D. VENDER AL CLIENTE EXIGENTES ES POR ESTA CAUSA QUE AVECES LAS SOCIAS RETRAZAN SUS PAGOS. EL DESTINO DEL CRÉDITO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. SU MERCADERÍA PARA LA ÉPOCA NAVID.ÑA EN LA CUAL HAY MAYOR DEMANDA D. PRODUCTOS Y PARA LA COMPRA D. HERRAMIENTAS D. TRABAJO EN LOS CASOS D. LOS VARONES. SU EXPERIENCIA DENTRO DEL MARCO D. GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS ES BUENA YA QUE ALGUNOS D. LOS MIEMBROS D. ESTE GRUPO PARTICIPARON D. OTROS FINANCIAMIENTOS EN OTROS GRUPOS DIFERENTES LOGRANDO CUMPLIR CON LOS PAGOS PUNTUALMENTE. EXISTE UN PARENTESCO FAMILIAR DENTRO DEL GRUPO ENTRE LA SEÑORA MARISOL Y GONZALO ELLOS SON HERMANOS PERO TIENEN INGRESOS TOTALMENTE INDEPENDIENTES.
texts.en:
The group "Vicunitas del Tunari" is represented by Mrs. Liliana Ella who just like her partners has a large family maD. up of five members. The members are hardworking and responsible people. In general they are involved in the sale of merchandise such as clothing, handicrafts, vicuna (an animal related to the llama) blankets, sneakers, groceries, auto parts, and home construction. Within any market there always exists the competition of supply and demand, and these women have learned to deal with it by rotating their merchandise in order to place on sale the items of the season. Some of them are not able to do it on time and are left with items that are out-of-season and difficult to sell to demanding customers. It is for this reason that sometimes the members are late with their payments. The purpose of the loan is to increase merchandise for the Christmas season during which there is a greater demand for their products as well as for the purchase of work tools for the men. Their experience within the realm of solidarity groups is good since some of the members of this group participated in other loans with other groups and were able to pay punctually. There exists a family kinship within this group between Marisol and Gonzalo who are brother and sister but they have totally independent incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy Placido, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Вохидова Шахло жительница города Яван.  Возраст 24 года , замужем , детей пока нет. Не зависимо от занятий мужа , имеет свой бизнес. Занимается птицеводством. Имеет большой курятник , где разводит птиц. Хочет получить кредит для тог, чтобы увеличить бизнес , закупить еще хороших породистых курей , для их разведения. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Shahlo V. resides in Yavan town. She is 24 years old and is married. She has her own business. Shahlo has a large henhouse where she raises poultry. She would like to get a loan for expanding her business by purchasing more and better quality chicken. She would be able to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase chicken and mixed fodder

loans.name: Febita

texts.en:
Febita chooses to engage in a village store business in assisting her husband with their financial needs. Due to lack of capital, she is now requesting a loan of 4,000 pesos to sustain her small business. Through the loan, she can purchase additional items such as canned goods, soft drinks, basic commodities and toiletries that are looked for by her customers. She is hoping that her current weekly income of 1,500 pesos (about $31 USD) will increase so she can provide the needs of their family and schooling of their children by working hard.

Febita is married to Eduardo, a farmer in the village. They have five children: Eduardo Jr., 23 years old; Alex, 20 years old, a college graduate and now working as a security guard; Avel, 18 years old, a college student; Arnel, 14 years old, a high school student; and their youngest is 12 years old, in grade IV.

loans.use: To sustain her village store.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en: Salvacion Y. is a 46-year-old married mother of three, two in high school and one a college graduate.  She and her husband earn their income by fishing, using small outrigger boats.  Salvacion is requesting this loan to buy a new boat and fishing nets and says her dream is to one day have her own house and a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy a new outrigger boat and nets for fishing.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is currently in the business of selling shoes and clothes and is requesting a loan to buy a tailoring machine for sewing many clothes. Teresa is 30 years old and is widowed. She has no children. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy land and build a house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy a tailoring machine for sewing many clothes for sale

loans.name: Kunush

texts.ru:
Кунуш Султанов мужчина 1950 года рождения ,женат имеет 5 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Дома содержит скот, жена и дети помогают ухаживать за скотом. Он содержит скот почти 30 лет. Основное  источник дохода в их селе, откорм скота и доходы с России.  По этому он и занимается этим  с детства и учит этому ремеслу своих детей.  Один из его сыновей присылает ему деньги с России, на эти деньги он делает ремонт. 
Кунуш получил кредит для увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Kunush S. was born in 1950, he is married and has five children. He does not have a high education. He keeps cattle at home and his wife and children help him to take care of it. He has been keeping cattle for almost 30 years. The main source of income in their village is from animal husbandry and income from Russia. This is why he has been in this business since childhood and teaches his children this skill too. One of his sons sends him money from Russia and he used this money to make repairs in the home. Kunush will use the loan to increase the headcount of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
El señor Benjamin C. tiene un terreno en el cual está construyendo una vivienda y le está haciendo falta el techo, tiene el proyecto de elaborarla de concreto ya que es más segura y duradera. 
  Solicita el préstamo para comprar el material ya que el sabe algo de construcción y  se encargara de realizar la mejora lo más pronto posible. Para terminar el patrimonio de su familia, y así dejar de pagar renta.
texts.en:
Benjamin C. is building a home on a plot of land that he owns. The house currently lacks a roof, and he hopes to build one out of concrete roofing tiles, as it will be safer and more durable. He is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials. As he knows something about construction, he will be able to do the work himself. He will complete construction as quickly as possible to be able to stop paying rent and to ensure his family's legacy.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a tile roof

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахноза молодая женщина 21 года. Она замужем но пока детей не имеет. Шахноза занимается пошивом женской одежды на заказ. Она училась у хорошей швеи пол года. Теперь она самостоятельно берет заказы и шьет разную женскую одежду, в том числе национальные платья, юбки, сорочки, брюки и т.д. Шахноза впервые берет кредит в нашей организации. Она хочет приобрести машину "Аверлог" для своего дела. Шахноза надеется, что кредит поможет ей расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is a young 21-year-old woman. She is married, but does not yet have children. Shahnoza is involved in making custom-tailored women’s clothing. She spent six months learning the craft from a good tailor. Currently, she takes orders on her own and sews different women’s clothing, including traditional dresses, skirts, night gowns, pants, etc. This is Shahnoza’s first time obtaining a loan at our organization. She wants to purchase the Averlog sewing machine for her business. Shahnoza hopes that this loan will help her expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a sewing machine

loans.name: Asistentes Group

texts.es: Este grupo denominado “Asistentes” esta conformado por 14 personas que se encuentran cursando su quinto ciclo demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad ya que la fundación agrocapital les otorga un apoyo económico y pueden fallar en sus pagos. Una mayoría D. los integrantes se dedican a la venta D. ropa, comida, cosméticos por catálogos y a la elaboración D. prendas D. vestir y la chaparía. La competencia en el rubro comercial es alta pero los socios saben como salir adelante como lo han ido demostrando en sus anteriores ciclos. El crédito les favorece para seguir creciendo en sus pequeños negocios y para poder brindas a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
The group called “Asistentes” (“Helpers”) is formed of 14 people who are in the fifth loan cycle, demonstrating punctuality and responsibility such that the Fundación Agrocapital has given them an loan and they are able to make the payments. Most of the members work selling clothes, food, catalogue cosmetics, and making things to wear and eat. The competition in the local commercial area is strong but the members know how to move their businesses forward, as they have demonstrated in their previous loan cycles. This loan will help them to continue growing their small businesses, and to be able to bring a better quality of life to their families.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Funds

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
The committee Mujeres Luchadoras was formed on Mary 22, 2009, thanks to the director of the group, Nilsa R., who works at selling vegetables. She approached a loan officer about starting a committee for women entrepreneurs. Nilsa was then able to gather a group of 16 women who work well together. 

The women use the credit given to them to invest in their respective businesses in order to mutually achieve common goals, both individually and as a group. The women participate in weekly meetings and show support and interest in each other’s activities. 

1	Nilsa R. - Vegetable sales 
2	Melissa D. - Food sales 
3	Marcelina M. - Small grocery store 
4	Daniela T. - Fruit sales 
5	Celestina G. - Food sales 
6	Jacinta D. - Food sales 
7	Matilde M. - Charcoal sales 
8	Gladys T. - Fruit sales 
9	María B. - Fruit and vegetable sales  
10	Sunilda M. - Vegetable sales 
11	Jorgelina O. - Small grocery store 
12	Celia F. - Avon cosmetics sales 
13	Librada P. - Vegetable sales 
14	Martina R. - Diner 
15	Mirian B. - Food sales 
16	Adolfina G. - Chipa (local bread) sales

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for sale

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en: Benedicta is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She is a seamstress. She is has been sewing for seven years. She is a specialist in women's clothing. Her skills and designs are of class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look, such as children's school uniforms, church attire, the kaba and slit (a tailored top and long skirt), wedding dresses, and funeral clothes. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of sewing materials like linen, thread and thimbles, to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to increase her savings and provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: To buy sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
"We earn our income from the rice field that we till. Because we are very familiar with the process of farming, it's no longer difficult for us to grow rice and manage our business to support our children," says 31-year-old Rosie A., who is the mother of two children. She knows about CEVI's credit services and would like a loan of 13,000 PHP to be able to purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides for her farm. These will go far to increase the size of her normal harvest.

Through small loans, CEVI helps people's small businesses grow. They provide their clients with – not just loans – but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, rice seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Rosielyn

texts.en:
“If you are thrifty, you will never be empty in times of emergency”, says Rosielyn as she always remember.   She is vendor of fish, meat and frozen foods.  She is the responsible wife of Micheal and they have four children and they live in Barangay Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. They want their children to be successful in the future by providing them with the right education.  Despite the economic crisis, the couple helps each other to earn a living for them to be able to send their children to school and survive their battle against poverty.
 
Her husband is presently working abroad as an Industrial Electrician while Rosielyn manages her small business.  She wanted her business to improve so she can help her husband in meeting the growing needs of their family.  She is now requesting a loan amounting to PHP14, 000 as additional capital. Through her patience and sacrifices, Rosielyn is able to earn around PHP6, 000 monthly income that is really was of big help in their daily needs. According to Rosielyn, she will do her best for her family and become a responsible wife and mother.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María F. tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a vender ropa usada y nueva, esté negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos pequeños a quienes les quiere dar lo mejor. Doña Rosa María ha tenido ya cuatro créditos con FVP los cuales ha pagado puntualmente.
Está solicitando un préstamo para comprar un comprar un vehiculo ya que el que tenia ya no sirve, y lo necesita para estar trasportando la mercancía ha diferentes partes de la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Y si su negocio tendrá más  ingreso para su familia y con el cual una parte será para pagar el préstamo

loans.use: Comprar un vehiculo para transportar su mercancía

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is engaged in dress making business for 13 years.  She started her business when she got married as her way of helping her husband in providing the needs of her family and also for them to have an alternative source of income aside from farming.  She is 58 years old and still striving to work hard for the sake of her family.  She is glad that through God's help, her business is still stable.  

Marina would like to improve her business.  This is the reason why she wanted to borrow a loan of PHP15,000 for the maintenance of her business. She is praying that her request will be approved to be able to increase her profit and reach her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.es:
Prudencia tiene 56 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia. Desde muy niña se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas apoyando a sus padres, pero hace 40 años decidió que ésta sería también la mejor manera de generarse sus propios ingresos económicos. Por ello, en la actualidad siembra en las tierras que heredó de sus padres los productos típicos de su zona como la papa, el maíz, el trigo, la arveja, etc. Prudencia comercializa estos productos directamente en el mercado de su localidad y es su hija quien la ayuda a administrar sus ganancias. Adicionalmente cría animales (cuyes y cerdos), los cuales compra y vende todos los fines de semana en la feria ganadera de su zona y con cuyas ganancias sustenta sus necesidades diarias mientras espera la cosecha. Su deseo a futuro es aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene. 
Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que  tiene grandes expectativas de su banco comunal y se compromete a ser puntual en todas sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para sus cultivos y medicinas para sus animales.
texts.en:
Prudencia is 56 years old and lives with her daughter in her own house. Since she was very young she has dedicated herself to agricultural tasks, helping her parents until 40 years ago, when she decided this would also be the best way to generate her own income. For that goal, at present, she sows the lands she inherited from her parents, growing produce typical of the region, such as potatoes, corn, wheat, honey mesquit, etc.

Prudencia sells these products directly in the local market and her daughter helps her with the administration of the earnings. In addition, she raises animals (guinea pigs and pigs), which she buys and sells on weekends in the local livestock fair. In this way they maintain themselves while awaiting the harvest. Her desire for the future is to increase the quantity of animals she has.

This is the first time she has requested a credit with MFP. She has great expectations for her community bank and accepts the responsibility to be prompt with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to buy sacks of manure for her crops and medicines for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY FERTILIZER AND MEDICINES FOR LIVESTOCK

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida es una joven dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el distrito de Manantay, región de Ucayali, tiene 20 años, es madre de un niño. Ella se dedica al alquiler de motocarro (transporte), actividad que comparte con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Victoriosas” desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que obtuvo fue de 300 soles que utilizó para invertir en frutas y utensilios para la venta de jugos, ella antes tenia este negocio.
Con este crédito de 1500 soles, piensa comprar un motocarro de segundo uso. La meta de Alida es tener una tienda de repuestos y lubricante de motos y motocarro.
texts.en:
Alida is a dynamic and hardworking young woman. She lives in the district of Manantay, Ucayali region. She is 20 years old, mother of a boy. She works renting a motorcar (transportation), activity which she shares with her husband. She has been part of the communal bank, "Las Victoriosas" (the victorious women) for two years. The first loan she obtained was for 300 soles, which she used to invest in fruit and utensils for the sale of juices; she used to have that business before. With this loan of 1500 soles, she plans to buy a second-hand motorcar. Alida's goal is to own store that sells spare parts and oil for motorcycles and motorcars.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying a second-hand motorcar

loans.name: Poderosas Group

texts.es: El grupo “Poderosas” esta representado por la señora Ana y conformada por 13 miembros son muy activos debido a que esta formado por gente joven y muy capaz. En general los integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades D. índole comercial como la venta D. cosméticos, comida, abarrotes en tiendas D. Barrio, zapatos, empanadas y al servicio D. soldadura mecánica.  Dentro del ámbito comercial la competencia es siempre alta pero gracias a su experiencia las socias ya cuentan con clientes fieles que confían en sus productos y cuando las ventas descienden buscan mercados como ferias vecinales. El destino del crédito es para la adquisición D. mercaderías, insumos y herramientas que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso y una mejor calidad D. sus productos. En cuanto a la experiencia  en la competencia crediticia los socios cuentan con ella gracias a financiamientos en instituciones similares pero es la primera vez que trabajan con una institución que les brinda confianza y apoyo económico, es por esta razón que desean seguir creciendo junto a nosotros.
texts.en:
Ana represents the Poderosas Group, which is comprised of 13 members. The members are very active because they are young, very capable people. Generally, the members of the group are engaged in commercial activities such as selling cosmetics, food, groceries in neighborhood stores, shoes, and empanadas. Some proviD. mechanical soldering services. Competition is always high in the commercial field. Thanks to their experience, the members have their loyal customers who have trust in their products. When sales fall, the members look for markets like neighborhood fairs. The loan is to get merchandise, supplies, and tools to help generate greater income and a better quality in their products. As far as their credit history goes, the members have experience thanks to similar financial institutions. But, this is the first time they have worked with an institution that offers them confidence and economic support. That is why they wish to continue growing with us.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Betty Betzaida

texts.es: La señora Betty B. , habita en un barrio pobre de Masaya , se dedica desde hace diez años como conserje, y sus horas libre trabaja en la costura ya que anteriormente se dedicaba  ala costura y hacia bonitas sabanas bordadas pero como no era dinero fijo todos los meses opto por trabajar fijo y dejarlo como segunda opción la costura en sus tiempos libres sus sueños es poder ver terminada su vivienda , en el terreno que sus padres le brindaron para que habitara con su familia , ya que para realizarlo no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacer la obra de construcción , con el primer crédito logro comprar parte de materiales como piedra y arena , ahora con este segundo desembolso lo va a   invertir en bloques y hierro , con este proyecto que ella tiene le va a brindar mejores condiciones de vida y sobre todo va poder constar con una privacidad , doña Betty tiene una hija a su cargo , su esposo labora como guarda de seguridad para apoyarla con los gastos del hogar
texts.en:
Sra. Betty Blando lives in a poor neighborhood in Masaya. She has worked the past 10 years as a janitor and spends her free time sewing. Betty previously worked full-time producing beautiful embroidered linens, but she did not earn enough money to cover her monthly fixed expenses. Therefore, she had to find a better paying full-time job.

She dreams of finishing the construction of her home, situated on the land that her parents provided for her and her family to live. Betty does not have the money needed to pay for the construction work. She used her first loan to purchase building materials, such as stone and sand. Now she is requesting a second loan to buy cement blocks and iron. This project will provide better living conditions and give her family privacy. Doña Betty has a daughter who is dependent on her. Her husband works as a security guard to help pay the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement blocks & iron to begin the construction of her house

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores G. is 45 years old and a single mother of four children: Jessie, 22 years old; Ana Mae, 15 years old; Marlon, 10 years old, and Marvin, 7 years old. She is eager to provide a good quality education to her children. This is one of their motivations in life. They keep on working hard and looking forward to big opportunities.

Delores makes potholders. Her eldest son, Jessie G., is a construction worker/ laborer whose income is not adequate to meet the family's needs. They are be able to devote time the potholder business because Delores it is a primary source of income. The business supports their needs and a bridge to the fulfillment of their dreams. She wants her children to attend school until college and to have stable jobs.

The loan that Dolores will receive through Kiva's field partner, Ahon SA Hirap Inc.(ASHI), will be used to purchase a bundle of different types of cloth ("tela" in Tagalog), scissors, needles, threads, and oil for her sewing machine. 

Dolores is hoping that this business will give them more income so that she can afford to send her children to school. Dolores has many plans for the progress of their lives, so she is praying to God to give her more life and a strong mind to attain goals in life.

loans.use: To buy cloth, needles, scissors, oil for her potholder business

loans.name: Amistad Y Paz Group

texts.es:
Cuando Herminia se queda sola al cuidado D. sus 2 hijos tuvo que ver la manera D. ganarse la vida y sacarlos adelante, lo primero que hizo es dedicarse a la venta D.  cosméticos  esto le generaba algunas ganancias pero no era suficiente, como estudio enfermería técnica empieza a ofrecer sus servicios para cuidar ancianos personas enfermas etc. Poco a poco se hizo conocida en ese campo logrando que la contraten actualmente es muy conocida no le faltan pacientes que la contratan ,D. esa forma ella mantiene su hogar y ha podido lograr que sus hijos estudien y con mucho sacrificio también logro comprar  su terreno donD. esta terminando D. construir su casa, lo que ella mas quiere es terminar la construcción del segundo piso  para poder hacer habitaciones y alquilarlas para vivir D. sus rentas, aparte D. eso piensa poner un negocio en su misma casa un bazar – librería.
 La señora Herminia usara su préstamo para  terminar algunos trabajos en uno D. los locales que tiene y poder alquilarlo. En EDAPROSPO tiene 5 años, formando parte D. la presidencia del grupo AMISTAD Y PAZ  siente que ser parte del grupo ha sido un impulso para lograr todo lo que ahora tiene y esta segura D. que pronto cumplira todo lo que tanto desea.


*La Sra Herminia es la D. polo violeta.
texts.en:
When Herminia was left alone to care for her 2 children, she had to see how to make a living and move them forward. The first thing she did was work selling cosmetics which earned her some profits but it was not enough. Because she studied technical nursing, she has started to offer her services to care for the elderly, sick people, etc. Little by little she maD. herself known in this area accomplishing that they now hire her. She is well-known and she is not short on patients that hire her. This way she maintains her home and was able to have her children study. With great sacrifice she also bought her land where she is finishing building her house. What she most wants is to finish construction on the second floor to be able to make rooms and rent them to live on their income. Apart from that, she plans to put a business in her same house, a bazaar - bookstore. Mrs. Herminia will use her loan to complete some work in one of the properties that she has and be able to rent it. She has been at EDAPROSPO for 5 years, as part of the presidency of the group AMISTAD Y PAZ "Friendship and Peace". She feels that being part of the group has been a drive to achieve everything that she has now and she is sure that she will soon fulfill everything that she wants. Ms. Herminia is the one in the purple shirt.

Translated from Spanish by Elycia Mulholland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish work on her property to rent it

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Fredy tiene 29 años, es conviviente y va nacer su hijo por que su esposa esta embarazada, El socio Fredy vive en la ciudad de Pisaq departamento del Cusco y pertenece al Banco Comunal “MAMACHA ASUNTA” de la Asociación Arariwa. 

El socio es técnico en informática y trabaja en el Ministerio de Salud en el área de informática hace cuadros estadísticos de cuantos pacientes se atienden en el hospital mensualmente y también tiene un pequeño negocio familiar de venta de cervezas y gaseosas en su restaurante “Las gemelas” en la ciudad de Calca. Ya son 5 años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestro socio es un padre trabajador y emprendedor que saca adelante a su familia. El socio requiere el préstamo para comprar más bebidas como cervezas y gaseosas. 
   
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member, Fredy, is 29 years old, lives with his partner, and will soon have a baby because his partner is pregnant. Fredy lives in the city of Pisaq in the department of Cusco and belongs to the community bank "Mamacha Asunta" of the Arariwa Association.

The member is a computer technician and he works in the Ministry of Health in the area of information technology making statistical tables of the number of patients who are attended to at the hospital each month and he also has a small family business selling beer and sodas in his restaurant "The Twins" in the city of Calca. He has already run this business for five years and it has gone very well for him thanks to all the effort that he has put into his work. Our member is a hardworking dad and entrepreneur who is supporting his family. The member needs the loan to buy more drinks such as beer and sodas.

The member is grateful for the opportunity offered to him in this way and promises to complete the repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member requires the loan to buy more drinks such as beer and sodas.

loans.name: Billy

texts.en:
Billy M. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. He is 34 years old. Billy is married. To make a living, Billy owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle services to transport passengers in the local community. Billy has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Billy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Billy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Billy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Iris Del Carmen

texts.es:
La cliente Iris del Carmen M. L. es confeccionista de ropa variada. Con una experiencia de 16 años en la industria de la confección. Ella Actualmente tiene 4 trabajadores 3 mujeres y un varón. Cuenta con un número de 10 maquinas, como activo fijo. Trabaja con empresas como MX uniformes y Publilogo las que le realizan pedidos mensuales a nuestra cliente, según el contrato que logran establecer con empresas privadas y estatales

Es soltera, madre de 2 Hijas que estudian en la universidad.

Este crédito lo solicitó para compra de insumos y poder cumplir con un pedido de 565 Blazer, 505 Blusas y 60 pantalones como son: entretela, hombrera, gruesones de botón, conos de hilo, seda de forro.

Es cliente A de CEPRODEL desde Febrero del 2002 con un buen record crediticio, se encuentra muy agradecida con nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Iris del Carmen M. L. is a tailor of many different types of clothes. She has sixteen years of experience as a tailor. Right now she manages four workers: three women and one man. She counts ten machines as fixed assets. She works with companies like MX uniforms and Publilogo, which place monthly orders from her according to the contract that they establish with private and state companies.

Iris is a single mother of two daughters who study in university.

Iris is requesting this loan to buy materials to complete her order of 454 blazers, 505 blouses and 60 pants. She needs to buy lining, shoulder pads, buttons, spools of thread, and silk lining.

Iris has been a client of CEPRODEL since February of 2002. She has a good loan record and is very grateful to this institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to make blazers, blouses and pants

loans.name: Grethel

texts.es:
Grethel es una mujer muy laboriosa, está felizmente casada con el padre de sus 6 hijos, 4 de ellos son mayores y viven aparte. Los otros 2 y su nieta viven en su casa en un barrio populoso de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 3 años trabaja en la puerta del mercado de su localidad vendiendo bisutería. Inicialmente le costó mucho ubicarse en esta zona porque los inspectores municipales le quitaban su mercadería porque no hay permiso para la venta ambulante. Pero afloró su persistencia y ahora le va bien, además está muy contenta porque con esas ganancias ayuda a su esposo quien es policía, en cubrir los gastos del hogar. A su vez, a su hija que madre soltera le viene enseñando el negocio para que aprenda su forma de trabajar. En adelante, quiere comprar un puesto dentro del mercado, porque le es muy rentable y así podrá brindar la educación adecuada a sus hijos.

Este te su doceavo préstamo con MFP, donde ratifica su compromiso de seguir siendo muy puntual en sus pagos, como hasta ahora. Asimismo comenta que está orgullosa de pertenecer a su grupo, pues tiene compañeras muy responsables. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de accesorios para el cabello y otros artículos de ese tipo.
texts.en:
Grethel is a very hard-working woman. She is happily married to the father of their six children; four of whom are adult and live apart, the other two and a granddaughter live with her in a densely populated neighborhood of Lima. For the last three years she has sold costume jewelry at the entrance to the local market. Initially it was very difficult to set herself up in this area because municipal inspectors would confiscate her merchandise because there are no permits for street vending. However, her persistence bore fruit and now she does well; besides, she's happy because she can help her husband, who is a police officer, meet household expenses. At the same time, she is teaching the business to her daughter, who is a single mother, so that she will learn how to work. In the future, she wants to buy a stand inside the market because it is very profitable and she will be able to provide her children with an adecuate education. This is her third loan with MFP and she reconfirms her commitment to continue being very punctual with her repayments, as she has been until now. Also, she comments that she is proud to belong to her group because she has very responsible fellow members. She will use the requested funds to buy hair accessories and similar items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair accessories and similar items.

loans.name: Achintha

texts.en:
Achintha is a 39-year-old woman living with her husband and 2 children in Kamburugamuwa in the Matara district of southern Sri Lanka.  She and her husband work together to manage a book shop, which they started about one and a half years ago.  They are both very hard-working and hope to expand the book shop in the future.

Achintha is asking for a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC to buy books and stationery to help supply her shop.  She is situated in a marketplace that is in a very beneficial location right next to a center where many people take classes.  She hopes this loan will help her expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy books and stationery

loans.name: Muyibat

texts.en: Muyibat sells food items to make a living. She hopes to increase her profit in her business. She hopes to grow her business to become bigger and stronger. She is requesting for a loan amount of NGN40,000 to purchase more food items to sell. She is 50 years old, married, and has  4 children. Her husband also works to support their home. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food items to sell.

loans.name: Mukama Yassinga Goup Of Mukono Group

texts.en:
His business story has a checkered career of ups and downs since he began it two years ago in Kirinya, Mukono district. The dawn of 2010 promised to open new horizons for his snack business (fruit and vegetables) but nothing has significantly improved since. His business enterprise, though replete with losses, has remained afloat thanks to his resilient nature.

This is the story of M. Emmanuel, a 25-year-old married father of one child. If his financial prospects are to improve, he needs help because, based on the 119,000 shillings he makes in a week, his business future may not be that secure after all. A loan, he figures, will go a long way in helping him expand his snack business.

loans.use: To expand his snack business by buying more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Puamoto

texts.en:
Puamoto N. L. is 35 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, selliN. pancakes (fried flour pancakes flavored with lemon or coconut jam).  Puamoto has 1 year of experience in this business.  Puamoto needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy flour, flavoriN., sugar, and plastic bags.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Puamoto joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Puamoto's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lendiN. is based upon the Grameen Bank lendiN. method.  Please join SPBD's lendiN. team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  
http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy flour, flavoring, sugar, and plastic bags

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria trabaja como comerciante de prendas de vestir, ella compra mercadería al por mayor de Desaguadero (es la frontera con el Perú) y reparte a sus proveedoras quienes lo comercializan en los mercados de La Paz; así es como ella logra sus ingresos con los que cubre la manutención de su familia. Su domicilio esta ubicado en la  zona de Villa Adela de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
El préstamo lo destinará a la compra de mercadería (ropa) la cual le servirá para aumentar su capital de trabajo.
 
Es sexto crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago le permite solicitar otro préstamo.
texts.en:
Maria is a clothing merchant; she buys clothes at wholesale in Desaguadero (on the border with Perú) and distributes to her suppliers who sell in La Paz’s markets. This is how she earns income to support her family. Her home is located in the Villa Adela area of the city of El Alto. She will use the funds to buy merchandise (clothes) which will increase her working capital. This is her 6th loan with Impro; her good repayment history qualifies her for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more clothing for her store.

loans.name: Serina

texts.en:
Serina C. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Serina is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Serina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Serina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Serina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Serina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used towards additional capital for her business. Serina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Serina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou M. est une femme de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MANKOLICOUNDA depuis le 13 décembre 2003. Elle développe un petit commerce de chaussures et de draps de lit. Elle mène cette activité en collaboration avec son mari depuis sept ans. Son mari achète la marchandise en Guinée Bissau et elle s'occupe de la vente dans les marchés hebdomadaires et villages environnants. Avec les recettes ils ont construit un habitat pour la famille et c'est avec les mêmes recettes qu'ils assurent l'éducation des enfants. 
Avec ce prêt elle souhaite renforcer son capital  en vue de faire plus de revenus pour pouvoir mieux prendre en charge l'éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Fatou M. is a 43-year old woman, married and the mother of four children under her care. She has been a member of the MANKOLICOUNDA “Banc Villageois” loan group since December 13, 2003. She operates a small business selling shoes and bed sheets. She has been carrying on this activity with her husband for seven years. Her husband acquires the stocks in Guinea Bissau and she handles the sales in the weekly markets and surrounding villages. They used their revenue to build a home for the family and to ensure that their children get an education. With this loan, she hopes to strengthen her capital so that she may increase her revenue and better provide for her children’s education.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen and better develop her commercial activity

loans.name: Cristo El Salvador Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL “CRISTO EL SALVADOR”

La alcancía comunal “CRISTO EL SALVADOR” es llamada así porque sus miembros son personas muy católicas y han encontrado un soporte en su religión.
Lucia es socia de esta alcancía, muchos años atrás afrontó la muerte de su esposo y quedó viuda entonces tenia que hacerse cargo de sus 7 hijos, entonces fue ahí donde se apoyo de su fe en Dios para continuar y darse fuerzas para sacar adelante a sus hijos, y lo consiguió, pudo criar a sus hijos hasta verlos adultos, gracias a su esfuerzo y positivismo, y al apoyo moral que sintió al tener fe en Cristo.
Pero pasaron los años y nuevamente su fe en Dios fue puesta a prueba con la muerte de 2 de sus hijos, dejándola a cargo de 3 nietos.
Lucia tenía que trabajar para criar a sus nietos, pero el trabajo de lavar ropa ya no es recomendable para su salud, ya que contaba con 65 años, y entonces gracias a una donación, hecha por vecinas del lugar donde vive, Lucia recibió una carreta ambulante para la venta de dulces, gaseosas, galletas, etc.
Lucia piensa usar el préstamo de EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, para continuar con la venta de dulces, galletas y gaseosas que lo realiza en una esquina de su casa, al lado de una canchita de futbol, donde siempre faltan las refrescantes gaseosas cada vez que los vecinos juegan algún partido.
texts.en:
“CRISTO EL SALVADOR (Christ the Savior)” COMMUNAL BANK The communal bank “CRISTO EL SALVADOR” is called as it is because its members are devout Catholics and have found support from their religion. Lucia is a member of this bank, many years ago she faced the death of her husband and she remains a widow. She had to take care of her 7 children, and it was at that time that she was supported by her faith in God to keep going and it gave her strength to keep moving forward for her children, and she succeeded, she was able raise her children to adulthood, thanks to her strength and positivity, and moral support that she felt having faith in Christ. But the years have passed and again her faith in God was put to the test with the death of 2 of her children, leaving her to look after 3 grandchildren. Lucia had to work to raise her grandchildren, but working washing clothes was not recommended for her health, as she is 65 years old, and then thanks to a donation, made by the neighbors where she lives, Lucia received a street cart for selling sweets, soft drinks, cookies, etc. Lucia is thinking of using the loan from EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD, to keep selling sweets, cookies and soft drinks which she does at a corner by her house, next to a football field, where refreshing soft drinks are always needed each time that the neighbors play any match.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets, cookies, soft drinks, etc for her kiosk, also hot chocolate because the weather is cold.

loans.name: Erevgiilham

texts.en:
Erevgiilham D. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Tuv province in central Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her daughter attends a local middle school, and the son is a student. Her husband works as a guard in a local military unit. 

Eregviilham operates a needlework business where she sews many different household products and makes a variety of clothing. She graduated from a college in 1985 as a seamstress and worked in a public company until it was later privatized. She began her business in 2006. 

Her dream is to expand her small sewing shop into a bigger operation where she would productively operate her needlework business. She is a modest, hardworking woman who is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Naite

texts.en:
Naite S. is 60 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture selling specialty food products in the local community.  Naite has 2 years of experience in this business.  Naite needs a loan of WST $1000 to buy raw ingredients for cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

Naite joined SPBD in the year 2009.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Naite's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for cooked foods

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine was born in 1977 and has two children who are 9 and 5 years old; both are in school. Her husband works together with her.

Seraphine has a shop selling various household items and soft drinks.  She has been in this business for four years and she is requesting a loan in order to buy more household items such as salt, sugar, boxes of matches, etc. 

Seraphine hopes to increase her capital as well by buying more items with the profits and building her savings. In the future she plans to have a wholesale shop with a variety of household items.  She also hopes to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying household items for resale

loans.name: Alcanzando Nuestras Metas Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Milagros Marlene tiene 33 años, tiene dos pequeños hijos, D. los cuales la menor tiene apenas 8 meses. Ella forma parte del grupò "Alcanzando Nuestras Metas", integrado por 8 personas trabajadoras y entusiastas, quienes sostienen que para lograr las metas planteadas solo hay un camino, el trabajo.
Ella se dedica a la atención D. su bodega que está ubicada en un espacio D. su casa; inició vendiendo ropa, la cual ofrecía D. casa en casa a sus conocidos, familiares y amigos, poco a poco fué juntando un capital y con la ayuda D. un pequeño préstamo empezó su bodega.
Con su trabajo ella pueD. aportar y apoyar a su pareja en los gastos familiares.
Una D. sus metas es ampliar su negocio, poder ofrecer variedad D. productos a sus clientes.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. diversas bebidas para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Milagros Marlene is 33 years old and has two young children; the youngest of whom is barely eight months old. She is part of the “Alcanzando Nuestras Metas” (Reaching Our Goals) group, maD. up of eight hard working, enthusiastic persons who believe that there is only one path to reaching one’s goals – work. She runs a store that is located in a space within her home. She began by selling clothing door to door to her neighbors, acquaintances, family and friends. Little by little she began to gather some working capital, and with the help of a loan, she was able to open her store. This work allows her to contribute and help her husband with the family expenses. One of her goals is to expand her business to be able to offer a variety of products to her customers. She will use the money from this loan to invest in different types of drinks to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Soft Drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the purchase of sewing materials

loans.name: Alexander Baltazar

texts.es:
Alexander tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el sector Ladrillera del distrito agrícola de Oyotún, una zona ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde que era adolescente a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos en la zona donde vive. El ayuda a los fabricantes con la elaboración de este material de construcción y lo distribuye por pedidos a los diversos clientes que residen por la zona. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Alexander desea adquirir material para seguir fabrincando ladrillos, para realizar su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

El es un joven tranquilo y bastante trabajador. Las personas que le conocen tienen muy buenas referencias suyas y asimismo le consideran un joven de confianza.
texts.en:
Alexander is 26 years of age.  He is single and lives with his parents and brothers in the Ladrillera agricultural district of Oyotún, a zone located an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been dedicated since he was a teenager to the manufacture and sale of bricks in the zone where he lives.  He helps builders with the making of this material and distributes it to order to the diverse clients that reside in the zone.  With the income that he earns from this activity, he settles his personal expenses and helps his parents with the support of the family economy.  

Alexander would like to acquire material to continue making bricks.  To achieve his objective, he has found it necessary to request his first loan from Edpyme Alternative; a loan of 500 new soles.  

He is a quite industrious and tranquil youth.  The people that know him give him very good references and likewise they consider him a trustworthy young man.

loans.use: To buy materials to grow his business of making and selling bricks.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya lives in Jaranwala, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and famous for its agricultural industry. She owns a two-room house in the area called 121.G.B and has been living in it with her family since she married A. G.. 

Her husband has a dairy business. For this purpose, he keeps some buffaloes at his home. The buffaloes give him a good quantity of milk, which he sells to different milk vendors in order to earn a good profit. Suraiya helps her husband in getting milk from his buffaloes. They both get up early in the morning and work hard to improve their financial condition.
  
Suraiya is the mother of four sons. All of them are young and do different kinds of work to contribute financially to the family. Her eldest son is an ironsmith. The next oldest helps his father in his dairy business, and the other two work in a brick furnace and manufacture bricks. 
 
Suraiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo for his dairy business. The additional buffalo will help him increase the milk quantity, and his income as well. Suraiya is a regular user of Asasah, and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she responsibly paid her installments and attended every meeting. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Suraiya.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for the dairy business

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en: Ganbat M. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. He and his family all live together in their ger (Mongolian nomadic housing tent). His two children both attend secondary school and his wife works as a doctor in the local hospital. Ganbat owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town. He began his business in 2000 by operating a transportation business using his tricycle and has since upgraded his vehicle to a car. After years of experience he has gained a lot of business experience. He would like to trade his current car for a bigger automobile. Ganbat is a very helpful and hardworking man. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a new engine for his car.

loans.use: To purchase a new engine for his car.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is a married mother with a 5-year-old child. She and her husband own a business that offers ceremonial services and sells ceremonial inventory. She has been in this business for five years and is very focused and determined. She is grateful for the loans she has received from HOPE Ukraine which have helped her business expansion.

This time, Nataliya is requesting a loan of 11,000 UAH to purchase additional materials for manufacturing funeral wreaths, e.g. artificial flowers, wire and ribbons. The loan will be beneficial for Nataliya’s family business by keeping it competitive and promoting further growth.

loans.use: to purchase materials for making wreaths

loans.name: Samuel King'ori

texts.en:
Samuel has practiced dairy farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 10 years.  He is 35 years old, married to Sarah Wambui and they have four children.

He heard about KADET from one of our credit officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid for his first loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy a dairy cow.

In the future, Samuel hopes to buy a bigger farm and practice dairy farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Floravelia

texts.en:
Floravelia B. is from the village of Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 26 years old. Floravelia is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Floravelia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods & snacks in the local community. Floravelia has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Floravelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Floravelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Floravelia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like junk foods & beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Floravelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell like snacks & beverages

loans.name: Berson

texts.en:
Berson has been in the farming business for the last fifteen years. His mixed farm, which is located in Kisii town in western Kenya, produces tea, bananas and maize which he sells locally. He employs four farmhands.
