He has requested this loan of 70,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to expand his cereals store. He says that the extra income from this loan will be used to expand his farming. He faces the challenges of a poor road network to the market and insufficient funds for expansion. In the future he would like to buy a piece of land to build some rental houses that will supplement his income.

Berson is 44 years old and married with six children between the ages of 6 months and 16 years. Four of the children are currently attending school.

loans.use: To expand his cereals store

loans.name: Ma. Arlene

texts.en:
Ma. Arlene, 42 years old, is from the town of Banga. To make a living, Ma. Arlene raises crops, primarily rice and corn, for sale. She works hard to grow her business.

Ma. Arlene joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living business and situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Ma. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Río Paraná Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es del Barrio Pacú Cua, surgió por promociones realizadas en la zona.
Todas las señoras realizan actividades comerciales en forma minoritaria, como la venta de bijouteries y accesorios para el cabello, remeritas, blusas, etc.
El monto que recibe cada señora es 500.000 Gs.
La presidenta del comité es la sra. Liz Mariela Z., ella se dedica principalmente a la serigrafía y a la venta de bijouteries.
texts.en:
This group is from the neighborhood Pacu Cua.  The members came together through their work in the region.  Each of the women runs a small business, such as the sale of clothing, or hair accessories, etc.   The loan will be shared and distributed among all the members.   The president of this committee is Mrs. Liz Mariela Z..  She has a silk screening business.  



E

loans.use: The money will be used by each of the members to invest in her specific business.   The businesses include clothing sales, silk screening, embroidery, hair accessories, etc.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a married woman who lives in Sta. Catalina, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a sari sari (general) store. Her husband Rodrigo, who is 41 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living. They have three children who are 10 to 21 years old. Susan joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Susan has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 11th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use to purchase more stock to sell so that she can continue to save up for the college education of her children and house renovation. Susan is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  - http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines  - on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 38 year old businessman.  He is married and has two children, aged 3 and 7.  He sells vehicle spare parts to better his family’s living standard.  He also works as a mechanic to get more income.  He has been running his business for five years and has employed one person. He was introduced to Faulu Kenya by his friend.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money.  He is also able to get loans easily from Faulu Kenya.  
He hopes to replenish his business stock so as to increase his income, grow the business and employ more people.  He has requested 70, 000kes to buy more spare parts.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta is a married woman from the province of Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a sari-sari store, an Avon dealership (beauty products direct seller) and fish vending. Her husband Peter is 60 years old. They have five children who are 17 to 34 years old. Julieta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Julieta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 2,400, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 to buy merchandise to sell in her sari-sari store and in her other businesses so that she can continue to save up for the future for her kids' schooling and home improvement. Julieta is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia B. is from the village of Bimonton, Mallig, Isabela. She is 57 years old. Eufemia is married and has 4 adult children. Eufemia operates a general store where she offers variety of different products. Eufemia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Eufemia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eufemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Eufemia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Eufemia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell, such as soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Lisbeth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN ISIDRO DE YANAHUARA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lisbeth; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales, ella cría los animales como pollos y cuyes y luego los hace engordar y luego los vende  en forma ambulatoria y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere refaccionar su habitación donde habita. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como cemento, yeso y arena para refaccionar la habitación.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Lisbeth, a member of the San Isidro de Yanahuara Communal Bank, located in the Urubamaba district, Urubamba province and Cusco department.

Lisbeth is 32 years, she lives with her partner and she has 2 children. She alternates her daily chores with an animal breeding activity. She breeds animas such as chickens and “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig); she fattens them and then she sells them on the streets. Thanks to this job she is able to provide for her children. She wants to make repairs to her house, and the loan she is requesting will be used to buy materials such as cement, plaster and sand to have her house repaired.

She is happy with the loan and she commits to complying with the repayments of her dues.

loans.use: To buy materials such as cement, plaster and sand to have her house repaired.

loans.name: Goreti

texts.en: Goreti is a fifty-one-year-old married woman with six children and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in clothes for ten years starting with capital of 400,000 shillings and she now has 2,000,000 shillings. Her hardships are price fluctuations and high taxes and her goal is wholesale business plus educating her children. Goreti needs the loan to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary  is 23 years old and single. She currently sells clothes. Mary is requesting  a loan to stock more clothes to sell. She hopes to buy animals and rear them in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transporting his farm products

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is a 50-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in H. Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband have worked in farming for 20 years. To earn more money to support her family, she intends to take a loan to buy fertilizer and raise cattle so that they can have more money to cover the cost of family expenses.

She hopes that in the future, she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for farming

loans.name: Carina

texts.es: A mediados del año 2008 Karina decidió emprender su aventura representada en un negocio, mediante el cual prepara refrigerios, almuerzos y comidas que vende a crédito y de contado a una clientela  de empleados ya conocida y también a los vecinos de su barrio, quienes la  identifican por los deliciosos alimentos que prepara con una gran  dedicación.  Su negocio fue motivado  por el deseo de apoyar  a su familia en los gastos de su hogar y fortalecido porque en su punto de ventas no había competencia alguna, lo cual generó el fortalecimiento de este. En la actualidad Carina se siente muy entusiasmada y desea hacerlo crecer, pero no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograrlo por si sola. Esta es la razón por la cual ha acudido a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos, para la preparación de nuevos menúes  que piensa ofrecer para impactar su mercado con novedades, pues su sueño y gran desafío es convertirlo en un restaurante muy bien posicionado en el mercado objeto de Carina.
texts.en:
In the middle of 2008, Carina decided to start a business preparing snacks, lunches and meals that she sells on credit and for cash to a known customer base of employees and locals from her neighborhood.  She is known by these customers for the delicious food that she prepares with great commitment.  Carina's business was motivated by her desire to support her family with their household expenses.  It was strengthened because there is no competition in her area. 

Carina currently feels very enthusiastic and would like to grow her business but she doesn't have the working capital she needs to achieve this herself.  This is why she is applying for a Kiva loan (her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo).  She will use her loan to buy a larger volume of raw materials and supplies for preparing new meals that she is planning to offer her customers in order to make an impact on her market with new offerings.  Her dream and her biggest challenge is to turn her business into a restaurant which is very well positioned within her target market.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and supplies for making new meals in larger volumes

loans.name: Marlene Sylvia

texts.fr:
Cliente de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 17 ans. Étant sortie d'une école d'esthétique, après sa formation,en 2006, elle ouvre son propre salon de coiffure.
 Ses recettes sont de 8000 fr a 80.000frs par jour et ses clientes sont les jeunes filles et les femmes.

Avec le prêt reçu , elle va renforcer les crèmes de beauté de toute qualité, 2 pots de 5 kg de de frisants, 10l de démêlants, des tissages , des mèches et un appareil pour les de manucure et pédicure.

elle a pour ambition d'organiser et moderniser son salon de coiffure pour attirer plus de clientèle.
texts.en: The client is a 34 year old married woman, and the mother of three children between the ages of 3 and 17.  Having graduated from a beauty school, after her studies, in 2006 she opened her one hair salon.  Her revenues are between 8,000 and 80,000 frs per day and her clients are young girls and women.   With her loan, she will strengthen her supply of beauty creams of all qualities, and buy 2 five kilogram jars of two 5-kg jars of relaxant, 10 liters of conditioner, weaves and extensions, and a manicure/pedicure machine.  Her ambition is to organize and modernize her hair salon in order to attract a greater number of customers.

loans.use: to purchase two 5-kg jars of relaxant, 10 liters of conditioner, weaves and extensions, and hair clips.

loans.name: Jorge Rolando

texts.es:
Jorge Rolando tiene 21 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL DIVINO NIÑO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto como siembre de maíz y arroz.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Comercial AGRIPAC y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de semillas y abonos de maiz y arroz.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como plagas en los cultivos y la falta de dinero para pagar a mas trabajadores. Su sueño es comprar un casa.

Le gusta hacer deporte y ayudar en lo que se pueda a los vecinos.
texts.en:
Jorge Rolando, 21, is married and lives with his wife and children in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.

The communal bank EL DIVINO NIÑO is located in the Estero Lindo community which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  This group is involved in growing short-cycle crops, such as corn and rice.

Jorge also grows corn and rice.  He buys his supplies in Comercial AGRIPAC and sells his produce in the wholesale market in Ventanas.

With the loan he plans to buy corn and rice seeds and fertilizer.  The loan helps him economically to meet his needs.  He is up against challenges such as crop plagues and lack of money to hire more workers.  His dream is to buy a house.

He enjoys sports and helping out neighbors when he can.

loans.use: To buy corn and rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Erdenetseteg

texts.en:
Erdenetsetseg is 40 years old and lives with her two children who attend high school, in Govisumber province of Mongolia. Her youngest daughter attends the Institute of Finance and Economics.  Erdenetsetseg started to trade meat in 1996. She purchases meat and animals from countryside people and sells them at the local market place. She manages her business independently. She is a very experienced person who knows her business and market. On daily basis, she sells two thirds sheep or goat meat and one third of horse or beef. 

Besides her sales income, her monthly retirement allowance is 108,000 MNT. She is interested in receiving a low interest rate loan from the bank. She is a hard working person who says, "I want to pay the tuition fee of my daughter's college". She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more meats and increase her turnover capital. She received the loan from the bank on the 1st of August, 2011, and she had 320,000 MNT of her own money in cash. Due to the Naadam festival, the demand of meat was very high. Thus, she used the money to purchase 10 sheep/goats from the countryside herder.

loans.use: To purchase more meats

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 45 years old and married. She has three children, age 14 to 21. She runs a clothing and dressmaking store in kroo town in the central part of Freetown.

Hannah has owned this business for five years and sells lace, bamako and men's and women's African dress at her market. Her business is the only source of income she has. She says that the main challenges to her business are the exchange rate and inflation.  

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more lace and African dress. Hannah says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. In the future, she would like to expand her business to various branches.

loans.use: To purchase more lace and male and female African dress.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 37 years old, married, and is a mother of 5 school-aged dependents. She lives in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To make a living, Lita manufactures and sells clay products to local businesses and community members. It has been five years since the business was started and it continues to exist. This business has allowed Lita to generate PHP 25,000 a month, which also includes other income sources from her spouse.

Earlier this year, Lita applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 from GDMPC to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. She aims to produce more and more of these products to accommodate orders and gain more income for the family. The possible revenue generated from this is intended to expand and improve the business, leading to more growth.

loans.use: buy raw materials to make clay products

location.town: Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
María Beatriz tiene 33 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos de trece, nueve, siete, cinco y un año de edad en el Cantón ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

María se dedica  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar un carro para transportar los productos que cosecha.

En los tiempos libres le gusta leer mucho la biblia.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old and lives with her husband and her children who are 13, 9, 7, 5, and 1 years old in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos. 

The members of the “ VCR Vencedores Unidos” located in the area of Anchoveta, on the way to Templanza, belong to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This solidarity group works in agriculture, growing short-cycle corn and rice.

María works in agriculture growing corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in Comercial Peña.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, and manure for her crops. The loan will help her buy what she needs. She encounters problems such as pests and diseases. 

Her dream is to buy a car in order to transport her harvest. In her free time she likes to read the Bible very much.

loans.use: in order to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Nobert

texts.en:
Nobert is aged 41 and has been in farming for 7 years,  producing and selling milk, maize and beans  for the local market. He is married with five children aged between 14 and 1 year old with the first 4 already schooling.

Nobert has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says this will improve his milk production and give additional supplement for the family meals and income. He is focusing on owning six dairy cows and a cereal-grinding machine in the local market.

High cost of animal feed stands out as the major challenge in farming. He intends to repay the loan and acquire another one.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Oscar Alberto

texts.es:
Oscar, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, él se dedica a vender sorbetes, paletas y sorbeletas  en el centro de la ciudad, ya tiene experiencia  no tiene un horario establecido de lunes a sábado
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar producto como: paletas, sorbetes, vasitos, de esa forma tendrá surtira de diferentes sabores de helados el negocio, con la esperanza de que la clientela acepte los prductos y aumente su demanda.
La aspiracion de oscar es que a traves del negocio pueda ofrecer a su familia todo lo necesario para la vida diaria.
texts.en:
Oscar lives with his wife and two children. He sells sorbets, popsicles, and other frozen treats in the central part of the city. Oscar already has experience, but he does not work according to an established schedule. His business operates Monday through Saturday.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy popsicles, sorbets, and cups so that he will have different flavors of frozen treats for his business. He hopes that customers like his products and that demand will increase. His aspiration is that his business will enable him to provide everything his family needs for their daily living.

loans.use: to buy sorbets, popsicles, and cups.

loans.name: Helen Grace

texts.en:
Helen Grace is 43 years old. She is married with 5 children. Helen Grace has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Helen Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Helen Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like snacks and beverages

loans.name: Jhanaeth Judid

texts.es:
La Señora Jhanaeth es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Progresistas, vive por la parroquia Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), este  lugar es de clima frió, cuenta con grandes llanuras que son propicias para la ganadería, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son personas amables y de un corazón muy cálido.

Doña Jhanaeth tiene 33 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 12, 11, 9, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos no están estudiando ya que no les gusta y sus otros tres hijos están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el trabajo que le ofrezcan, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
La Señora. Jhanaeth se dedica al cuidado de sus hijos que aun son muy pequeños y como pasa en casa cría y vende pollos y cerdos.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito en  el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y pollos. 

Su meta es de tener más animales para la cría.
texts.en:
Sra. Jhanaeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Progresistas” (Progressive Women). She lives in the parish of Victoria del Portete (Cuenca), a place with a frigid climate. There are wide open plains that are conducive to raising livestock. The people have maintained the culture and traditions of their towns. They are friendly people who have very warm hearts.

Doña Jhanaeth is 33 years old, married, and has six children (ages 12, 11, 9, 7, 5, and 3). Her two oldest children are not studying because they don’t enjoy it. The next three children attend a school in the city. Her husband works at a job that was offered to him. They live in a rental property since they do not own a home.

Sra. Jhanaeth devotes herself to taking care of her children since they are still young. She also spends time at home raising and selling chickens and pigs. Jhanaeth is receiving her fourth loan from the Communal Bank and will invest in the purchase of pigs and chickens. Her goal is to have more animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio tiene 55 años de edad y es casado y tiene 2 hijos; El socio sigue en su negocio de transporte,el es propietrio de un taxi y hace servicio publico,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,por medio de este trabajo el socio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de transporte . El  socio solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carro para comprar repuestos
                                                
El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is 55 years old, married, and has two children.  He continues working in his transport business.  He owns a taxi and provides a public transport service.  He works from 7.00am to 10.00pm in the different streets of the city of Cusco.  Through this work he provides for his children.  The member would like to expand and improve his transport business.  He is requesting this loan to have maintenance work carried out on his car and to buy spare parts.

The member is happy to be receiving his loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on his car and to buy spare parts

loans.name: Helena

texts.es:
Helena es socia del Banco Comunal “Kapia Marca” del distrito y provincia D. Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 48 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, dos independientes.

Hace seis años que trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R., su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. venta D. golosinas, artesanía y telas. 

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma D. S/. 2,500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra D. diez rollos D. telas D. diferentes colores para venderlas en la ciudad D. Arequipa.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener más capital y tener un puesto donD. pueda captar más clientes y mejorar sus ganancias.

Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las bromas D. las socias y la posibilidad D. ahorrar.
texts.en:
Helena is a member of the Kapia Marca communal bank in the district and province of Yunguyo in the Puno department.  She is a 48 year old widow.  She has four children; two of them are independent.

She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela R. for six years.  Her first loan was for 300 soles, which she invested in her business of selling sweets, handicrafts, and fabrics.

She will request a new loan for 2,500 soles in order to buy ten rolls of different colors of fabric to sell in the city of Arequipa.

Her dream for the future is to have more capital, to have a stand where she can get more customers, and to improve her income.

What she likes the most about her communal bank are the jokes from the members and the chance to save.

loans.use: to buy ten rolls of different colors of fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase business equipment i.e., plates, spoons, a stove, a frying pan, etc.

loans.name: Gladis Mabel

texts.es:
Gladis, desea aumentar sus ganancias por eso está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, e invertirlo en la compra de mercadería y más que todo comprarse dos puertas de balcón para instalarlas en la tienda, dándole mayor seguridad frente a la delincuencia.
Ella ha tenido efectos positivos en el negocio y su familia, por medio de los prestamos, por eso está nuevamente trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Gladis wants to increase her sales, so she is asking for another loan. She will invest in the purchase of merchandise and most importantly the purchase of two french doors to install in her store, which will give her greater security against crime.

The loans have allowed her to make a positive impact on her business and her family, which is why she is working with the institution again.

loans.use: to buy two French doors.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde, 27, is married with two children; none of them go to school because they are still young. 

Clotilde owns a bar, which she has started recently and she hopes to be the very best business in the future. She has requested the loan to buy more beers to sell. With the profits from the business, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more beers to sell

loans.name: Dora Concepcion

texts.es: Dora, necesita fortalecer su negocio y por eso se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo préstamo, además que ha recibido una buena atención por parte del personal de la institución, ella considera que el préstamo anterior fue una gran ayuda para fortalecer el negocio y continuar brindando un buen servicio a los clientes,su compra sera en azucar, frijoles, arroz, pollo, embutidos,  espera mantenerse dentro de su buena condición y poder continuar también ayudando a su familia.
texts.en: Dora needs to strengthen her business so has decided to request a new loan.  Besides, she’s received good attention from the staff at the institution.  She believes that the prior loan was of great help to her to strengthen the business and continue to provide good service to her customers.  She will buy rice, beans, sugar, chicken and cured meats.  She hopes to continue in her good condition and to be able to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en:
Haifa is a 22-year-old lady who is married to a young lawyer. She is a student at the university majoring in statistics. She is now in her last semester to gain her bachelors degree. Her husband is encouraging her to continue her studies to get a masters degree in her major.
With the support of her husband, Haifaa has decided to finish school and register for higher studies. She has applied for a loan in order to pay her last semester's fees so she can graduate and get her bachelors degree.

loans.use: to pay her last semester's fees.

loans.name: Aïgbe 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AÏGBE 2 est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Mireille Olga, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 36 ans est mariée à un certain Alban. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Mireille Olga vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Mireille Olga et son mari. Mireille Olga a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Mireille Olga  vend divers produits (sucre, lait, savons) à son domicile depuis cinq ans environ. Mireille Olga s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Mireille Olga sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AÏGBE 2  un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits (sucre, lait, savons).

loans.name: Amira

texts.en:
Amira, is a 63 years old widow woman.After her husband’s death she had no source of income to support herself , but she was a strong woman. Fortunately she had an old sewing machine to work on .She gained an excellent reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to the quality of her work and affordable prices.
When she heard about Izdiharona's  qard hassan product for widow women (without interest product) she took a 1000 USD loan to buy new sewing machine and renovate her workplace to increase her profit.
She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits .
The story of Amira and her business is just one of the many examples of Izdiharona for economic development clients .
She preferred to blur her face for cultural reason.

loans.use: to buy new sewing machine  renovate her workplace .

loans.name: Dieu Est Bon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST BON est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, nommée Véronique (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 53 ans n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Véronique est mariée à un briquetier du nom de Pierre. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux a leur charge. Véronique vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Véronique vend des vêtements comme activité principale depuis quatorze ans. Véronique s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Véronique ensemble avec les membres du groupe DIEU EST BON sollicite pour la troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été remboursés

loans.use: Acheter des vêtements.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is single and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Noemi requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Noemi has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Noemi would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en: Sabri I. is 50 years old and lives with his wife in the village of Jastrebovo, near Razgrad. Sabri and his wife keep the only grocery store in the village. They keep this store for three years. Before that they had a chicken farm for over 35 000 chickens in the village but it was hard for the family to keep it so they had to close and to reorganize their business. Now they need an $ 800 loan to buy new electronic scales for their grocery store.

loans.use: To buy new electronic scales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Roseta would like to buy five bales of clothing and improve her business premises

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mrs. Sou S., 60 years old, is married with 5 children and lives with her husband in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband (pictured here because S. is unavailable) raise rice and different vegetables in their small piece of land and typically generate around $3/day in revenue. One of the couple's daughters works at a garment factory, and the other four are farmers. In order to make more money and increase the variety of crops, S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more seeds to grow in her field and to repair her house, which is frequently leaky during the rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase seeds to grow on her piece of land and to repair her house

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria E. is 54 years old, happily married with 6 children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells used bed spreads, wrappers, curtains and shoes. She is a union leader and has being with LAPO for 4 years. She needs this money to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda U. is a part of the group pertaining to Pajchani de Villa Tejada. She has a 13 year old son who is studying in highschool. Eduarda has two businesses which generate income. First, is the sale of footware which she buys buy the dozen and then sells individually in the Tumusla Street Fair in the city of La Paz. The second business, and the one which generates more income, is the sale of beer. For this, she travels to other locations, mainly those that celebrate folkloric holidays, anniversaries and other events, where there is a lot of beer consumption. If things are good, this generates more income, but it's not a regular activity.

Eduarda will use the loan to continue with her businesses, mainly the sale of beer. Without the loan, she will not be able to purchase the beer to sell, and will not be able to generate the income she needs to take care of her son.

Eduarda U., pertenece a la asociación Pajchani de Villa Tejada, es madre de un niño de 13 años, el cual se encuentra estudiando en colegio. Eduarda tiene dos actividades que le generan ingresos, la primera, es la venta de calzados, los que ella compra por docena y vende por unidad en la Feria de la calle Tumusla en la ciudad de La Paz. La segunda actividad y la que le genera mejores ingresos, es la venta de cerveza, para esto ella viaja a otras localidades, principalmente aquellas que celebran fiestas folclóricas, entradas folclóricas, aniversarios y otros, donde el consumo de cerveza es por mayor. Si bien esta actividad le genera mejores ingresos, es una actividad ocasional. A tal efecto, Eduarda precisa de capital para poder continuar con sus negocios, principalmente el de la cerveza, ya que sin capital, no puede adquirir la cerveza por tanto no puede vender y generar recursos para la manutención de su hijo.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: This loan is to invest in her business selling beer. Without the loan, she will not be able to purchase the beer to sell, and will not be able to generate the income she needs to take care of her son.

loans.name: Ngum

texts.en: "There is no food for a lazy person"  -- that is the motto of F. Ngum, who works very hard to help her husband provide for their five children, three of whom are still very young. F. rises before dawn to fry puff balls for customers who eat them for breakfast. She has come to us for a loan to continue in this line of work, as well as grow cassava and begin selling water fufu, a paste of grated and fermented cassava that is very popular in Cameroon. She will use the additional income made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees and help her husband build a house.

loans.use: Purchase of flour, firewood, oil and water fufu

loans.name: Sonia Nancy

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia is member of the communal bank, "Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial" (Hardworking Women of the Camp Fair). She works selling fruits in a stand located in the Yungay market, Ancash department.

With this loan for S/. 800.00, which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy 2 boxes of apples, 2 boxes of mandarin oranges, 1 hundred bananas, and 2 boxes of oranges.

She is 34 years old, living in common-law marriage, and has 5 children. Her husband works in transportation as a driver, and they both support each other to educate their children and keep their household moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Sonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Mujeres Trabajadoras del Campo Ferial”, se dedica a la venta de frutas, está ubicado en el mercado de Yungay del Departamento de Ancash.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará 2 cajas de manzana, 2 cajas de mandarina, 1 ciento de plátanos y 2 cajas de naranja.

Ella tiene 34 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos, su esposo es chofer (transportista) y ambos se apoyan mutuamente para educar a sus hijos y sacar adelante su hogar.

loans.use: Buying fruits wholesale (Compra de frutas al por mayor.)

loans.name: Julia Justina

texts.es:
Miss Julia is 50 years old. She is a single mother of two children, an 18 year old young woman and a 7 year old boy. Miss Julia has a small general store in her house and also sells clothing and cosmetics. Her daughter helps her sell the clothing and cosmetics at the university. She accepts payments in cash or in installments. Thanks to these two activities Miss Julia can support her family and provide an education for her children. The loan she is requesting will be used buy sand, cement, building blocks and iron (metal) to build an additional bedroom so she can provide her children a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Libertad Leal, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Julia tiene 50 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos, una joven de 18 años y un niño de 7 años. Doña Julia tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa de habitación y también se dedica a la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Su hija le ayuda colocando ropa y cosméticos en la universidad, sus ventas las realiza al contado y al crédito. Estas dos actividades que doña Julia realiza le ayudan a mantener su hogar, y darles educación a sus hijos. El crédito lo quiere para comprar arena, cemento, bloques y hierros para construir un cuarto de habitación ya que desea darles una vivienda más digna a sus dos hijos.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a bedroom.

loans.name: Gairat

texts.en:
J. Gairat is 25 years old, and he lives in the B.Gafurov region in Tajikistan. Mr. J. works in the Khujand and rents a mini-market there. He offers an assortment of goods such as bedspreads, roller towels, tea towels, bath towels, children bicycles, office equipment, and mobile telephones.

Mr. J. is requesting a loan of $1200 for a shop in the new modern market that is opening in the B.Gafurov region.

loans.use: To open a shop in the new modern marketplace

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.es:
Tiburciana, Julia, and Victoria have belonged to the Agua Viva communal bank for 3, 11, and 9 years, respectively.

Tiburciana is married, is 50-years-old, and has 7 chidren, five of whom live with her. Tiburciana sells anticuchos (marinated meat) on the new bridge as a street vendor.

On the other hand, Julia is married, is 51-years-old, and has 8 children, one of whom lives with her. Julia makes a living by selling flowers in her town. She makes her sales as a street vendor in the Nery García market. Julia and her husband also buy and sell animals.

Victoria is married, is 37-years-old, and has 4 children. Victoria and her sister wash cars in a local rented location. Victoria also sells clothing on credit, products which she brings from the city of Lima. Tiburciana, Julia, and Victoria need loans of 800 soles, 1500 soles, and 800 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of chili peppers, garlic, oil, bull, sheep, car soap, and silicone.

The dreams of Tiburciana, Julia, and Victoria are to have a local stable, to improve their businesses, to implement their businesses with machines, and to give their children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Tiburciana, Julia y Victoria pertenecen al Banco Comunal Agua Viva hace 3, 11, 9 años respectivamente.

Tiburciana es conviviente, tiene 50 años y 7 hijos de los cuales 5 viven con ella, Tiburciana vende anticuchos en el puente nuevo de manera ambulante.

Por otro lado Julia es casada, tiene 51 años y 8 hijos de los cuales 1 vive con ella, Julia de dedica al cultivo de flores en su pueblo, sus ventas lo realiza de manera ambulante en el mercado Nery García. Además Julia junto a su esposo compran y venden animales.

Mientras que Victoria es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Victoria junto a su hermana prestan servicios de lavado de carros en un local alquilado. Además Victoria vende ropa al crédito, productos que trae de la ciudad de Lima.

Tiburciana, Julia y Victoria necesitan préstamos de 800 soles, 1500 soles, 800 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de ají, ajo, carne, aceite, toro, oveja, champú de carro y silicona.

Los sueños de Tiburciana, Julia y Victoria son tener un local estable, mejorar sus negocios, implementar su negocio con más maquinas y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: Tiburciana, Julia and Victoria need loans of 800 soles, 1500 soles, and 800 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of chili peppers, garlic, meat, oil,  bull,  sheep, car soap, and silicone.

loans.name: Hadija's Sana Tu Group

texts.en:
Hadija is 39 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 9-15.Hadija sells clothes, a business that she started in 2005. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $110 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Fatime, who has a business dealing in fish sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mayela

texts.es:
Mayela belongs to the Mujeres Soñadoras community bank, located at Jirón Tnt. Carlos López 120, in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 53 years old and the mother of 7 children. Her husband is a driver, but his income is not enough to support the family so Mayela, with her first loan from Manuel Ramos, invested in a small amount of clothing for resale.

She currently has fixed up an of her house from where she can sell clothing, and this also makes is easier for her to take care of her home and to rent out rooms. She is always busy and this makes her feel fulfilled. With her businesses and with much effort, she is getting ahead.

With another loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy merchandise such as: clothing, shoes, jewelry, watches, etc.

Mayela works hard because she wants to have a peaceful, worry-free life, and with the income she has, in the future she would like to expand her storefront and sell other products.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Mayela pertenece al Banco Comunal _Mujeres Soñadoras, ubicado en el Jr. Tnt. Carlos López 120, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 53 años y es madre D. 7 hijo, su esposo es chofer, pero los ingresos económicos con los que cuanta no le alcanza para mantener a su familia, es así que Mayela con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña venta D. ropas.

En la actualidad ha acondiciono un ambiente en su casa para poder ofrecer sus prendas D. vestir, y le facilita también cuidar D. su casa y D. su alquiler D. cuartos, siempre esta en constante actividad y eso la hace sentirse mas realizada, con sus negocios esta saliendo adelante a base D. mucho esfuerzo.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará mercadería como: ropas, zapatos, joyas, relojes, etc.

Mayela trabaja mucho por que quiere tener una vida mas tranquila sin preocupaciones, con los ingresos que tiene en el futuro esta pensando ampliar mas su local y vender otros productos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret Z. is a 50-year-old widow and mother of six children. Margaret lost her husband through a car accident, which according to her was a great loss indeed. She is a local manufacturer of palm kernel oil, which is used to prepare many local dishes. Her operation is on a limited scale because she lacks capital to buy machines for the processing. She wants to take advantage of the loan to buy more raw material (palm kernels) and processing equipment to increase her efficiency and produce larger quantities. She believes this will help to expand her business and increase her income to provide for her family and finance her children’s educations. She belongs to the community group called “So mu yie” (Handle with care) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee each other, serving as social collateral to access loans and to apply peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy more raw material (palm kernels) and processing equipment.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla has been selling groceries and drinks in Novomoskovsk's central market for ten years. A true entrepreneur, she studies the market to determine client needs and preferences. Industrious and enterprising, Alla is focused on expanding her business. Presently, she has a monthly income of about $600.

Alla is currently seeking a loan for 1,500 Grivnas. She plans to use the loan to increase her assortment of fresh merchandise and expand her business. With the increased sales and profits, Alla hopes to open additional vending kiosks and improve the living standards of her family.

Note: this is a short term express loan that will be repaid in one month.

loans.use: To purchase fresh groceries to expand her food market business

loans.name: Thi Lap

texts.vi:
Mrs. Lap joined the TYM Fund in 1998. Before that her family's income only came from farming and rearing pigs. After joining the Fund and having more capital, she decided to invest in raising cows to breed and sell. Currently, she has 2 cows to breed and 3 cows to sell. Apart from livestock and farming, her family can also rely on fishing so her family's income is very stable. After 10 years of membership, Mrs. Lap has been one of the members who use their loans effectively. This time, she would like to borrow 18,000,000VND (1,100USD) to continue investing in raising cows. Her monthly income is 4,000,000VND (about 266USD).

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Lập tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Trước đây gia đình chị chỉ trồng trọt chăn nuôi lợn để phát triển kinh tế gia đình . Sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ tình thương có thêm nguồn vốn vay gia đình chị đã đầu tư để chăn nuôi thêm bò thịt và bò sinh sản. Hiện tại gia đình chị đang nuôi 2 con bò sinh sản và 3 con bò thịt. Ngoài chăn nuôi, trồng trọt gia đình chị còn có thêm nghề đánh bắt cá vì thế thu nhập của gia đình chị rất ổn định. Qua 10 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương đến nay chị Lập là một trong những thành viên sử dụng vốn rất hiệu quả. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 18.000.000 đ để ttiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò Thu nhập 4.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Raising cows

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a husband and father of 3. He is 51 years old and lives in a suburb of Beirut that is frequently underserved by financial institutions and public services. Adnan owns a small cafe that provides a modest income for his family.

Adnan has been working in the bamboo industry before opening the coffee shop. In order to increase the household income, Adnan would like to purchase bamboo raw material so that with his wife, they can produce and sell bamboo items for which there is a demand especially for baskets. Adnan has requested $1,000 to purchase the material required. This is the fourth time Adnan has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. Adnan is a very serious borrower who has always repaid his debts on time.

loans.use: Purchase bamboo raw material

loans.name: Ahammd

texts.en:
Ahammd is 21 years old, single and lives with his family. He does not have a formal education, but has learned a lot working with his father for the last six years in a car-repair shop. He loves this line of work, and wants to expand the family business as soon as possible.

He has applied for a loan to buy more replacement parts. By expanding his business, he hopes to improve his life and the life of his family.

He would like to thank all the lenders whose help makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To expand a car-repair shop

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is married and has a 9-year-old son. She owns a retail business located at the city market at Zydachiv. She sells various goods like fabrics, threads, colognes, perfumes, personal hygiene products, etc. Her monthly gross revenue amounts to 25,000 UAH; the net income is about 5,000 UAH.

Natalia has been working in this business for 8 years. When she started she realized that she liked this business and it can be successful. She began to increase number of goods and their variety. Hard work and a good reputation helped Natalia develop her business and reach sustainability and success. 

Natalia would like to get a loan for 4,500 UAH to buy goods for the coming winter season. Natalia hopes that increased sales will generate additional income and help her to pay for heating of her house during the winter.

loans.use: Increase the variety of her goods

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
El Sr. Julián F. tiene 42 años de edad, esta casada con la Señora Zulma Insfran de 40 años de profesión ama de casa, tienen dos hijos uno en edad escolar y otro recién nacido.

 Julián nos cuenta que la casa donde viven la había heredado  de sus padres. Nos comento además  que  para comenzar su negocio  en el año 2003,  con un préstamo que adquirió de un familiar realizo las primeras compras y ventas de artículos de primera necesidad como: arroz, fideo, azúcar, etc. hoy día  gracias al buen ingreso  que  su negocio le genera puede cubrir los gastos de la casa y  brindarle una buena educación a su hijo.  
El crédito solicitado es  para la compra de mercaderías tales como arroz, azúcar, fideos, carne, lácteos, pan, enlatados, verduras y frutas, ya que se aproxima  la fiesta de fin de año y quiere aumentar el stock de su mercadería, para poder brindarles una buena atención a sus clientelas.
texts.en:
Julián F. is 42 years old and is married to Zulma Insfran, 40, who is a homemaker. They have two children, one in school and the other a baby.

Julián tells us that the house they live in was inherited from his parents. In order to start his business in 2003, he took out a loan from a relative. He made his first purchases and sales of staples such as rice, pasta, sugar, etc. These days, thanks to the good income his business brings in, he is able to cover household expenses and to pay for his son's good education. He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar, pasta, meat, dairy products, bread, canned goods, vegetable and fruit. With the end-of-year festivities approaching he wants to expand his inventory in order to satisfy his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of meat, dairy products, canned goods, fruit, vegetables, oil, flour, etc

loans.name: Eddy Pantaleon

texts.es:
El señor de Nombre Eddy Pantaleón A. C. tiene la edad de 41 años, su estado civil es casado, este Señor tiene 2 hijos de los cuales sus edades son las siguientes una mujer de 18 años y cursa el 1 año de la carrera de odontología y su hijo varón de 13 años que cursa el 2 año de secundaria, su compañera de vida labora como laboratorista, los propósitos que tiene  son aumentar en su producción ya que le proporcionaría mas ingresos que le han sido de beneficio tanto para su familia y para el mismo, en sus deseos esta el permanecer con salud para continuar con su trabajo, en sus sueños esta el llegar a educar a sus hijos para que en un futuro estos sean personas de bien y sean personas preparadas ante cualquier situación que se les presente.


La actividad económica a la que se dedica es el destace de cerdo, la ubicación de su negocio es en malpaisillo en la siguiente dirección de la gasolinera PETRONIC 4 cuadras al sur, el tiempo que tiene de poseer el negocio es 15 años, su negocio inicia con la compra de la cabeza de cerdos ya que su papa administraba este tipo de trabajo como lo es el destace de cerdo y decide independizarse estableciendo su propio negocio por lo que recibe la suficiente afluencia de clientes y esto lo motiva a seguir adelante  su negocio por lo que necesita el financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdo ya que tiene que salir a las diferentes comarcas para que la compra de los cerdos le sea mas favorable.
texts.en:
Eddy Pantaleón A. C. is 41 years old and is married. He has 2 children whose ages are the following: a daughter who is 18 years old and is studying her first year in dentistry, and a son who is 13 years old and is in his second year of middle school. His wife works in a laboratory. His goal is to increase his production, since this would give him a larger income, which has been beneficial as much to his family as to himself. He hopes to continue to have good health so he can continue with his work. He dreams of educating his children so that they can be successful and be prepared to deal with any situation they might be confronted with. Eddy works in pork butchering. His business is located in Malpaisillo, at the following address: Four blocks south of the Petronic 4 gas station. He has had this business for 15 years. He began the business by buying pig heads, since his father also worked in pork butchering, and he decided to become independent by establishing his own business, which has provided him with plenty of customers, which motivates him to continue with his business. He needs working capital to buy pork because he has to go to different regions to buy the pigs that are most economically favorable for him.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Uguloy

texts.ru: Джураева Угулой проживает в городе Яван.Пять лет назад оствалась одна с четырьмя детьми на руках. Ее муж умер и теперь она одна обеспечивает и воспитывает своих детей. Взяв в руки  дело мужа , а он занимался куплепродажей крупно-рогатого скота , сама занялась этим делом. Доход получаемый от ее дела хватает только , чтобы прокормить семью. Она планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы купить еще одного бычка . Таким образом у нее будет дополнительная возможность заработать. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Uguloy J. lives in the town of Yavan. Five years ago she became a single parent of four children. Her husband died and now she supports and raises the children by herself. She took over her husband's business, the buying and selling of cattle, and now does the work herself. The income she receives from this business is just enough to feed the family. She plans to take out a loan to buy another bull, giving her an additional source of revenue. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Orzugul

texts.ru:
Саидмуродова Орзугул Самаровна 1976 года рождения, замужем, у нее 2 детей. Занимается продажей детской обуви, на рынке "Станция" города Вахдат. Предпринимательскую деятельность начала в 2004 году с продажи детской одежды. В данный момент у нее детские зимние обуви (ботинки, сапоги и галоши). Товары для продажи привозит с оптового рынка «Корвон» города Душанбе. 
Ассортимент продаваемых ею товаров она хочет пополнить разновидностями спортивных обувей. Орзугул хочет участвовать в программе Кива и получить займ в сумме 1500 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев для закупа сезонных товаров.
texts.en:
Orzugul S. is married and has 2 children. Orzugul sells shoes for children at "Station" market in Vakhdat. She has been in business since 2004. At present, Orzugul sells mainly winter shoes, which she purchases at a wholesale market in Dushanbe. Orzugul will use this loan to add sports shoe models to her inventory. She will repay this loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sports shoes inventory

loans.name: Kissa

texts.en:
Kissa has been selling  cooking oil and maize in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She belongs to Amani group loan (Group code 2005).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $350. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more cooking oil and maize for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Kissa  is 45 years old, married, and has five children: ages 22, 19, 18, 15, and 10.

loans.use: To buy more cooking oil and maize for her business

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou N. est un tailleur qui habite au quartier Som de Thiès.  Il sollicite ce prêt pour l’acquisition d’une nouvelle machine à coudre afin de faire face aux nouveaux modèles des femmes.  Tailleur de profession ce prêt lui permet de renforcer son activité pour pouvoir se marier dans le futur et bien entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Mamadou N. is a tailor in the Som neighborhood in Thiès. He's seeking this loan to buy a new sewing machine, in order to be able to make new designs for women. A trained tailor, this loan will enable him to bolster his business, in order to get married in the future and take care of his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба – молодая женщина 32 лет, замужем и мать 2-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как в сельских местностях принято рожать больше 3-х детей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a young 32 year old woman; she is married and is the mother of 2 children. Her husband purchases and sells livestock at the livestock market. Mahbuba fattens large livestock at home. She helps her husband to grow his business because she would like to have more income in order to expand their family as in rural areas it is customary to give birth to more than 3 children. They would like to use the loan in order to increase their livestock headcount and to increase their income.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is engaged in direct selling AVON cosmetics products. She is 42 years old, married, and has three children namely: Jerald, 25; Maynard, 19 who is currently in college; and Jerwin, 16 who just graduated high school and will be enrolling in college soon.

They live happily in Barangay Minanga Sur Iguig, Cagayan. The village where they live is an agricultural based community where farming is the main source of income. She is hoping to improve her small business in their village and be able to work hand in hand with her husband to improve their way of life. 

Edna is hoping that she will be able to receive a loan of PHP10,000.00 for her direct selling business. She intends to use the loan as additional capital for her business to purchase more items, thus increasing her profit. She carefully budgets her income in order to support her family's basic needs. She also wants to save for the education of her children. The loan will be a big help towards increasing her income, which will help to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Heng M. and her husband Kimheng are both 27 years old and reside in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. They own a plot of land close to their village where they make a living as vegetable cultivators. They grow crops like cabbages, morning glories, cucumbers, and Chinese kale and they are able to plant twice a year. Besides their farm work, Kimheng also repairs boats. The family have three children, who are all single and attending school.

Heng M. is applying for a loan to purchase boat repair materials to support her husband's business. She plans to use some of the loan for farming activities.

She and her husband are pictured.

loans.use: To purchase boat repair materials.

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Por ser madre soltera y con dos hijos que mantener, la señora María de los Angeles se dedica a la venta de diversos productos teniendo su propia pulpería la que ha abastecido con varios productos comestibles.

Ella es una dama que en todo momento ha buscado la manera de mejorar sus condiciones y para esto una vez más ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos como lo son golosinas, galletas, meneítos, entre otros para surtir su negocio y brindar mejores condiciones a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Because she is a single mother with two children to care for, Maria de los Angeles sells various items in her own store, which she has stocked with myriad food products. This is a woman who has always been on the lookout for a way to improve her life, and she has once more approached Kiva partner Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase products such as candies, cookies, and jell-o, among other things, to stock up her store and provide her small children with better [living] conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 43 años, es una persona muy querida por sus vecinos debido a su buen carácter. Es viuda y tiene 4 hijos que viven cómodamente en su casa propia. Ella es propietaria de varios terrenos cultivables; donde siembra (con la ayuda de sus hijos y peones) plátanos, piñas y mayormente café. Además, cada semana también se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas, para ello se traslada las chacras donde tiene a más de 20 agricultores que la abastecen de diversas frutas a precios muy cómodos, de ese modo ella revende a precios accesibles a sus compañeras de comercio ambulante. Desde entonces ha ganado mucha clientela, sus compradores la conocen como “Camicha” y ella es muy feliz con su negocio, pues se siente una madre muy útil que puede financiar la educación de sus hijos, con miras de que logren ser profesionales. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, demostrando puntualidad en cada una de sus cuotas y en su cargo como tesorera de su banco comunal. Carmen tiene un trato muy amable para realizar las cobranzas a los integrantes de su grupo, pero de incumplir alguno de ellos los anima a ser responsables con palabras muy serias, las cuales escuchan todos atentamente. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá para incrementar la cantidad de frutas que vende.
texts.en:
Carmen is 43 years old and is is very loved by her neighbors because of her good character. She is a widow and has four children who live comfortably in her own house. She is the owner of several cultivable fields where she plants (with the help of her children and laborers) bananas, pineapples, and mostly coffee. In addition, each week she works buying and selling fruit. For that she goes to the farms where she has more than 20 farmers who supply her with various fruits at very good prices. In this way she is able to resell at prices accessible to her street vendor companions. Over time she has earned many clients. Her customers know her as Camicha and she is very happy with her business since she feels she is a useful mother who can finance the education of her children, with hopes they can achieve their goal of becoming professionals. This is her fifth credit with MFP, demonstrating punctuality with each of her repayments. In her position as treasurer of the communal bank Carmen has a very friendly way of carrying out collections from the members of her group but if any of them do not make their payments she encourages them to be responsible with very serious words, which they listen to carefully. The money she requests will be invested to increase the quantity of fruits she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the inventory of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy potatoes in bulk and improve her working place by making some renovations.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en: Kareem K. is 30 years old and married. He has a shop where he sells VCDs. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 nairas to purchase more VCDs to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan is living a simple life in Sto. Domingo, Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya with her family. He just graduated from high school in March 2009 at the age of 30. He believes that one is never too old enough to pursue his studies. However, he could not continue on to college due to lack of financial resources. Instead, he will help his parents cultivate their rice field and vegetable farm. He wanted to save for his future family. But, in the meantime, he will help his parents to earn a living. 

They get their major source of income from farming. At the moment, Ryan is now cultivating their farmland twice a year by planting rice and a variety of vegetables. He is now asking for a loan of PHP36,000 from Kiva lenders. This amount will be used to maintain their rice field and to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, insecticide, and labor fees for farm laborers. Some will be used for food and snacks. He hopes that lenders will trust him with business capital for his farm.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama A. sells accessories like traditional earrings, pomade and cosmetics at Abrodzirum near Shama-Kedzi. She is a widow and has one child. Ama has no formal education. She has been in her business since 1984. Ama uses her income to pay fees and settle bills. Ama will use this loan to buy more earrings and other jewelry to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save towards the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more earrings,  jewelry and cosmetics

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en:
Visitacion is 59 years old. But despite her age, she is still very determined to work from Monday to Saturday. She is engaged in the hog-raising business but aside from this, she is also working as a laborer or helper to earn additional income. She used to own a dress-making business, however, she temporarily closed it and decided to venture into raising hogs.

Visitacion dreams of continuing her dressmaking business because it was her major source of income before. She wanted to have additional capital, and that's why she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 from KIVA lenders for the maintenance of her hog-raising business and to earn more income. She is hoping that God will make a way to be able to make her business successful someday and to reach all her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Abau

texts.en: Abau S. is currently in the business of selling phaste and bread and is requesting a loan to stock more groundnuts to make phaste to sell. Abau is 22 years old and is married. Her husband who is a soldier. She has one child and her child does not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts to make phaste to sell

loans.name: Faatali

texts.en:
Faatali P. is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Satapuala. She is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Faatali owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting taro for sale. Faatali has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 680 WST a month from these activities.

Faatali joined Kiva partner SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,700 WST from SPBD. This loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Faatali is now requesting a new loan of 2,450 WST, which will also be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. The loan will be her third from SPBD. Faatali plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

Faatali was not affected by the tsunami which hit Samoa on 9/29/09.

About SPBD
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Mariette

texts.es:
Mariette, tiene una pensión familiar y su esposo trabaja distribuyendo refrescos en la empresa Pepsi tiene tres hijos
Vive en la zona de villa san Antonio Bajo de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (compra de insumos para la pensión y ayudarle en capital de trabajo para la distribución de refrescos)
Es la séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Mariette runs a family boarding house. Her husband works for Pepsi as a distributor of soft drinks. The couple has three children. They live in the Villa San Antonio Bajo district of the city of La Paz in the home of Mariette’s parents.

The loan will be used as operating capital to buy supplies for the boarding house. Part of the loan will also be used for her husband’s soft drink distribution business.

This is Mariette’s seventh loan with IMPRO. Her credit history qualifies her with a client rating of “1”, which indicates she has been very good at completing her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her boarding house & beverages for her husband's distribution business

loans.name: Bettsy

texts.es:
Bettsy es una jovial madre de 23 años, vive con su pareja en la casa de su madre. 
Anteriormente apoyaba a sus padres con sus cultivos de café y plátanos, pero desde que formó su propia familia, se dedica a la compra y venta de plátanos juntamente con su esposo. Dos veces por semana madrugan para comprar sus plátanos en chacras que están bien alejadas, pues ahí los encuentran a un precio bajo y así les resulta más rentable porque al llegar al pueblo los venden a un menor precio y también los llevan a la capital de su región donde obtienen mejores ganancias. 
Para el futuro, desean compra su propio terreno, donde puedan construir su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, Bettsy se siente muy agradecida, ya que su préstamo anterior le permitió iniciar su negocio y con éste incrementará su capital.
texts.en:
Bettsy is a happy mother who is 23 years of age. She and her partner live at home with her mother.

Bettsy previously helped her parents with their coffee and banana crops. Now that she has her own family, she buys and sells bananas along with her husband. Twice a week, they leave early to buy fruit directly from the banana farms since they are located a considerable distance from where they live. They are able to obtain their products at a low price, which makes them more profitable when they take them into the regional capital where they can generate better revenues. In the future, Bettsy and her husband want to buy their own land so that they can build a house and improve their quality of life.

This is her second loan with MFP. Bettsy is very grateful for her previous loan, since it enabled her to start her business. The money from this loan will be used to increase her capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her operating capital for buying & selling bananas

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La socia MARGARITA es una humilde madre que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”. 

La socia tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y tienen cuatro hijos.  Los mayores estudian en la Universidad Maynor, Eduard, y Lehaz y la menor Fabiola en el colegio. Ellos viven en el distrito de Santiago de la provincia del Cusco. La socia tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de productos secos como maíz, trigo, cebada, fréjoles y habas los productos los trae de la pampa de Mollepata y pampa de Anta. Ella en su domicilio en posas hace la germinación de granos de maíz (jora) y vende a la chicherias (Lugar donde se prepara la bebida alcohólica de la chicha de jora). Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia. La socia requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio comprando más maíz y productos secos.  
  
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member Margarita is a humble mother who belongs to the Virgin of Chapi Communal Bank. She is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children. The 3 eldest, Maynor, Eduard, and Lehaz, study in the University, while the youngest, Fabiola, is in public school. They live in the district of Santiago, Province of Cusco.

Margarita has a small business selling dry goods such as corn, wheat, barley, beans, and peas. These products are brought from the valleys of Mollepata and Anta. She germinates grains of corn in her own home and sells them to the makers of 'chicha', the local alcoholic beverage. She has been doing this for years and it has gone very well, thanks to the effort she has put into it. She is a hard-working and enterprising mother who is advancing her family.

Margarita needs a loan to increase her business's capital and buy more corn and dry goods. She is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and she also promises to comply with the corresponding repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO INCREASE HER CAPITAL AND BUY MORE CORN AND DRY GOODS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Ut

texts.en:
Ut S., 37, is a hardworking woman who resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Ut S. was married, but divorced her husband years ago. She now has three kids who attend school and depend on her income.

To pursue a daily income, Ut S. built a medium-sized grocery shop where she sells different types of cooking ingredients to her villagers for a profit. Normally she sells her items in retail or in bulk and she is able to earn around $10 each day to manage her family’s daily requirements.

Recently Ut S. exhausted her wares and she hopes to acquire more inventory to continue selling. Due to her lack of money, Ut S. requests a loan of $1,200 which will enable her to purchase inventory to sell.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her shop

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa ventured into farming in 2006. She recently joined CEVI, an MFI, to expand her business opportunities. As a married woman with two children, she has to make an income to sustain her family. She is now preparing her land farm for planting. She needs farm inputs so she applied for a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos. With this amount, Elisa will be able to purchase farm supplies like seeds, fertilizers, and more.

loans.use: Farm inputs like seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Salvit

texts.es:
