texts.en: Risa, 22 years of age, has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for the last six years.  He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy more sheep and goats to rear and later sell at a profit.  In the future, Risa hopes to practice zero-grazing, which is easier to manage.

loans.use: To buy more sheep and goats to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta, 46 years old, is a married woman from the town of Banga. She is engaged in farming. She particularly plants and harvests rice crops. She rents a stall at the market to sell her harvest. Violeta works hard to support her family financially.

Violeta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jessenia Mariela

texts.es:
Jessenia tiene 35 años D. edad  es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos. ElL.  viene trabajando con EDAPROSPO  más D. 5 años. Jessenia  tiene un kiosco D. venta D. golosinas, gaseosas y comida, se dedica a esta labor desD. hace 10 años. ElL. inició esta actividad gracias a su hermana quién le dejó su pequeño kiosco, emprendió esta labor con L. idea D. obtener ganancias para ayudar con los gastos D. L. casa y D. sus hijos a su esposo. ElL. solicitó el préstamo para comprar mercadería (golosinas, gaseosas, panes, confitería) para su pequeño negocio y algunos ingredientes para L. comida que venD. como: arroz azúcar y aceite, al por mayor ya que esto le permite ahorrar un poco. Jessenia  sueña con tener un restaurante o una 
Tienda comercial en L. zona por dónD. vive.
texts.en:
Jessenia, 35, has a live-in partner and four children.  She has been collaborating with EDAPROSPO for over five years.  Jessenia has a small sales kiosk where she sells snacks, soft drinks and food.  She’s been in this business for 10 years.

She started the business thanks to her sister who gave her her small kiosk.  She started the work hoping to earn profits to help her husband meet her household and her children’s expenses.

She requested the loan to buy merchandise (snacks, soft drinks, bread, sweets) for her small business as well as some ingredients for the food she sells like: rice, sugar and oil, at wholesale because this allows for some savings.

Jessenia dreams with owning a restaurant or a commercial store in the area where she lives.

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: sweets, soft drinks, rice, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Ameen's Group

texts.en:
Ameen is one member of this group loan from Kiva partner Asasah. 

She is a caring and supportive lady. In order to help financially support her family, she does stitching works. She learned this art before her marriage and now is taking full advantage from it. She receives orders from different boutiques and ready-made clothes shops and completes the orders on time to earn for her family.
 
She belongs to Pakpattan, which is a small city of Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. She lives there in a two-room brick house with her family in the area of Peer Karian road. She moved there after her marriage.
 
She has given birth to two daughters and a son. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education.
 
Ameen’s husband is a very hardworking person. He operates a business of making wooden cots. He started this business 30 years ago and in this number of years he has successfully built a good reputation among his clients for his good work. He also makes other furniture like chairs and tables and sells to different furniture shops on profit.
   
Ameen has applied for a loan for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy wood and nails in larger quantity for making good quantity cots for selling.
 
She is hopeful that her husband will successfully be able to make his business more profitable after investing loan money into it.
 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ameen.

loans.use: To buy wood and nails for wooden cot-making business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
M. is currently in the business of selling siko (a local beer), simsim (sesame seeds), beans and small fish. She is 23 years old and married to a man who is in the army.  They have 4 children and none of them goes to school.

M. borrowed a loan to stock more siko, simsim, beans and fish to sell. She hopes to expand her business with any extra profits in the future.

loans.use: Stock more siko, simsim, beans and small fish to sell.

loans.name: Faida

texts.en:
Faida is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She is married to a businessman who contributes to the family's basic needs. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years she has operated a grocery stall, selling green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions. Her customers are from the neighboring community.

Faida faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale stall in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of tomatoes and potatoes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of tomatoes and potatoes for sale

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga is a 43-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has 6 children, the oldest of whom is 17 years old.

Dominga is engaged in farming. She has been growing rice for 20 years. She sells her harvest to the market. Dominga also sells fish caught by her husband, who is a fisherman. Dominga works hard to support her family.

This loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fishing nets

loans.name: Aereopaquita Nidia

texts.es: Aereopaquita Nidia se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Tiene más de 32 años en este negocio, ella es una persona muy trabajadora a pesar de la edad que tiene. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ofrecerles a sus clientes un buen servicio y al mismo tiempo se preocupa por brindarles a sus clientes lo que ellos le solicitan. Es por eso que actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, camisetas entre una gran variedad de ropa en general. Sueña con mejorar las condiciones de vida  de ella y su familia.
texts.en: Aereopaquita Nidia's business is selling used clothing.  She has been in this business for more than 32 years.  She is a very hard-working person in spite of her age and has always been noted for offering good customer service and taking care to provide her customers with what they request.  She is requesting this loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, t-shirts and a wide variety of clothes in general.  Aereopaquita dreams of improving her own living conditions as well as those of her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, t-shirts and other clothes

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en: Amalia is 28 years old and married. She has a clothing business where she sells various types of clothes in the market. She has had the business for over five years. Amalia is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy additional clothes to sell in the market. Each month, Amalia earns about PHP 15,000 per month doing this type of business. Growing of her business is her desire to continue sending her children to school to receive their education.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes to sell

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is from the village of Gata, Jimenez, Mis. Occ. She is 39 years old, married and has no children. To make a living, Rosie runs a business venture in the retail sector selling a variety of different products in the local community.

Rosie has been engaged in her business for 12 years and earns approximately 1300 PHP a month for these activities. Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Rosie is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP with which she will purchase additional inventory and use for working capital. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Rosie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell in her general store.

location.town: Tudela-Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Chhem lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She is a rice cultivator, earning an income of around $1.50 a day to help support the family expenses. Her husband helps her in the rice-planting business. Chhem also does casual work for additional income.

The couple has three children, two of whom are studying in public school and are still dependent on their parents' income. Chhem will be using her loan to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. Chhem and her husband appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es:
Oscar, es soltero, vive con su madre, se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo y res, tiene 3 años de dedicarse al destazo, dos veces por semana, su horario es de 4:00am a 9:00am, él aprendió de su abuelo, a destazar cerdos y reces, para comercializar la carne.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y una vaca, estos los necesita para destazarlos y comercializar su carne, con este préstamo tendrá la oportunidad de aumentar sus su negocio, teniendo más animales para el destazo.
Su objetivo es hacer crecer el negocio y ayudar a su madre, en todos sus gastos, también superarse económicamente.
texts.en:
Oscar is single, and he lives with his mother.  He sells pork and beef.  He has been a butcher for three years.  He does this twice a week, and his schedule is from 4:00 a.m. until 9:00 a.m.  He learned from his grandfather how to butcher pigs and cows in order to sell the meat.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy pigs and one cow.  He needs them to butcher and sell for their meat.  With this loan he will have the opportunity to increase his business because he will have more animals to butcher.

His objective is to make his business grow and to help his mother with all of the expenses.  He also wants to be financially successful.

loans.use: to buy pigs and a cow to butcher.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en: Jorge, 42 years of age, is single and a father of 3. He's engaged in a livestock business, particularly hog-raising. He's been in this business for almost 6 years. He also has a rice mill. His net income every three months is 30,000 PHP. He's asking for a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase some hogs to raise. He is glad that his business income is now enough to support his children's education. He would like to continue receiving loans to aid the growth of his business and generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to purchase some hogs to raise

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI III  est constitué de femmes mariées du village de SANANKORO dans la sous préfecture de SELINGUE, région de SIKASSO (troisième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles, ont en moyenne 35  ans,  4 enfants et  cultivent de l’arachide, du gombo etc.   
Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso  et  sont à leur  deuxième  prêt  de campagne.
KAMISSA, la première debout à gauche, compte utiliser son  prêt pour acheter, une quantité suffisante de semences d’arachide, des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles,  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de SELEFOUGOU,SELINGUE et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail , souvent en gros, au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Elle compte réaliser, après l’écoulement de sa production agricole, un bénéfice de  65.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BENKADI III is a group composed of married women from the village of SANANKORO in the sub-prefecture of SELINGUE, Region of SIKASSO (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in traditional families, average 35 years of age, and have four children. And they grown peanuts, okra, etc. 

Concerned about making their plantations profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second farm loan. 

KAMISSA, who is standing first from the left in the photo, intends to use her loan to buy a sufficient quantity of peanut seeds, assorted equipment and supplies, and some farm inputs at the big market of SELEFOUGOU.

Following the off-season, the produce is stocked for a while, so that it gains in value.  Then it is sold retail, often in bulk, for cash at the big market of SELEFOUGOU, SELINGUE, and at surrounding markets. Customers generally come from large cities. 

After selling her produce, KAMISSA plans on making a profit of 65,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay the loan interest and to cover typical family expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and assorted supplies and equipment

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is 22 years and has 3 children, ages 1-6, only one in school. Her husband is a businessman. She owns a general store in which she sells different items such as salt, soap, matches, etc. Delphine has done this business for the past 3 years. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family. She needs a loan to reinvest in her business. Delphine wishes to have a wholesale store in the future.

loans.use: to buy some items for her shop.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua makes fante kenkey (a variety of kenkey wrapped in plaintain or banana leaf, rather than maize leaves) at Benyadze near Elmina. She is currently taking care of 2 children.  As a single parent, taking care of her children has not been easy. The loan will help her buy additional bags of corn to make kenkey for distribution. She feeds, clothes and educates her children. She wishes to reinvest the new profit. In the picture above, she has some fante kenkey on a tray on her lap.

loans.use: The loan will help her buy additional bags of corn to make kenkey for distribution.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es:
Carlos es un señor de 36 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa e hijos, en una comunidad llamada Osa, localizada en Caña Blancal esto en la provincia de Puntarenas. Está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona rural muy visitada por sus playas. Sus principales actividades económicas son las turísticas y agropecuarias.

Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposa le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte y que los vecinos de la comunidad se han sentido satisfechos con el servicio brindado.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Carlos es un micro crédito de ¢500,000(quinientos mil colones), para compra de cerdos, y para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su proyecto.

Don Carlos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Con este préstamo se espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 36 year old man.  He lives with his wife and children in a community called Osa in Caña Blancal in the Puntarenas province.  This community is located in a rural area that is frequently visited for its outstanding beaches.  The main economic activities here are tourism and agriculture.  

Carlos says the he has the support and help of his wife which allows him to continue with his venture.  He also says that he is very interested in this venture as he has seen how, little by little, his business has grown.   He has seen the demand grow stronger each time and his neighbors in the community have been satisfied with the service he offers.  

At this time Don Carlos is requesting a micro loan of ¢500,000 (Five hundred thousand colones) to purchase pigs and to give his venture the best possible support and maintenance.  

Don Carlos is a member of the communal bank Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Caña Blancal, one of the 110 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  He hopes this loan will help him to grow more on a personal as well as on an financial level.  Also, he would like to express his gratitude to these organizations and the lenders as the loan allows him to dedicate more time to productive activities.

loans.use: purchase pigs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 39-year-old single mother of 3 children with ages ranging from 5 to 12. She considers herself to be a visionary woman. 

Rose operates a retail store where she sells sugar, rice, beans, maize, sodas and bread in a shopping centre. She has been in this business for 3 years.  Before this she was involved in farming. She describes her biggest business challenges is inflation and seasonality. 

Rose will use this KES 50,000 loan to purchase sugar and maize to sell at her store. She hopes to be able to expand her business to wholesale and to open retail shops in various towns one day in the future.

loans.use: purchase sugar and maize

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Antonio le esta haciendo falta el piso de concreto en patio de enfrente de la casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar el material que, arena y cemento ya que el se encargara de realizar la mejorar en horario adicionales a su empleo.
Don  Antonio elaborar en una fabrica en el aria de producción con este sueldo planea pagar el crédito, ya que su esposa la señora Maria Elena se encargar de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de sus negocio de venta de ropa usada. 
Desea mejorar la viviendo don pronto llegara su primer hijo.
texts.en:
Antonio’s house does not have a concrete floor on the patio in front of his house.  He is requesting a loan to buy the material, sand and cement, because he will make the home improvement by working additional hours at his job.

Antonio works in a factory in the area of production.  He plans to use this salary to pay for the loan.  His wife, Maria Elena, takes care of the family expenses with the income she gets from her business of selling used clothes.

He wishes to make the improvement to his home because his first child will soon arrive.

loans.use: to put down a concrete floor on the patio of his house.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 43-year-old married man with 10 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family rests on him and his dream is to educate his children up to the university level. 

Moses owns a bar and he has operated it for the last five years. His hardship is price flactuation and his dream is to have a big bar and hotel. Moses needs a loan to buy crates of beer for resale.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her small grocery store as well as continue to sell tortillas.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Judith has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Judith has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Judith hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Nematillo

texts.ru: Нематилло женат и любящий отец 4 детей. Он умный и добросовестный человек. Для содержания семьи и улучшения домашних условий, он начинал свой бизнес 10 лет назад. Нематилло занимается купле-продажей продуктов питания  в своем магазине, который находится возле его дома. В этом бизнесе помогает ему его любящая жена. Они вместе усердно работают. За товарами ездит сам Нематилло 3-4 раза в месяц в соседний город. Его сын после возвращения из армии тоже помогают в бизнесе. Нематилло запрашивает займ для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов с целью увлечения оборотного капитала.
texts.en: Nematillo is married and is a loving father of four children. He is smart and conscientious person.  In order to support his family and improve home conditions, he started his own business ten years ago.  Nematillo is involved in buying and selling food products in his store, which is located near his house.  His beloved wife helps him with this business, and they work diligently together.  Nematillo travels to the nearby town to buy his products 3-4 times per month.  Now that his son returned from the army, he also helps with the business.  Nematillo is requesting this loan for the purchase of a new assortment of products in order to increase his revolving capital.

loans.use: to buy food products in order to increase revolving capital

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, of whom only two go to school. She takes care of additional family members, including her grandchildren. She sells fired cassava (a root similar to a potato) and pancakes on a retail basis. She works six days a week. She has been in business for the last three years.

Jane has requested a loan of 400,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO to buy baking flour and cooking oil. Her major business challenge is transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully established bakery and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are utility bills, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
11 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Caacupé trabajan conjuntamente para obtener mayores ingresos y D. esa forma ayudar a sus familias. Luchan diariamente, pues desean darle a sus familias lo mejor, para que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo D. necesidades.
Una D. ellas es Sustiana, quien se dedica a la venta D. pollos, comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio, por lo que ya se ha formado una buena clientela. Gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante y cubrir sus gastos básicos. Ella al igual que sus amigas, integrantes D. comité, desean ayudar a sus familias dándoles una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. pollos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con los pedidos D. su clientela. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
11 women from the city of Caacupé work together to earn a better income to help their families. They fight every day, as they want to give their families the best so that they don't want for anything.

One of them is Sustiana, who sells chickens for a living. She says that her business is going very well as she already has a good customer base. 

Thanks to her work and sacrifice, she has been able to support her family and cover their basic expenses. She and her friends, the members of the communal bank, want to help their families and give them a decent life.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy chickens to fulfil her customer's orders. She thanks the foundation for the opportunity it is giving her.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell on.

loans.name: Ibrahem

texts.en:
Ibrahem is a 27-year-old young man; he is married and works in agrigulture. Ibrahem has a piece of land planted with olive trees, and he wants to prepare well for the winter season. He wants to purchase fertilizers and some necessary farm supplies, such as water pipes, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Ibrahem gets the loan, he will pay to purchase the fertilizers and farm supplies he needs to be well-prepared for the coming winter season. This will enable him to compete with others in the same field and maximize his crop yield, which will increase his income and enable him to provide better living conditions for his family. Ibrahem is shown in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and some farm supplies

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Yanacoto Group

texts.es: Pamela es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Santa Rosa de Yanacoto” grupo conformado por 09 integrantes, la cual tiene más de 03 años trabajando con el Programa-Prosperidad. Pamela tiene 23 años de edad es soltera, actualmente vive con sus padres. Ella se dedica a la elaboración de chocolates donde luego los ofrece a la gente de su zona, la cual  lleva trabajando de esta manera mas de 02 años, gracias a este negocio a podido concluir su carrera de Hotelería y Turismo, aparte de este negocio hace 02 meses empezó a  trabajar en una fábrica de donde obtiene un ingreso mas.  El deseo de Pamela es poner una juglería en su vivienda donde también pueda ofrecer sus productos de chocolates, y así poder ahorrar para sus estudios próximos ya que una de sus metas es  estudiar la carrera Universitaria de Arquitectura. Ella solicito el crédito para comprar insumos para la preparación de chocolates como azúcar, leche, vainilla, manteca y materiales como cajas decorativas, ya que por campaña navideña tiene pedidos que entregar. La Alcancía Comunal “Santa Rosa de Yanacoto” agradece el crédito brindado. Pamela es la que está de pie al lado derecho y viste un polo color fucsia. Sra. Cecilia  no está presente en el desembolso por motivo de trabajo, del Sr. Benito se adjunta la fofo en la parte superior de la fotografía.
texts.en:
Pamela, one of nine members of Santa Rosa de Yanacoto Communal Bank, has been working with Programa Prosperidad for more than three years.  Pamela, 23, is single and currently lives with her parents.

She works making chocolates which she later sells to the people in her area.  She has been working like  this for more than two years.  Thanks to this business she has been able to finish her studies in hotel and tourism management.  In addition to this business, two months ago she began working in a factory, which gives her additional income. 

Pamela's goal is to set up a juice bar in her home where she also can offer her chocolate products.  In this way she will be able to save for her future studies, since one of her goals is to study architecture in the university.

She requested the loan to buy supplies for making chocolate, such as sugar, milk, vanilla, and lard, and materials like decorative boxes, since she has Christmas orders to deliver.  Santa Rosa de Yanacoto Communal Bank is grateful for the loan offered.

Pamela is the one standing on the right side, wearing a fuchsia polo shirt.  Cecilia was not able to be present at the distribution because of work and Sr. Benito appears in the small photo in the upper corner of the photograph.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, vanilla, lard, and decorative boxes.

loans.name: Hounkpo-Nou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUNKPO-NOU est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Sofiatou Abiodoun, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier d’ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Sofiatou Abiodoun est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Laurent. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Sofiatou Abiodoun a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Il y a quinze ans, Sofiatou Abiodoun vend de divers produits (conserves, savons, sucre, etc.). Ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de son enfant. Sofiatou Abiodoun achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Sofiatou Abiodoun désire obtenir un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUNKPO-NOU.
texts.en: The HOUNKPO-NOU group comprises three people who live in the same neighbourhood. The group representative, called Sofiatou Abiodoun, has her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time this group is seeking financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase the scale of their business. Sofiatou Abiodoun is 44 years old and is married to someone called Laurent. They have one dependent child, attending school. Sofiatou Abiodoun stopped school at the secondary level. Sofiatou Abiodoun has sold various products (canned goods, soap, sugar, etc) for fifteen years. This allows her to meet the needs of her child. Sofiatou Abiodoun buys her products in a market in Benin. With a goal of increasing the scale of her business, and to better meet her customers' needs, Sofiatou Abiodoun wishes to have this first loan with ALIDé, together with the other members of the HOUNKPO-NOU group.

loans.use: to purchase various products (canned goods, soaps, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is a 34-year-old married lady with two children living in Kagadi, Uganda. She has a retail shop which she has operated for eight years now in the same area. She started with farming where she got the starting capital for the business. She has dreams of educating her children. The business is being affected by price fluctuations and inflation rates which are affecting her working capital. Maria wants the loan facility to purchase glasses, plates and flasks to sell.

loans.use: to purchase glasses, plates and flasks to sell.

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
"Our business in life is not to get ahead of others, but to get ahead of ourselves." (E. Joseph Cossman). 

Cresencia has been a businesswoman for one year. She is 52 years old and married. She resides at Aquino, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental and is blessed with four siblings at school age. 

She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for eight months already and she borrowed money in Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for additional business capital. Her business is a sari-sari store. She earns about Php 5,000 monthly in her business as profit. She improves her living conditions with the use of the profits.

loans.use: to use as business additional capital.

loans.name: Twungurane Group

texts.fr:
Jeanine fait partie du groupe  Twungurane et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 29 ans et est mariée à Eric, un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  4 enfants  âgés de 2 à 10 ans, dont 2 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bananes   depuis 6 ans. 

Elle est à son dix-septième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de bananes à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Jeanine is part of the group Twungurane and lives in Gitega. She is 29 years old and is married to Eric, a shopkeeper. Together they have 4 children aged from 2 to 10 years old, of whom 2 study.

She has been selling bananas for 6 years.

She is on her seventeenth loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan that she obtains, she is going to increase her capital and buy many bananas to resell to make more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy many bananas to resell to make more.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 43 year-old Mohamed.  He is Married, and has 3 children aged 18,15 and 12yrs-. In 2000, Mohamed established his Redeemed Dress and Shoes business. He began his business because he was trained up as a business man. Working 7 days a week and 12hrs- hours a day, he earns about Le1, 000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le5, 000,000 . Mohamed requires a loan in order to buy more redeemed dress of different in a very large quantity for resale. In the future, Mohamed plans to expand in business and to build house.. He is very hard working   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more redeemed dress of different in a very large quantity for resale

loans.name: Joes Rafael

texts.es: Joes Rafael: Es originaria de Waspam, tiene 45 años de edad, casada con una hija de 14 años de edad que estudia su secundaria. Con el propósito de vivir de manera segura y digna, desde hace 2 años ha iniciado la construcción de su vivienda de minifalda de concreto y madera. Solicita financiamiento, para construir poco a poco su vivienda y comprar materiales de construcción: bloques, cemento, hierro, madera, zinc, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es tener una vivienda segura con las condiciones adecuadas y velar por la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Joes Rafael is originally from Waspam. He is 45 years old, married, and has a 14-year-old daughter who is in high school. With the intent of living securely and decently, he started two years ago the construction of his “minifalda” (a structural design that can withstand earthquakes) house made of concrete and wood.

Joes Rafael is requesting a loan so that he can gradually build his home and purchase construction materials such as blocks, cement, iron, wood, zinc, and nails. He will also cover the cost of labor. His dreams are to have a secure home with adequate conditions and to provide for his child’s education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman  with one child who is still young to attend school .She owns a house that neither  has piped water nor  electricity.Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Lucy  has operated a tailoring business for the past three years. She makes women suits and men suits. Her potential clients are ladies and gents. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase cloth materials, sewing thread for her business

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.en:
Mister Lorezno is married and has three children of 17, 8 and 6 years of age. He lives in the city of Pedro Escobedo in the State of Queretaro. He has a mechanic repair shop for tractors, agriculture being a way of life in this region. Thanks to this he has a good number of clients every week. In 1997 he started his business with his brother-in-law, to separate themselves from their boss and throw themselves into the adventure of owning their own business, one that to date has been successful. Thanks to this business Lorenzo has been able to provide his children the necessities and indispensable needs such as an education. His previous salary was not enough and they faced problems constantly.

He requires a loan of $1200 to purchase parts that he needs, planning to repay the full amount in a term of 6 to 12 months. Lorenzo needs your support to be able to continue the business that he started some 10 years ago. This business that has allowed him to provide his family with daily sustenance. Don\'t doubt it any longer. They need you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Lorenzo esa casado y tiene tres hijos de 17,8 y 6 años de edad, el vive en la localidad de Pedro Escobedo, en el estado de Querétaro. El tiene un taller de reparación de tractores a agrícolas, por ser la agricultura una actividad preponderante en esta región, gracias ha esto el tiene un buen número de clientes cada semana. Inició en 1997 cuando decidió junto con su cuñado independizarse de sus patrón y por su cuenta lanzarse a la aventura de su negocio propio que hasta la fecha le ha dado buenos resultados. Gracias a esta actividad Lorenzo puede brindarles a sus hijos lo necesarios e indispensable como la educación, con su salario anterior no le alcanzaba y enfrentaban problemas constantemente.

El requiere de un préstamo de $1200 DLLS para comprar refacciones que necesita, planeando cubrir el monto total en un plazo de 6 – 12 meses. Lorenzo necesita de tu apoyo para poder continuar con el proyecto que inició ya casi hace 10 años y que le ha permitido darle ha su familia el sustento diario, no lo dudes más, ellos te necesitan.

loans.use: purchase refactions

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim was born in  1965 in Salyan region. Yenikand village. He is married and has 3 children.
Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought 2 calves.
Now he needs a loan of $800 to buy 4 calves.
With this business he meets the demands of his family.

loans.use: To buy 4 calves

loans.name: Faisiniso

texts.en: Faisiniso is married and has two children. She has five years of experience in trading.  At first, she borrowed products from suppliers to sell, agreeing to pay them interest. After hearing about MicroInvest, she became a client and started her business with $100. Her elder son helps her. Their business situated in the open-air market. It is very busy place and she successfully sells her products there. The items she sells includes: navod(traditional sweets), lump sugar, granulated sugar, powdered sugar, icing sugar etc.. She is requesting a loan of $500 to open another store for her son.

loans.use: selling of sugar and sugar products

loans.name: Esteban

texts.en:
Esteban is married and has four sons and two daughters; he's originally from Veracruz, where he started his business selling elotes - corn on the cob -fifteen years ago. Seeking better opportunities, he moved his family to Linares, Nuevo Leon, where he continued his business assisted by his wife and children. Through hard work he has been able to buy two food carts that he uses to sell his products. He's also been able to finance his home and buy a pick up truck. When the opportunity arises, he also works as a mover and making deliveries.

Esteban is a very responsible and entrepreneurial man who wants the best for his family. He's requesting a loan in the amount of US $325 to buy supplies and to expand his elote business. He will repay the loan over a period of 6 months. You can become an important part of his family's life by supporting his business. He is grateful for the opportunity and considers any assistance a blessing.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Esteban es casado y tiene 4 hijos y 2 hijas, es originario de Veracruz, donde inició su negocio de venta de elotes hace quince años, pero en busca de mejores oportunidades para su familia decidieron mudarse a la localidad de Linares en Nuevo León, donde continuó con su trabajo recibiendo la ayuda de su esposa e hijos. Gracias al esfuerzo y buen trabajo que realiza día con día, con el ingreso que obtiene ha logrado adquirir dos triciclos en donde vende sus productos, una camioneta y ha logrado financiar su casa. Cuando tiene oportunidad trabaja también realizando fletes, principalmente a personas que se cambian de casa.

Esteban es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable que sólo busca lo mejor para su familia, en estos momentos necesita de un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos para la preparación de los elotes y poder continuar creciendo con su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte importante en la vida de esta familia, Esteban agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas, tu ayuda será de gran bendición.

loans.use: To purchase supplies

loans.name: Israyil

texts.en: Israyil lives in  Yenikand village in the Salyan region, with his two children.  He is 54 years old and has been farming  for ten years. He wants to improve his business to provide his family with a better future. He is applying for a loan of $475 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Tawai

texts.en: Mrs. Tawai Moshood is 35 years old, she is married with 6 children, and she lives in Benin City. She grinds pepper, beans and tomatoes for people living in her community. She learnt the business from her mother. She is requesting for a loan of $475 to enable her to buy a additional grinding machine and foodstuff for sale so she can help her family.

loans.use: To buy additional machine for granding

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Married and the father of five children, Mr. Kodjo K. is presently living in Kpéssou where he was born in 1958. He was obliged to leave school at a young age and begin an apprenticeship. He is now a master carpenter, whose skill is greatly appreciated by his customers.

Mr. K. currently has quite a number of orders that he would like to fill. For that reason, he is requesting a loan of US$ 600 to purchase wood so that he can produce the furniture his customers have ordered. The income from the sale of this furniture will allow him to better support his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père de cinq (5) enfants, Monsieur K. Kodjo vit actuellement à Kpéssou où il est né en 1958. Très tôt, il abandonne ses études et entre en apprentissage. Aujourd’hui devenu maître menuisier, il est bien apprécié par les consommateurs de ses produits artisanaux, par leur finesse.

Monsieur K. Kodjo a reçu aujourd’hui beaucoup de commandes qu’il compte satisfaire. Pour cela, il sollicite ce crédit de $600 pour s’acheter du bois afin de produire ses meubles et satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle. Les revenus issus de la vente lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use:
Purchase of planks for carpentry business

Achat de planches

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in clothes for the warm weather season

loans.name: Luzinga East G Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Peninah R.. She is currently in the business of goat rearing and is requesting a loan to expand business. Peninah is 36 years old and is married. She has 7 children ranging from age 2 to 9 and her children go to school. Each week, Peninah makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to boost business. Peninah has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Peninah is joined in her small group by Dorothy M. and Daniella Nakisuyi. Dorothy M. has a business running a drug shop and wants to purchase more drugs to sell. Daniella Nakisuyi is currently operating a business selling sugar wax and wants a loan to add to the business.

loans.use: To buy more goats and expand business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Surtir su local con mas productos y ademas mejorar su comedor

loans.name: Simoambar 1 Group

texts.es:
Gloria is a craftswoman who makes bracelets, necklaces and earrings using amber. Her community, Simojovel, is characterized by extracting amber from its mines. Most community members work with this material and base their economy on it. With the loan, she intends to buy more amber in order to shape different accessories for men, women and children. She is separated from her husband and needs to invest in the business, in order to obtain profits to support her four children. Gloria is 31 years old and a member of the solidary group called Simoambar 1, along with her partners, devoted to the same activity, Cristina A. Hernández y Berthi Sánchez Hernández.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria es artesana y hace pulseras, collares y aretes con material de ámbar. Su comunidad, Simojovel, se caracteriza por extraer de sus minas el ámbar. La mayor parte de su comunidad trabaja este material y su economía lo obtiene de este mismo. Con su préstamo pretende comprar más ambar para darle forma en distintos accesorios para hombres, mujeres y niños. Ya que es separada de su esposo, necesita invertir en el negocio para obtener ganancias y asi sostener a sus cuatro hijos. Gloria tiene 31 años y forma parte del grupo solidario llamado Simoambar 1, junto con sus compañeras, que desempeñan la misma actividad, Cristina A. Hernández y Berthi Sánchez Hernández.

loans.use: invest in the purchase of amber.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ms. Ama A. is 38, married and the mother of 2 children. She lives in Lavie, a small village about 130 away from Lome, the capital city of Togo. With this first loan with FECECAV, she is hoping to purchase palm nuts in bulk so that she can produce red-oil, a popular local product. The profits she will make will help her to support her children and to improve their quality of life.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Ms. Ama A. est âgée de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle réside à Lavie, un petit village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Avec ce première crédit de FECECAV, elle espère acheter en gros les noix de palmes pour fabriquer et vendre l'huile rouge, un produit populaire. Les profits qui se dégageront de son activité lui permettront de supporter les besoins de ses enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts

loans.name: Together We Tinap Group

texts.en: Abdul K. started his business three years go with small "loans at a time" from SMT.  He is honest and paid his installments diligently.  Abdul K. is very grateful to the loan program.  He sells plastic sandals.  Abdul K.'s business expanded and he can provide 3 meals a day to his family.  Abdul K. is the group leader. He is thirty-one years old and married with 2 children.  Other group members are engaged in various business activities.  The group is requesting a loan of Le.5000000 to further expand their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase plastic sandals, increase food market, and increase invetory in the general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair products to keep operating a small salon.

loans.name: Johana Francisca

texts.es:
Señora Johana L. is native of the municipality El Viejo of the city of Chinandega and is very vigorously dedicated to the business of the making and sale of tortillas which she markets from her own house of habitation in the municipality.

It is important to emphasize that from very early in the morning she creates her tortillas to offer to clients. Today, due to the fact that she has a small son of school age that she must maintain, she has requested a loan from Ceprodel to obtain the commodities for the making of the tortillas and in this way to continue offering the necessary conditions for study to her small son.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Johana L. es originaria del municipio El Viejo de la ciudad de Chinandega y se dedica muy esforzadamente al negocio de elaboracion y venta de tortillas las cuales las comercializa en su propia casa de habitacion en el municipio.

Es importante destacar que desde muy temprano por la mañana ella elabora sus tortillas para ofrecerla a los clientes. Hoy en dia debido a que tiene un pequeño hijo en edad escolar que mantener, ha solicitado un credito en Ceprodel para obtener su materia prima para la elaboracion de las tortillas y asi continuar brindandole las condiciones de estudio necesarias a su pequeño.

loans.use: To buy corn and firewood for the making of tortillas.

loans.name: Mgeni

texts.en:
Mgeni is 47 and divorced with 2 children, aged 20 and 18. She has been a poultry keeper since 2005. Every day, she works from 8AM to 8PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Mgeni is now looking for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Shazia's Group

texts.en:
Shazia baji is the wife of L. M. and lives in a small town named Bund Road of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been living in this town for the last 11 years. She is the mother of two daughters who are both in kindergarten. Shazia baji's husband has a scrap business. He has been in this business for the last 20 years. Shazia baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work and take care of her family. She successfully repaid her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy more scrap (plastic bottles, iron and waste papers) for her husband's scrap business.

Shazia is joined in her group loan by a few more members. Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy more scrap (plastic, iron) for her scrap business. Sabra baji and Shama baji each want a loan to buy clothes to resell. Chanda baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics to resell. Nusrat baji wants a loan to buy spices to refill in small bags and packets and to sell in markets and shops.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Shazia would like to buy scrap for her scrap business and the other women in the group would like to support their businesses.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery tiene 30 años de edad, está separada, es madre de un niño de 02 añitos, estudió en el Instituto Superior Tecnológico de Juli y vive en el Jr. Yunguyo s/n, distrito de Juli, provincia de Chuchito, departamento de Puno.

Ella es socia del Banco Comunal “Niño San Salvador” de Juli. Con el préstamo de S/. 300 compró una bayeta y lana para confeccionar bordados. Desde muy joven aprendió a bordar, ello le sirvió para sacar adelante a sus hijos y para vender sus bordados en la ciudad de Puno. Al mismo tiempo vende papa en el Mercado de abastos de Juli.

Con este préstamo de S/.500, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará  40 metros de bayeta a S/. 152 y lana a S/ 52.50.

Su deseo es que su negocio crezca y ser independiente.
texts.en:
Mery is 30 years old, is separated, is the mother of a 2 year old child, studied at the Superior Institute of Juli and lives at Jr. Yunguyo (no house number), Juli district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is a member of the "Niño San Salvador” Communal Bank of Juli. With the loan of S/. 300 she bought fabric and wool to make embroideries. From a young age she learned how to embroider, which allowed her to support her children and sell her embroideries in the city of Puno. At the same time she sells potatoes in Juli's food market. With this loan of S/.500, which will be paid back in 4 installments, she will buy 40 meters of fabric at S/. 152 and wool at S/ 52.50. Her wish is for her business to grow and to be independent.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy 40 meters of fabric at S/.152 and wool at S/.52.5

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una mujer D. 54 años, es separada D. su pareja vive con su hija y sus nietos. Se dedica a la agricultura, actividad en la que se inició desD. que se separo D. su esposo, hace 20 años. María relata que le agrada la agricultura y que junto a su nuera cultivan naranjas, siendo dentro del todo el proceso, la cosecha lo que le agrada realizar, porque todos cooperan para sacar los mejores  frutos D.  su trabajo. Dentro D. lo difícil, para ella, es el sembrado, ya que a su edad no pueD.  realizar trabajos muy forzados y requiere ayuda para ello. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Maria invertirá la cantidad que solicita en la compra D. abonos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 54 year old woman who is divorced and lives with her daughter and grandchildren. She makes a living through farming, which she has been doing since she separated from her husband 20 years ago. Maria says that she enjoys farming and works together with her daughter in law to grow oranges. Throughout the entire process, the harvest is the most enjoyable part because everyone works together to pick the best fruits from their work. The most difficult part for her is planting the seeds because at her age, she cannot carry out straining tasks and needs help to do them. This is her first loan with MFP. Maria will invest the money in the purchase of fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for farming

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. YU. U. lives in Choeung Vat village in Kampong Cham province. She is a grocer who owns a small store in the local village. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand; thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

She hopes to increase income and provide a better life for her children. She is a 69-year-old widow with four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more grocery goods for her inventory.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn Q., 41 years of age, resides at Bernad Subdivision, Aguada, Ozamis City. She is married to a utility worker, working for one of the leading telecommunication companies and she has 2 children studying at Ozamis City School of Arts, 2nd year and 3rd year students respectively.

Hypo-retailing is her business; she sells to her neighbors, to office workers, and to housewives. Hypo is used for bleaching purposes. She is also engaged in retailing kerosene, vegetables, and fruits. But she is more likely earning her living with the Hypo retail business.

In connection with this, Jocelyn needs the amount of PHP 10,000, to expand her Hypo retail business, as it is in demand, and if ever she would gain more income from it, she could finance the other side of her business which is vegetables, kerosene, and fruit retailing.

She wishes also to send her children to the best schools to insure their future lives.

loans.use: additional capital for expanding her Hypo bleach retail business

loans.name: Achiro

texts.en:
Achiro M., 40, sells bedsheets at the market. Her husband is a mechanic. They have three children who all go to school. Achiro is requesting a loan to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services that are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Rahmat Ghulam Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Rahmat baji is the wife of G. M. and has been a resident in the city of Vehari, Pakistan for the past 11 years. People have been coming to her husband to buy clothes for six years.

Rahmat baji is a very hardworking lady. She gets up early and prepares breakfast for  her two sons and her daughter then gets them ready for school. After that she cleans the whole house and then starts sewing clothes. She sews clothes to pay off the school fees of her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy clothing to expand her husband’s clothing selling business. 

She is the group leader of several other women in her locality. Mafia baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Saeeda baji wants a loan to buy clothing to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Vatan

texts.ru: Рахимов Ватан проживает в районе Файзобод. Возраст 45 лет, женат и имеет семерых детей. Имеет большую ферму , где разводит бычков. Обратился к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы обеспечить животных комбикормом. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Vatan R. lives in the Fayzabad area. He is 45 years old, is married and has seven children. Vatan has a large farm where he raises cattle. He turned to us for a loan in order to provide the animals with feed.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase feed

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie A. is a 24-year-old mother of three children ages 9, 5, and 2 and a half. The older two are in school and she supports them herself, as her husband does not work. She sells vegetables and lives in the Nymasaria slum. She says during the dry season, her tomatoes will sell for about 20 bob a bunch (around USD 0.50) while during the rainy season, which we are now entering, a bunch will sell for only 5 or 10 bob. She buys the tomatoes at a garden near Lake Victoria and says she will use the 10,000 KSH she is asking for school fees and to purchase more stock.

Winnie recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin-enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: inventory and school fees

loans.name: Ludio

texts.es:
Ludio tiene 34 años de edad y vive en pareja con Agustina de 28 años de edad. Hace 4 años que comparten el mismo hogar y tienen un hijo de 5 años de edad.

Ludio es técnico en refrigeración, aprendió la profesión de un hermano que también se dedica a lo mismo, hasta que logró independizarse y montar su propio taller.

Ludio repara todo tipo de electrodomésticos como: heladeras, acondicionadores de aire, congeladoras, etc. Hoy día su taller propio funciona en su domicilio y su compañera, que es ama de casa, le acompaña día a día colaborando con los trabajos del hogar.

Comenta que tiene buena clientela bien formada y gracias a las ganancias obtenidas pudo hacerse de casa propia  y a la vez comprar todos los muebles y electrodomésticos necesarios para amoblarla.

En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para construcción debido a que está ampliando su vivienda y necesita de dinero para invertirlo en dicha construcción.  Ludio quiere ampliar su propio taller en su casa.
texts.en:
Ludio is 34 years old and lives with his partner Agustina, who is 28. They have lived together for four years and have a 5-year-old son.

Ludio is a refrigeration technician. He learned this skill from his brother, who is in the same business. Ludio worked with his brother until he was able to start his own shop.

Ludio repairs all types of home appliances, such as freezers, air conditioners, and refrigerators. Today, he has a shop in his own home, and his partner, who is a homemaker, helps him out with household chores every day.

Ludio has a solid client base and thanks to his earnings has been able to purchase his own home and furnish it with all the necessary furniture and appliances.

He would like to build an addition to his house, and so he is requesting a loan to invest in its construction. Ludio wants to increase the size of his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make an addition to his home shop

loans.name: Abdugafor

texts.ru: Абдугафор кредитор в Микроинвест шестой год.Пользуется кредитами для расширения своего основного бизнеса, продажей канцелярских товаров.Следующий кредит он хочет использовать для завоза партии пишущих ручек , фломастеров, карандашей и.т.п.Его устраивают условия Фонда и он с благодарностью продолжает кредитоваться.На снимке Абдугафор в день выдачи.
texts.en:
This is the sixth year that Abdugafor is a MicroInvest borrower. He uses the credit to grow his main business, school supply sales. He would like to use his next loan to purchase writing pens, markers, pencils, etc. He is happy with the Fund terms and he gratefully continues to borrow. In the photo is Abdugafor on the day that he received his loan.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of books and school supplies

loans.name: Patricia   M.

texts.en:
Patricia  M. S. is from the village of Pob 4 Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Patricia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Patricia owns & operates a "sari-sari" or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products in the local community. Patricia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Patricia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Patricia is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Patricia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Kamol

texts.en: J. Kamol has a minivan with which he provides transportation services. Having attended to this business for eleven years, he has gained much experience. Initially he rented a car but, after making certain savings over time, he bought his own minivan. The business is stable and generates the main, considerable income for Kamol’s family allowing improvement in their living conditions. Currently Kamol’s minivan needs some repairs. That’s why he needs a loan of 8,000 Somoni to purchase the spare parts. Kamol thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to repay the loan with accuracy. The well-being of this family is in your hands. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his minivan

loans.name: Haidar

texts.en:
M. Haidar is 34 years old. He is married and has 6 children. Haidar sells women's shawls in the central market of Shahrituz. His wife, who appears in the photograph, helps him with the business. For 10 years, he managed to serve his clientele. Thus, Haidar‘s business is his main source of income, allowing him to improve his living conditions and provide his children with education. He requests $600 USD to buy new women's shawls in order to increase the range of goods that he sells. Haidar would like to thank everyone for support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy new women's shawls

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en: Idowu is 42 years old and a widow with four children. She sells gift items and rechargeable phone cards. She is requesting a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more gift items and rechargeable phone cards.  She thanks all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase gift items and rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Mrs. Long Hong Un Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty-five people living in Pou Roung village in the Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Long H. U. is a 50-year-old village bank president. She is a farmer, and owns land to cultivate rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Kiev MoeU., is a policeman. The couple has three children, one of whom is a laborer, another is a grocer, and the third is attending the local school. Mrs. Long H. U. is applying for a loan to buy more grocery products to expand her second child’s business.

Fifteen members in this group have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term (EoT) loans do not require principal payments until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. This type of loan allows the members to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start making payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy grocery products to expand her second child’s business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Trigales.
Maria es casada, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos, vive en la comunidad D. La Vega, en donD. tiene un restaurante y también venD. abarrotes en general, bebidas, los fines D. semana venD. comida típica.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Maria sueña con tener un recreo campestre y tener una granja D. crianza D. cuy y gallina.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Communal Bank “Trigales” (Wheat Fields). She is 56 years old, married, and has 4 children. She lives in the community of La Vega, where she operates a restaurant. She also sells groceries and beverages. On the weekends, she sells traditional food.

Maria needs a loan of 900 soles in order to buy rice and sugar. She dreams of having a vacation in the country and owning a farm where she can breed guinea pigs and chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice & sugar

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 42-year-old married man and father of 3 children. He is the only provider in his family; that's why he works hard to earn enough income to satisfy their needs. He has been working as a blacksmith since 2000. Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase iron for his business.

loans.use: To purchase iron

loans.name: Delma

texts.es:
Delma es una mujer muy trabajadora de 47 años, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia. Durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a la siembra de papa y maíz, y a la crianza de animales. Actualmente, ésta sigue siendo la forma como Delma busca el bienestar de su familia; cada día sale a pastear a su ganado (vacuno) y de sus vacas obtiene la leche que vende diariamente. Cuando llega el tiempo de la cosecha vende los productos que produce en sus chacras, y otras veces vende sus animales. El deseo a futuro de Delma es de incrementar su producción agrícola para poder convertirse en una exitosa agricultora y comerciante de sus productos.
Esta es la oportunidad número 14 en que tiene un préstamo con MFP y renueva su compromiso de ser puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertido en la compra de abono para su próxima campaña de siembra.
texts.en:
Delma is a very hard working woman of 47 years of age. She lives with her children in her own house. For her whole life she has worked growing potatoes and corn, and raising animals. This is currently still the way in which Delma seeks her family's well-being; every day she takes her cattle to the fields and obtains the milk she sells daily from her cows. When it is time to harvest, she sells the products she produces in her farm, and other times she sells her animals. Delma's wish for the future is to increase her farm's production to become a successful farmer and seller of her products. This is the 14th opportunity in which she has had a loan with MFP and she renews her commitment to being punctual with her payments. The money she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizer for the coming sowing season.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fertilizer.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. is from the village of Magsaysay, Sibutad, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 49 years old. Leonida is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leonida joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Leonida from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the borrower's children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to one son who is currently in school. She lives with her husband and child in a rented apartment in Kade. Kade is a farming/commercial town in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Lucy is a baker. She bakes bread for sale. She hawks her bread and also supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. Lucy has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other baking ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour. etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more materials and supplies to make clothing for sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing-dominated community called Takoradi in the Western Region of Ghana.

Veronica works hard to support her husband to be able to provide for the family. She trades in cereals such as beans, maize, groundnut (peanuts), etc. Veronica supplies to retailers and food vendors in her community and treks to nearby communities to sell as well. Veronica has been in business for eight years. She wants to use the loan to procure goods in bulk to serve her customers especially during this Christmas.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk.

loans.name: Leonidas Del Carmen

texts.es: El señor Leonidas tiene 47 años de edad, hombre muy esforzado y trabajador, casado, con tres hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios, dueño de taxi el cual trabajaba y ahorraba, lo que lo llevo a comprar otro taxi y con financiamiento un camión, lleva siete años trabajando en su negocio el cual se siente contento por todos sus logros el cual podrá dar a su familia una mejor condición de vida. Es su décimo crédito el cual invertirá en la compra de llantas para su camión. Ya que es una necesidad por que están muy gastada las llantas para evitar cualquier incidente. Los dos taxis que tiene paga a cadetes para que le trabajen pero en un futuro quiere cambiar las unidades para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes da las gracias a la institución por hacer posible crecer su negocio el cual es de mucho beneficio para poder sastifacer las necesidades cotidiana a si como poder dar los estudios a sus hijos para que logren una mejor estabilidad en sus vidas.
texts.en:
Leonidas is 47 years old and is a hard-working man. He is married with three children who are currently in school. He worked driving a taxi which he owned, and saved money. This allowed him to buy another taxi and, with financing, a truck. He has been working at his business for seven years and is happy that with his success he can provide a better life for his family. This is his tenth loan, which he will invest in a set of tires for his truck. This is much needed because the current tires are too worn to avoid problems. He pays two drivers to work for him driving his taxis but in the future he wants to change vehicles in order to provide better service to his customers. He thanks the lending institution for making it possible for his business to grow. This is very helpful for covering everyday expenses, such as being able to send his children to school so that they will have more stability in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new tires for his truck in order to provide better service and protect his safety

loans.name: Son

texts.en: C. is 35 years old and resides in the province of Kampong Chhnang where she built a medium pigpen next to her house. In her stall, she feeds many pigs either to produce babies or to sell to the slaughterer. Her husband is a civil servant officer for an industry. C. has a child who is a student and lives with her in the family home. C. will be using her first loan to purchase a motorcycle to use as transportation. She intends to use the remaining money from the loan to add to her capital for her pig breeding enterprise. C. was not available for a photo so her husband is shown instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Radjabali

texts.ru: Одинамадов Раджабали проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 69 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Одинамадов Раджабали растениеводством занимается более 15 лет. В своем саду сажает деревья. Кредит берет для посева урожая.
texts.en:
Radjabali O. lives in the Hamadoni district. He is 69 years old, married and has 3 children. Radjabali has been involved in horticulture for over 15 years. He plants trees in his garden. He is requesting this loan for the new planting.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New planting

loans.name: La Ñusta Iii Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal ÑUSTA III está formado por 10 socios que son trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven en la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, urbe que se caracteriza por sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería. 

Los socios se dedican a la venta de verduras, venta de comestibles, venta de flores, venta de frutas y otros socios brindan servicios de construcción de casas y llamadas a celulares móviles de manera ambulante. 

Marisol tiene dos hijos y se dedica a la venta de flores en el mercado modelo de Calca, la socia esta preocupada porque en el mes de enero las lluvias constates hizo que el rió del vilcanota aumentara su caudal entonces derrumbo su casa y el rió arraso con todos sus pertenencias sin poder recuperar sus pertenencias dejando su casa en escombros, Marisol requiere el préstamo para la alimentación de sus hijos y para la matricula del colegio de sus hijos y seguirá sacando adelante a su familia a pesar de las adversidad del clima. 
 
Los otros socios están preocupados por que las ventas han disminuido debido a que los compradores que trabajaban directamente con el turismo dejaron de comprar.
