Las fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco hicieron que turistas cancelaron sus reservaciones de viaja a la ciudad del Cusco.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "ÑUSTA III" is made up of 10 members who are hardworking and who are always looked for opportunities to get ahead. With their daily efforts they provide a better future for their children. The members live in the Calca province of the Cusco department, an area known for its beautiful countryside, its agriculture and its livestock activities. The members sell vegetables, food, flowers, fruit and some of the other members provide services including the construction of homes and cellular phone services sold on the street. Marisol has 2 children and she sells flowers in the Modelo Market in Calca. She is very worried because in the month of January the constant rain increased the flow of the Vilcanota river, flooding her house. All of her belongings washed away before she could retrieve them and her house was left in ruins. Marisol needs a loan to feed her children and to pay for the schooling of her children so that she can continue to advance her family in spite of the adversities of the weather. The other members are concerned because sales have diminished because the buyers who work directly in the area of tourism are no longer buying. The strong rains that fell for 3 days in the city of Cusco caused the tourists to cancel their reservations to travel to the city of Cusco. The members as a group are grateful for the opportunity provided with this loan, and each member is committed to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Marisol needs a loan to feed her children and to pay for their education

loans.name: Ramona Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ramona se dedica a la venta de verduras en su tramo que esta ubicado en el mercado central, realiza sus compras de contado al por mayor.
  
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de plátanos, yuca, banano, naranja, remolacha, tomate, cebolla, apio, zanahoria y otros.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Ramona es madre soltera de dos niños lo cuales actualmente van a la escuela para tener un mejor futuro, el cual es el sueño de su mamá.
texts.en:
Ramona sells vegetables in her stand located in the central market; she buys wholesale and pays cash. This loan will be used to buy bananas, yucca, oranges, plantain, beets, tomatoes, onion, celery, carrots, etc. It is worth mentioning that Ramona is a single mother of two children, who are currently going to school to have a better future; this is their mother's dream.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yucca, banana, plantain, oranges, beets, and pickling spices.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina  vive, en la zona San Roque, ubicada en una zona peri urbana de la ciudad de El Alto.

Es casada vive en su casa propia, junto a su padre y su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil en diferentes lugares de la ciudad.

Trabaja  en la venta de pan, que ella misma elabora en su pequeño horno artesanal, el cual se encuentra ubicado  en su domicilio. 


El crédito lo destinará a la adquisición de materiales de construcción(ladrillo refractario, cemento, etc.) para realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su horno ya que por esta época de lluvias hubo un deterioro en la parte de paredes y techo. 
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Justina lives in the San Roque neighborhood which is located in suburbs of the city of El Alto. She is married and lives in her own home together with her father and her husband. Her husband is a construction worker who works all over the city. Justina sells bread that she makes in a small artisanal oven located in her home. The loan is destined for the acquisition of construction materials (bricks, heat-resistant materials, cement, etc.) to make improvements to the infrastructure of the oven since it’s the rainy season and there has been deterioration in the walls and roof. This is her second loan with Impro; our evaluation has qualified her for another loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy heat-resistant bricks, cement, and other materials to repair the oven she uses to bake bread.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos Castellón OC.   es un señor de 36 años de edad el cual vive con su esposa y su hijo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace ya varios años Don Carlos  se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece,  en especial  La leche. Don  Carlos considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, el podrá construir su propia casa ya que aun vive en la de sus padres con su hija y esposa.

En estos momentos don Carlos desea obtener un microcrédito  por  ¢665000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco  mil colones), para comprar semilla de pasto  y mejorar las condiciones del corral donde tiene sus  vacas. Esto le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y generar los ingresos necesarios para construir su propia casa. 

Don Carlos es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer   préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. Asegura que este crédito ha sido una gran motivación y trabajara fuertemente para seguir teniendo acceso a ellos y convertirse en un microempresario exitoso.
texts.en:
Carlos Castellón OC. is a 36 years old gentleman who lives with his wife and child in a community called Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles, Alajuela Province. The community is situated in a mountainous area near the northern border of the country. The main economic activities are ranching and farming, with specific emphasis on the cultivation of grains, sugar cane, and oranges. Don Carlos has been raising cattle for several years. He sells to the neighbors in his community who are very satisfied with quality of his products, especially the milk. Don Carlos is grateful for the progress of his business, which will allow him to build his own home. He is still living at his parents’ house with his wife and daughter. At the moment, Don Carlos wants to obtain a microloan in the amount of 665,000 CRC so that he can buy grass seeds and maintain the corral where he keeps his cows. This will help him improve his business and generate the income he needs to build his own house. Don Carlos is a member of Manantial de Santa Fe Communal Credit Enterprise, one of 100 member organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and he hopes to grow personally and financially. He assures us that this loan provides great motivation for him to work hard so that he can access future loans and become a successful micro-entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grass seeds & pay for maintenance of a corral

loans.name: G.s. Pablo Ii Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Pablo II lo conforman Gregoria y Petrona, por lo que tienen mucho tiempo de trabajar con Fundación, pues los financiamientos han sido su mayor apoyo. Gregoria se dedica a la elaboración de repostería hace mas de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio, ha tenido ciertos beneficios porque ha logrado proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y su compañera Petrona se dedica a la elaboración de bordados para toallas, manteles y sabanas pues juntas han buscado la forma de salir adelante. Es así que solicitan un financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y así comprar utensilios y materia prima para la elaboración de repostería.  Sueñan con mantener activos sus negocios durante mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Gregoria and Petrona make up the Pablo II Communal Bank. They have worked with Fundación for a long time. The loans have been their biggest help. Gregoria has been in the business of making pastries for over 17 years. It has had certain benefits because she was able to make improvements on her house. Her colleague, Petrona, embroiders towels, tablecloths, and sheets. Together they have looked for the way to get ahead. That is why they are asking for a loan for working capital. They will buy utensils and raw materials for making pastries. They dream of keeping their businesses active for a long time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Lucia Magdalena

texts.es:
Al igual que las otras socias  Lucia L. es  otra integrante del banco Comunal  Feria Libre,  vive en una casa prestada por su tía   con su esposo  que trabaja como chofer de transporte urbano y sus dos hijos de 6 y 3 años, el mayor estudia en una escuela de la localidad,  este banco esta situado en la parroquia Ricaurte  ubicada al noreste del cantón Cuenca. Limita al norte con  la parroquia Sidcay,  al este la parroquia Llacao, al sur y al oeste la ciudad de Cuenca.  Entre sus principales atractivos turísticos encontramos  un hermoso mirador en  el barrio la Dolorosa junto a la planta de agua potable, en la iglesia de la localidad encontramos imágenes de santos, cuadros y reliquias muy antiguas, su rica gastronomía atraen a los visitantes

Lucia pinta  en cerámica aprendió a realizar estas manualidades en un curso especial, recién encontró trabajo y su labor es pegar juguetes y pintarlos. También nos comenta que  se encuentra en su sexto ciclo dentro de su banco comunal invitada por su suegra, los créditos recibidos  le han beneficiado en su negocio y por ahora con el  préstamo  que recibirá va a invertir en la compra de  cerámica, pintura, pinceles  etc.  para la elaboración de sus artesanías.

Tiene como meta seguir un a curso de belleza para ser una gran estilista y montar su propio gabinete.
texts.en:
Like the other members of her group, Lucia L. is part of the Communal Bank “Feria Libre” (Open Market). She lives in a house provided by her aunt. Her husband works as a city bus driver and they have two children, ages 6 and 3. The oldest child is enrolled at the local school. This Communal Bank is located in Ricuarte Parish, which is in the canton northeast of Cuenca. Ricuarte Parish is bordered to the north by Sidcay Parish, to the east by Llacao Parish, and to the south and west by the city of Cuenca. Among the main tourist attractions are the beautiful lookout of the neighborhood of La Dolorosa next to the drinking water plant and the local church with its images of the saints and ancient paintings and relics. The rich food culture attracts many visitors.

Lucia took a special course in which she learned to make painted ceramics. She recently found work assembling and painting toys. In addition, she says that she is starting her sixth loan cycle and was invited to join the Communal Bank by her mother-in-law. The loans she received have benefited her business and will use her current loan to buy ceramics, paint, brushes, and other supplies for making crafts.

Lucia’s goal is to continue with her beauty courses so that she can become a great stylist and open her own salon.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ceramics, paint, brushes, and other supplies for making crafts

loans.name: Kamaamia

texts.en:
Kamaamia N. is 26 years old and married to Kanasa N.. He is a farmer who farms his own piece of land which he has done for the last four years.
  
He learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his second loan. He is planning to plant twenty acres of wheat which does very well in this area. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to rent more land to increase his wheat production. His future dream is to buy a bigger piece of land so he can plant more wheat for commercial purposes. His hope and dream is to become a large-scale wheat farmer.

loans.use: to plant more acres of wheat

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Badenya est un regroupement de cinq femmes de la ville de San qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles sont toutes mariées. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans et une moyenne de 3  enfants. 
Elles mènent différentes activités commerciales: vente de produits divers, des condiments alimentaires, de beignet, de la restauration etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidés d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe).
Les femmes du groupe Badenya  achètent leurs marchandises à San et à Yangasso.  Elles effectuent leurs ventes au marché de Yangasso  et dans les villages environnants de la ville de Yangasso.
 Tedi G. est le membre du groupe qui fait de la restauration et c’est elle qui sert le maximum  de passagers et routiers de Yangasso.
Elle compte  acheter, 200 kg de riz, 1 seau de pâte d’arachide,  un panier de tomate, 10 litres d’huile, 2 paquets de maggi, 2kg de sel, 30 kg d’oignons et des légumes. Elle prépare dans sa gargote tous les plats alimentaires du Mali. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 22 000 FCFA par mois tandis que les autres membres compte sur un profit mensuel de 19500 FCFA.  
Elles utiliseront leur revenu dans les dépenses de leur famille et dans les affaires.
texts.en:
This Badenya group brings together five women from the town of San who met through being related and/or neighbors. They are all married, and their average age is 28 with each having 3 children on average. They have various commercial activities: sale of different items, condiments, fritters, and cooked food. To grow their businesses, the members decided to join the loan group of Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan (group loan). The women of the Badenya group buy their merchandise in San and Yangasso. They make their sales at the market of Yangasso and in the surrounding villages. Tedi G. is the group member who sells cooked food and it is she who serves a maximum of passengers and long-distance drivers from Yangasso. She intends to buy 200 kg of rice, one bucket of peanut butter, a basket of tomatoes, 10 liters of oil, 2 packets of Maggi cubes, 2 kg of salt, 30 kg of onions, and some vegetables. At her little snack bar, she prepares all the traditional dishes of Mali. She expects to make a profit of 22,000 F CFA per month, whereas the other members expect to make a profit of 19,500 F CFA. They will use their income for family expenses and their businesses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for preparing cooked food

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina L. is from the village of Eastern, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 49 years old. Carolina is married and has 11 school-aged children, 6 of whom are still in school. To make a living, Carolina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Carolina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Carolina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Carolina is requesting a new loan of 21,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Carolina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Doña Rosa, tiene 54 años, está casada con Teodorico D. 57 años, ambos tiene 10 hijos, pero sólo viven con 3 D. ellos, en su casa propia. Junto a su amado padre, trabaja desD. hace 30 años, en el cultivo D. piña, café, plátanos y palta, asimismo venD. estos productos y otras frutas oriundas D. la selva al por mayor, D. esa manera dinamiza lo que cosecha, yendo a los mercados D. Lima y Huancayo. Lo que más le gusta es desarrollar ambas actividades, pues se considera una mujer con mucho coraje, además que le es rentable, permitiéndole comprar varias hectáreas más D. terreno, para que pueda construir su casa y brindarles una adecuada calidad D. vida a sus hijos. Por el momento continuará trabajando en esta actividad, con el fin D. incrementar la venta D. frutas, hasta que su establecimiento sea una distribuidora D. productos D. la selva. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, le gusta trabajar en su grupo comunal, pues está integrado por personas bastante responsables y puntuales que son un ejemplo a seguir. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos D. abono orgánico, además D. herramientas agrícolas como machete, lampas, pico, canastas y lija.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old, married to 57 year old Teodorico, and they have 10 children but only live with three of them. They live in their own house. Along with her beloved father, she has been working for 30 years growing pineapple, coffee, bananas, and avocados and sells this produce and other jungle fruits in bulk, and in this way speeds up the harvest and sends it to the markets of Lima and Huancayo. What she most likes is to develop both activities, as she is considered to be a woman of much courage. As these activities are profitable, they have enabled her to buy more land to build a house and offer a decent standard of living to her children. For the time being, she will continue with this work with the goal of increasing the sale of fruits until she can really become a distributor of jungle products. This is her second loan from MFP. She likes working with the savings group because the members are so responsible and punctual that they are an example to follow. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy sacks of organic fertilizer and agricultural tools such as machetes, hoes, picks, baskets, and sandpaper.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizer and agricultural tools.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice, cooking oil, sugar, flour and pepper to sell to her customers

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa C. is from Barangay La Torre North, Bayombong. She is 37 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Marissa owns and operates a business providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month. In 2010, Marissa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide her services. This loan will be her first from ASKI. Marissa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide her manicure and pedicure services

loans.name: Esperance

texts.fr:
Célibataire de 46ans, mère de 2enfants dont l’âge varie entre 21ans et 10ans, avec son niveau d’étude secondaire, elle a une passion pour la coiffure et elle décide un jour, encouragée par ses copines qu’elle aimait faire les tresses, elle  ouvre un salon en pleine air dans la cour de la parcelle familiale en 2007 avec 3000f comme fond de démarrage.
Depuis 2009, elle gère un salon de coiffure  avec vente des produits  cométiques et capillaires.
Les tresses et les coiffures journalières lui rapportent 7000f et 15000f selon les jours (weekend, fêtes …). 
Avec le prêt,  elle va acheter 5 bidons de5 litres de shampooing,  bidons de 5litres de démêlants, 2gros pots de défrisants, 1gros pots de gèle coiffant, 5paquets de pinces, 5paquets de filets, 1 lots des peignes tiges, 20 paquets des différents mèches.
Elle voudra ouvrir un salon plus moderne ou elle veut utilisée les filles mères et faire plus de bénéfices afin de soutenir ses filles à faire des grandes études.
Sa famille  la soutien et l’encourage à aller de l’avant.
texts.en:
This entrepreneur is a single woman, 46 years old, with two children (21 and 10 years old). She has finished secondary studies. She has a passion for the hairdressing trade. One day in 2007, encouraged by her friends whose hair she enjoyed braiding, she opened her salon under the open sky, in the courtyard of her family residence, with 3000 as a starting capital. Since 2009, she has been managing a hairdresser salon and selling beauty and hair care products. Braiding and hair styling brings her an income between 7,000 and 15,000 per day (depending on whether it’s the weekend, holiday etc). With this loan, she is going to purchase five 5-liter cans of shampoo, as well as some 5-liter cans of hair straightener , two big jars of anti-frizz hair treatment, one big jar of hair gel, five packs of hair pins, one lot of combs, 20 packs of various hair extensions. She would like to open a more up-to-date salon where she would employ young single mothers and be able to achieve a higher revenue in order to provide for higher-level studies of her daughters. Her family supports her and encourages her to advance.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cans of hair straightener, shampoo; hair extensions, anti-frizz, hair gel, combs, hair pins etc.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia  D. lives in Prk. Mohon, Brgy. Kawit, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a General Store business. Her common law husband Romeo, who is 49 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. Alicia  joined NWTF- Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF- Project Dungganon, Alicia  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to buy stocks for her general store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her store. Alicia D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital for General Store

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María Elena tiene mucho tiempo de trabajar con fundación, pues los financiamientos han sido de gran ayuda. Ella se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella inicio este negocio por la necesidad de adquirir un medio de ingreso para su hogar, ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy trabajadora y que además disfruta de interactuar con sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima como sabanas, toallas, cosméticos y calzado.
texts.en:
María Elena has worked with Fundación Leon 2000 for a long time and the loans have been a great help to her. She earns her living by selling general merchandise. María Elena started her business out of necessity because she needed a means of generating income for her household. She has demonstrated that she is hardworking person who enjoys interacting with her customers.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase merchandise such as bedding, towels, cosmetics, and shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bedding, towels, cosmetics, and shoes

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert S. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. He is 33 years old. Gilbert is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Gilbert owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Gilbert has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gilbert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gilbert is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gilbert from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mrs. Ros S. and her husband, Mr. Chantha Meach, both 52 years old, have been married since 1979 and have seven children: two sons and five daughters. Three of them are married and live outside the family home; one is a teacher; two attend school and another one assists her mother in the business. The family lives in a small village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Ros and her husband, who sell rice and food at their home, now want to expand their business, so Ros is requesting a loan of US$600. She will use part of the loan to replace the motorbike her children drive to school because it is old and prone to mechanical problems.

loans.use: To expand her business and replace the motorbike her children use to drive to school.

loans.name: Santuke

texts.en: Santuke K. is currently in the business of selling sugar, cooking oil, fish, etc. and is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of goods to sell. Santuke is 35 years old and married to a community leader. She has 2 children who do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of goods to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita es socia del Banco Comunal “Brisas de Rio Blanco” ubicado en el distrito de Pilcuyo, provincia El Collao, departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil casada y con un hijo, tiene grado de instrucción de secundaria completa.
La señora  viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace cinco años, el primer préstamo recibido fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual le permito comprar más productos en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.
Ella solicitara un nuevo préstamo de S/ 2000.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le permitirá incrementar el capital de su negocio.
Su sueño es  progresar en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the “Brisas de Rio Blanco” community bank which is located in Pilcuyo district, El Collao province, Puno department.  She is 38 years old, married, and has one child.  She completed her secondary education.

Margarita has been working for Movimiento Manuela Ramos for five years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles which allowed her to buy more products for her business selling groceries.

She is requesting a new loan for 2,000 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her business capital.

Her dream is to make progress in her business.  What she most likes about her community bank is the punctuality.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Tolibjon

texts.en:
N. Tolibjon is a very responsible and optimistic person. He has three children and a wife to support, so he wants to develop his business. This business consists of cattle-raising in his village because there is a very high demand for milk from villagers, and especially from customers who come from nearby towns. Tolibjon is helped by his children. He is currently faced with many problems because his children are growing and their expenses are growing accordingly. The only way to get out of this difficulty is to succeed in business, so we hope that his capabilities along with services provided by IMON International will help him improve his business.                                   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle for developing his business

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie E. is from the village of Maquilao, in Tangub City. She is 30 years old. Jovie is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jovie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jovie has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jovie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. Jovie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jovie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings & young crops

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old single man living with his parents and three siblings. He is from Lebanon. He worked in a barber shop for six years and opened his own shop in 2008. In addition to his brother’s and father’s income, he is also considered to be an income provider for the family. He obtained a first Kiva loan and was an excellent client with punctual payments.

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to enlarge his business. He will buy more products and tools for his shop so he can satisfy his customers' needs and get higher revenue.

loans.use: To enlarge his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 45-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four young children who are attending school. He has worked as a freelance electrician for 30 years, depending on customer’s requests. He is the only income source for the family. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his daughter's university fees to avoid financial problems with the university’s management and let his daughter pursue her education contentedly.

loans.use: To pay his daughter's university fees

loans.name: Jeff

texts.es: Jeff, de 30 años, es un joven soltero y trabajador. Su familia lo conforman sus padres y su hermana, con quienes viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Como hombre joven, Jeff se dedica a la agricultura, en donde sus principales cultivos constan de café, fruto que es cultivado en sus 2 hectáreas de terrenos. Tiene 5 años dedicándose a ello y lo que más le gusta, es poder ayudar a sus padres a desarrollar los granos de café, ya que le heredaron parte de sus cultivos. “El secreto para obtener un buen grano, es dedicar mayor tiempo en el cuidado de las plantaciones”, afirma que entre sus planes es sembrar otras variedades de café. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Prestatarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde asegura podrá salir adelante en compañía de los socios de los integrantes de su asociación. Jeff, tiene viveros de café, por ello con el crédito que recibirá contratará peones, para que le ayuden en el proceso  de hacer hoyos para plantar café.
texts.en:
Jeff is 30 years old, single and a hard worker.  His family consists of his parents and his sister with whom he lives in their own home which is located in Unión Palomar community (in the central Peruvian jungle).  Jeff is a farmer and his main crop is coffee.  He sows this crop over two hectares of land.  Jeff has been in this business for 5 years and what he most enjoys is being able to help his parents grow their coffee beans since they left him part of their crops as an inheritance.  "The secret to obtaining a good coffee bean is committing a lot of time to looking after your plantations" he confirms.  Jeff's future plans include growing more varieties of coffee.

Jeff is a member of the "Prestetarios de la Unión" community bank and this is his first loan with MFP.  He assures us that he will be able to get ahead with his fellow bank members.  Jeff has coffee nurseries and he will use his loan to hire laborers who will help him to dig holes in which to plant his coffee.

loans.use: To hire laborers who will help him plant his coffee

loans.name: Ayishietu Maame

texts.en: Ayishietu Maame A. has been trading in food items, such as rice, palm oil and Fante kenkey (boiled maize dough), for 15 years. She works near Nyame Bekyere in Cape Coast. She is married to a driver and has three children. Ayishietu contributes to the education of her children. She is requesting a loan to add to her initial capital in order to expand her business. Her business plan is to add the sale of root vegetables to her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Marta

texts.en: Marta is currently in a business of selling greens and tomatoes. She is 30 years old and a widow with five children, all of whom go to school. Marta took out a loan to stock more greens and tomatoes to sell. In the future, she hopes to pay her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: To stock more greens and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en:
A. Ravshan lives in Instaravshan, Tajikistan. He has four minor children. His wife helps him in business. He is engaged in the cultivation of agricultural products such as wheat and potatoes and also cattle breeding. Ravshan has worked for more than five years in his business, earning profits and purchasing cattle. He would like to get a loan of US$2000 for purchasing cattle, promising to repay on time. Thanks in advance IMON and KIVA he says!

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson S. O. is fifty-six years old and married. His wife is a businesslady and they have five children aged between twenty-three years old and ten years old. His business is located at Bukura Shopping Centre in Kakamega. Kakamega is in the western region of Kenya. It is a rich agricultural area known for production of sugarcane and commonly known as the sugar belt region.

He sells kerosene and diesel to the local people. Besides these items he also supplies milk to the local people. He has been in business for five years now. Nelson says that this business is profitable, and the major challenge he has is financial constraints. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 to purchase more diesel and kerosene to resell. He hopes to grow his business and in the future purchase a plot of land where he will put up rental houses. He describes himself as a visionary man.

loans.use: to purchase diesel and kerosene for resale

loans.name: Santos Del Pilar

texts.es: Santos del Pilar es una mujer emprendedora, que disfruta de su medio de vida que es la venta de mercadería en general. A pesar que no ha sido fácil mantener su negocio, los deseos de salir y la experiencia en su trabajo ha realizado es lo que motiva a Santos continuar adelante. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de  prendas, calzado, perfumes, camisas, trajes de baño para la temporada de verano. Las metas que tiene son de seguir mejorar cada día más su actividad y al mismo tiempo incrementar su inventario.
texts.en: Santos del Pilar is an enterprising woman who enjoys her work selling general merchandise.  Although it has not been easy to maintain her business, her desire to get ahead and her work experience have motivated her to continue forward.  This loan is for the purchase of clothing, shoes, perfumes, shirts, and bathing suits for summer.  Her goals are to continue improving her business each day while increasing her inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, shirts, and bathing suits for summer.

loans.name: C4908 Isangano Group

texts.en:
Laurence is 36 years old and she is married.  She is the representative of a group called "Isangano" in the local language.  Laurence is the first person on the left in the picture.  She owns a small shop that sells soft drinks like traditional beer.  She has five year's of experience. 

Laurence and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more soft drinks like traditional beer. With the profits, they will build a comfortable house. They also needs a refrigerator which will allow them to sell cold soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks like traditional beer.

loans.name: Kongossigué Dit Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur Kongossigué dit Yacouba est un homme marié de 35 et père de 3 enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez son oncle à Bougouni dans le  quartier Niébala.
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école moderne, très vite il commença les activités génératrices de revenus. Pendant des années il a tenté plusieurs activités comme l’achat et la vente des céréales, mais sans succès. C’est ainsi qu’il décida d’apprendre auprès son ami, qui est vendeur de boutique au marché, cette activité d’achat et de vente d’articles divers.  Avec une expérience de 4 ans, il maîtrise son activité.
Pour le renforcement de ses activités, il décide de prendre un prêt avec Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des articles divers pour sa boutique. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso. Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée de la population locale.
 Avec ce prêt, il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 62 500 FCFA.Avec ce bénéfice il envisage agrandir sa boutique.
texts.en:
Mr. Kongossigué, who goes by Yacouba, is a married 35-year-old father of three.  He lives with his wife and children in the home of his uncle in Bougouni, in the Niébala neighborhood.  Without a secondary education, he started working very early.  Over the years he tried several businesses, such as buying and selling grain, but with no success.  He then decided to learn the business of small commerce from his friend who is a seller in a market boutique.  With four years’ experience, he has mastered the business.

To strengthen his business, he decided to take a loan with Soro Yiriwaso to buy various items for his store.  This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso.  He buys his supplies in Bamako (the capital of Mali).  His customers are local.  With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 62,500 FCFA, which he plans to use to enlarge his store.

loans.use: to buy various items for his store.

loans.name: Yousra

texts.ar: يسرى عمرها 30 سنة تعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والاولية لها في عملها 15 سنة تعمل بجد ونشاط وهي تعتمد على ذاتها في تكوين المستقبل وزيادة الدخل ورأس المال هي نشيطة ومحبة للعمل تريد من خلال المجموعة ان تؤمن مستقبل جيد من خلال تطوير عملها وذلك بشراء بضاعة جديدة موسمية مثلجات ومعلبات يتميز عملها بقربه من مناطق سكنية وقريبة الى اهل منطقتها وهي تتميز بالاسعار الجيدة والبضاعة الجديدة هي طموحة تحب ان تمتلك محل اكبر يضم الكثير من البضاعة التي تخولها ان تستوعب عدد اكبر من الزبائن وهي تسعى الى ان تممتلك منزل خاص بها من خلال تطوير عملها وتأمين مستقبل جيد لها وان تساعد اهلها في الحياة الاقتصادية الصعبة
texts.en: Yousra is 30 years old and works in a grocery store. She has been doing this for 15 years and is hard-working and enthusiastic. She depends on herself to increase her income, plan for the future and provide the necessary capital for the business. She loves her business and with this loan she wants to develop her business by purchasing new seasonal stock as well as frozen and canned produce. Her business is distinguished for its proximity to residential areas, for her good prices and up to date stock. She is ambitious and wants to own a larger store that can stock more goods and in turn attract a larger number of customers. She aspires to be able to have her own house, secure her future and and assist her family through their financial difficulties.

loans.use: to develop her business by purchasing new stock as well as frozen and canned produce.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Elsa; ella tiene 70 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en una empresa, ella ya es jubilada y en algunas ocasiones realiza ventas de artesanía en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, la socia quiere terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como cemento, arena y yeso.
                                                      
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Siempre Adelante (Always Moving Forward) Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Ollantaytambo in the province of Urubamba and department of Cusco.

The member is Elsa. She is 70 years old and is single. The member balances her daily life with the work of running a business. She is already retired and occasionally sells handicrafts in the district of Ollantaytambo. The member wants to finish construction on her house. The member requests this loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, and plaster.

The member is happy to receive this loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as cement, sand, and plaster

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 32 years old and is a married woman with 3 children aged 13, 8 and 6. Arlene’s husband works as a farmer.

Arlene is also a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. She has been growing rice for more than 10 years. Arlene earns enough money by doing this. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Arlene hopes to own a bigger farm and for her children to finish college.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Phenny

texts.en:
Phenny is a married woman with five school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 24 years, she has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and restaurant operators. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major goal is to expand and earn more profits from her business.

With the KSHS 40,000, she wants to purchase broilers and chicks for her poultry business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase broilers and chicks for her poultry business.

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.en:
Madeleine is a 33 year old Rwandan entrepreneur. She is married and has 2 children, 6 and 11 years old, both of whom are in school.  

For the past 2 years, Madeleine has been running a general store with her husband, selling goods such as sunflower oil, Vaseline, and shoes. This successful business has enabled her to improve the standard of living for herself and her family.

She will use this loan to purchase more goods to sell in her store so that she can continue to generate more profits to support her family. She plans to reinvest in her store so that it will continue to grow. She also hopes to earn enough profits in order to build a family house.

loans.use: To purchase good to sell.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama sells fruits, onions, tomatoes, and cassava at Elmina. She is a widow and has six children. She responsibly feeds, clothes, and educates her children. Her loan will be used to acquire different kinds of fruits to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to provide a meaningful education for their children.

loans.use: to acquire different kinds of fruits to resell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Doña Maria tiene su propio negocio, una pulperia con mas de veinti cuatro años, trabajando para ayudar  asus dos hijos, es madre soltera. Y comenzo con poco productos mas golosinas, luego comienza hacer prestamo en una financiera en donde comienza ah elevar su inventario.
Hoy en dia trabaja con prestamos en Afodenic, en donde lleva cinco ciclos, lo que han sido para aumentar las ventas. pues se consume mucho el grano basico el cual desea introducir mucho, pues todo ha incrementado ah altos costos, comprara tambien productos lacteos, cajillas de huevo, golosinas. Manteniendo a sus clientes sastifechos. Y logrando verder para cumplir con sus compromisos de pago.
texts.en:
María has had a business of her own, a grocery store, for over 24 years working to help her two children; she’s a single mother.  She started with just a few snack items and later started to take out loans at a financial institution to increase inventory.

At present, she works with Afodenic loans and has been in five cycles that have been used to increase sales.  Because basic grains are consumed quite a bit she wants to stock them in quantity because prices have increased.  She will also buy dairy products, flats of eggs and snacks to keep her customers satisfied to sell and be able to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Victory

texts.en:
To generate additional income, Victory has engaged in a hog-raising business in their village for almost eight years now. He is 35 and married, and has only one child. They live in a village where they plant and harvest rice and vegetables for sale. He wants to become financially stable so he can provide all his family needs, especially the education of their child. They want him to finish his studies and become a professional someday. 

Despite the hardships of life, they continue to work and strive to earn income and satisfy their needs. Due to financial difficulty, Victory is asking for a loan of 10,000 Philippines peso (P) to buy feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. He believes that with his patience and sacrifices, he can be able to make the business grow. He hopes that someday, he will put up a variety store for his wife to manage.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is 50 year old, married and has two children who are in school.

Felomina is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Felomina requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Felomina has been farming sugarcane for 12 years, and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felomina would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Aysha

texts.en:
Aysha is a 50-year-old woman. She is married and has four sons and three daughters. Some of her sons are Palestinian National Authority employees with decent salaries. 

Aysha lives in Dier Sharaf village near Nablus city in Palestine. She has a canteen to serve the university students. She wants to purchase greater varieties for sale but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. 

When Aysha gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will pay to purchase the variety she needs for the canteen to sell to university students. She will have a wider range of items for sale and increase her income and provide better living conditions for her family. Aysha is a conservative woman, so her son is photographed instead of her.

loans.use: To increase the range of goods she sells in the university canteen.

loans.name: Amalia Emiliana

texts.es: La Sra. Amalia es cliente nueva viene recomendada por sus padres ya que son nuestros,  ella vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona arenal  y se dedica a la venta de mantas tejida de lana de vicuña, polleras,  vestimenta para las señoras de polleras, las mantas de vicuñas cuestan de entre 3000, a 3500, bolivianos lleva a pueblos aledaños de la ciudad como ser Palca, Unni, Rio Abajo, también en la zona sur la Sra. Amalia entrega a crédito las mantas y recoge las cuotas semanalmente viajando a los pueblos donde le dejo a crédito y también trabaja de empleada domestica de lunes a viernes y los fines de semana viaja, ella se dedica a este negocio junto con una de sus hermanas. Amalia aun es soltera sin hijos el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería (mantas de lana de vicuña, polleras y enaguas) por que tiene una fuerte demanda en pedidos por ser mes festiva en la comunidad de Unni.
texts.en:
Amalia is a new client recommended by her parents who are also our clients. She lives in her parents' home in the Arenal zone and sells shawls woven from vicuna wool, plus the overskirts worn by some women. The vicuna shawls cost between 3,000 and 3,500 Bolivian pesos. Amalia sells them in towns surrounding the city, like Palca, Unni, and Rio Abajo, as well as in the southern zone.

Amalia delivers the shawls on credit and collects payments weekly, travelling to the towns where she offers credit. She also works as a domestic Mondays through Fridays, then on weekends conducts her business jointly with one of her sisters.

Amalia is still single and has no children. She will invest her loan in purchasing merchandise (shawls of vicuna wool, overskirts, and petticoats) because there is a strong demand, since this is the month of festivals in the community of Unni.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (shawls made of vicuna wool, overskirts, and petticoats) to sell.

loans.name: Essi

texts.fr:
Essi est une femme âgé(e) de 44ans. Elle est mariée å un technicien. Elle a 02 enfants.
Essi travaille comme revendeuse de condiments (tomates, piment, oignons) depuis 2003 au marché de NUKAFU. Elle achète à DJABLE (une localité située à quelques kilomètres de la ville de LOME).
Essi a requis son troisième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter d’augmenter son stock en achetant plus de condiments.. 
Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit aider son mari dans les charges de foyer  et assurer un avenir radieux à ses 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Essi is a 44-year-old woman who is married to a technician. She has two children. She has been working as a seller of condiments (tomatoes, chili peppers, onions) since 2003 at the NUKAFU market. She makes her purchases in DJABLE (a town located a few kilometers from the city of LOME). 

Essi has requested her third loan from WAGES to increase her stock by buying more condiments. She says that, with the profits, she plans on helping out her husband in covering household expenses and ensuring a shining future for her two children.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26-year-old single man who is living in his parents’ house. Since Mohammad has a good knowledge of computers and technology, he opened almost two years ago a small shop that has two sections: one is a café where he provides soft and hot drinks and sheesha (tobacco smoked in a pipe), and the other is an internet café.

Now Mohammad has applied for a loan to buy more assets for the shop and redecorate. In the future, he is planning to open each section of his shop in a separate place.

loans.use: to buy more assets for the shop and re-new its decoration
